loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old, and she has five children, all of whom are in school (e.g., one is studying nursing). Mary prepares and sells banku (a meal prepared from milled maize), plain rice, and vegetable sauce for the people of her community. However, she has to travel to nearby villages (such as Tema and Nkawkaw) in order to buy the various inputs that she uses to prepare food.

Accordingly, she is seeking a loan to buy more bags of rice, cartons of fish, chicken thighs, and vegetables to enable her expand her operation and to avoid increasing input prices.

She is a member of the group called “Eye Yehowa” (meaning, "it is God"). Group members agree in principle to guarantee each other to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To expand her business and to reduce transaction/transportation costs by purchasing additional food products (e.g., bags of rice, carton of fresh fish, chicken, maize, etc.) in bulk

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah M. prepares food for sale. She is married and has 7 dependents. Demand for her food has increased, and she wants to increase production.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more food supplies for her food production.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more food supplies for her food production

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married mother, and she has five children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling grocery products in her community for the past four years.

She is seeking a loan because she wants to increase her inventory; specifically, she plans to buy more products such as diapers, sanitary pads, soap, tin fish, evaporated milk, cocoa powder, crates of soft drinks, and bottled water.

She is a member of the group called “Eye Yehowa” (meaning, "it is God"). Group members agree in principle to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To expand her store's inventory by purchasing additional grocery products (e.g., tin fish, evaporated milk, cocoa powder, soft drinks, bottled water, etc.)

loans.name: Sabina's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Sabina is 33 years old and married. She has 4 children between the ages of 1 and 13. Sabina started selling clothes in 1998. She works from 8am to 8pm every day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of $140 from her sales.

Sabina has applied for this loan in order to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Maria, who also has a business in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in a successful shop

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu I. sells rice and beans. She is married and has 3 children. Demand for her goods has increased, and she wants to increase sales.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 50 years old and married with 2 children, ages 15 and 7. She started selling charcoal in 1984. Asha works from 7am to 7pm every day and earns a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She has applied for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Celina's Raha Group

texts.en:
Celina is 31 years old and married. She and her husband take care of 2 people, ages 22 and 20. Celina started catering in 2000. She works from 7am to 6pm every day and earns a monthly profit of approximately $550 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to open a new business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Veronica, Pili, Asha and Zainabu who have businesses dealing in food vending, charcoal sales and a salon.

loans.use: To open a new business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a married woman, and she has six children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling kenkey (a meal prepared from milled maize) and fried fish for the past eight years.

She is seeking a loan to buy more bags of maize, cartons of fish, firewood, gallons of vegetable oil, and vegetables to expand her business and to avoid increasing prices with respect to the aforementioned products. Further, she hopes that this loan will allow her to start to save money, which would in turn be applied to her children's school fees.

She is a member of the group called "Gyina Pintin" (meaning, "Stand Firm"). Members agree in principle to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional products (e.g., maize, fish, firewood, vegetable oil, vegetables, etc.) in bulk to expand her business and to avoid potential price hikes on such products

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 45628

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 55-year-old, married woman with five children. She has been selling varieties of scarves in her town for twelve years now, though she has to travel to Kumasi to buy the products that she sells. Scarves are very important to Ghanaian women because not only are they used for daily dress, but they also signify beauty and maturity; as a result, there is always a ready market for scarves.

Lucy is seeking a loan to buy more bales of the scarves from Kumasi in order to cut down on the number of times she has to travel there to purchase her products, especially in light of the fact that transportation costs are continually on the rise. She is a member of the group called “Eye Yehowa” (meaning, "it is God"). In principle, the members of her group agree to guarantee each other as a form of social collateral in connection with the repayment of their loans.

loans.use: To purchase bales of scarves in bulk to reduce transportation costs.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 38 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 20, 17, 10 and 7. Sabina owns a small stock of poultry, which she started in 2004. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $450 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her poultry and to open a new shop.

loans.use: To buy more food for her poultry and to open a new shop.

loans.name: Rose's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Rose is 27 years old and is married. Rose owns a small shop and she is a clothes seller, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Halima and Mwanaid, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 32 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 13 and 9 years old. She and her husband also take care of 4 other children. Anna owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items (beer and soda) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items (soda and beer) for her business.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 25 years old and is married with 1 child, 3 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 10 years old. Frida is a cosmetics seller, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cosmetics items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics items for her business and to open new business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 41 years old and is married with 6 children, ages 9 to 19. Mariam owns a small cafe, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (chairs, tables, snacks and drinks) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items (chairs, tables, snacks and drinks) for her business

loans.name: Neema's Imani Group

texts.en:
Neema is 29 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 8 and 3 years old. Neema is a clothes seller; she started in 2005. Every day she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in fish sales, food vending and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ritta

texts.en:
Ritta W. is married and has four children. She sells spare parts but is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. is a baker and sells bread. She is married and has three children. She needs money to invest in her business because the price of flour has gone up.

She is asking for $125 as additional capital to buy more materials for her bakery.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her bakery

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena is a father with four children and also a married man. Two of his children are currently in school. Brand new shoes are very expensive to buy in Ghana and therefore majority of Ghanaians prefer to buy second-hand (used) shoes. Kwabena is thirty-nine years old and he has been selling used shoes for the past twenty-two years in the Eastern Region.

He wants to use his new loan to buy more shoes to meet the high demand for them. He is a member of the group called “Gye Nyame” (meaning Only God). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: Željka

texts.en:
Željka is 37 years old and married with two children, 10- and 12-years-old. They are from the town Derventa. Her husband works and earns about 750 KM monthly.

Željka sews and she has an old machine for sewing. Željka will use this loan of 1200 KM to buy parts for her machine and material for sewing. She hopes to improve business and increase her income for her household.

loans.use: To buy machine parts and material.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Christina N., who is married and has two children, aged 5 and 10. Christina established her clothing and cosmetics business in 2005. Working six days a week, and eight hours a day, she earns about $40 every month from this business. Christina has already received and repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to expand her range of clothing and cosmetics. In the future, Christina plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Modesta K., who is married and has three children aged 10, 15, and 18. She has one other dependent living with her because his parents died of HIV/AIDS.  In 1998, Modesta established her farming business. Working six days a week, and five to eight hours a day, she earns about $50 every month from this business. This entrepreneur now requires a loan in order to purchase inputs and equipment to grow more crops. In the future, Modesta plans to diversify her business and employ staff. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional inputs and equipment in order to grow more crops.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Mrs. Wilma devotes herself to the art of making fine linens for decorating bridal showers, Sweet Fifteen parties, graduations, etc. She has spent the greater part of her life at this art. Wilma is a widow, and she is responsible for moving her family and her home forward, all based on the income that her handiwork brings in. This woman is very responsible and enterprising. In all the time she's been with us, she has never had a problem making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Wilma es una señora que se dedica al arte de la manteleria (Adornar las fiestas de matrimonio, quinceaños, graduaciones, etc), ella ha trabajado la mayor parte de su vida en este arte. Doña Wilma es viuda, tiene la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a su familia y su casa, todo basado en los ingresos que le genera su arte con sus manos. La Señora es muy responsable y emprendedora, todo el tiempo que ha trabajado con nosotros, no ha presentado ningun problema en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase materials to give classes in the art of linen-making

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena was born in 1958 and is married. She lives in the town of Derventa with her husband and three children. Both of them have a pension of 550 KM.

Milena will use this loan of 1,200 KM to buy parts for the computer. She uses her computer to keep books for a few companies and she wants to provide more efficient service so that she can earn more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy parts for the computer.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is married and has four children. She prepares food for sale. Business is doing very well and she wants to increase production.

She is asking for $125 as additional capital to buy food supplies for her food production.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for her food production

loans.name: Bupe

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Bupe M., a single woman with no children.   In 1997, she established her rice farming business. Bupe has already received and repaid three loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase inputs and equipment to grow more crops. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase inputs and equipment to increase the yield of her rice crops.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. is married and has two children. She sells charcoal, but her profit has been affected because the price of charcoal has gone up.

She is asking for $75 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Sophia W., who is married and has three children aged 12, 17, and 20.  She also has two other dependents living with her because they are her sister's children.  In 2005, Sophia established her rice and maize farming business, and now requires a loan in order to purchase inputs and equipment to grow more crops. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase inputs and equipment for her rice and maize farming.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Eliza M., who is single with one child, aged seven. She also has two other dependents, her nephews, who live with her.   Eliza established her clothing business in 2004, and now requests a loan in order to expand her range of clothing.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is married and has three children. She sells clothing, towels, and other fabrics. She wants to increase her sales to meet the demands of her customers.

She is asking for $125 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Alesi

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Alesi N., who is married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 14. In 2000, Alesi established her farming business. She now requires a loan in order to purchase inputs and equipment to grow more crops. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase inputs and equipment for her maize farm.

loans.name: Hebert

texts.es:
Mr. Hebert is a very humble person who repairs cars, especially changing tires and selling tire lubricants. He is a mechanic. He has worked in this business for many years; his work is well known and sought after. He and his wife have put forth a lot of effort to make this business and their family get ahead. Today, he needs more financing in order to purchase more lubricants and auto oil since the quantity of cars that transit the area is very large and promising. Finally, as a client of ours, Mr. Hebert has demonstrated a lot of responsibility and commitment with himself and others; this can be seen in the excellent credit history he maintains.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Hebert es una persona muy humilde que se dedica a reparar automoviles, en especial el cambio de llantas y la venta de lubricantes para los mismos, Él es mecanico. Trabaja en este negocio hace muchos años, su trabajo es muy bien conocido y solicitado, Él junto a su esposa, se han esforzado bastante para sacar este negocio y su familia adelante. Ahora necesita de mas financiamiento para poder comprar mas lubricantes y Aceite para automoviles ya que la cantidad de automoviles que transitan por la zona es muy grande y prometedora. Por ultimo, el Señor Hebert como cliente nuestro ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad y compromiso consigo mismo y con los demas, esto se puede ver en el excelente historial que tiene.

loans.use: Will purchase oil for his business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha E. is married and has three children. She owns a provision store and is running out of stock.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce Y. prepares food for sale. She is married and has three children. Because the number of her customers is increasing considerably, her current production cannot meet the demand.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to buy more food supplies for her food production.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for food production

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. prepares food for sale. She is married and has two children. Her business is doing very well and she wants to increase production.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to buy food supplies for her food production.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for her food production

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr:
Born July 1, 1956 in Allada, in the south of Benin, Mrs. Odette C. is the mother of nine children. She sells religious and holy objects such as statues of Mary, Jesus and the saints in front of the Sacre Coeur Catholic church in Cotonou, located along the interstate road linking Cotonou to Porto Novo. Many people attend the church every day, and particularly on Sundays during mass and on days of remembrance. On average, Mrs. Odette C. sells 15,000 CFA francs worth of goods each day. Currently, she is facing difficulties in buying supplies from neighboring countries. To do so, she is requesting this loan in order to meet the ever-growing demand of her customers. She is a woman of excellent character who is also one of our best clients.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 01 juillet 1956 à ALLADA dans le sud du BENIN, dame C. Odette est mère de 9 enfants. Dame C. Odette vend des objets religieux et pieux tels que les statuts de Marie, de Jésus et d'autres saints devant la grande église catholique SACRE CŒUR de COTONOU située sur la route inter état reliant la ville de COTONOU à celle de PORTO NOVO. L’affluence est grande tous les jours surtout les dimanches lors des messes et les jours de recueillement. Dame C. Odette réalise en moyenne un chiffre d’affaire journalier de 15 000 francs. Actuellement elle éprouve des difficultés pour s’approvisionner dans les pays faisant frontière avec le nôtre. Pour cela, elle sollicite ce crédit afin de satisfaire la demande qui ne cesse de croître chaque jour. Elle est d'une bonne moralité et fait partie de nos meilleurs clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 50 religious prints, 20 statues and rosaries

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. sells fruit. She is married and has four children. Her business is doing very well and she wants to increase her sales.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es:
Porfiria Sandoaval is married and has 3 children aged 8, 15 and 18 years. Her husband is a welder. She started her business in shoe sales through a catalogue to cover her expenses and economic necessities following her husband's accident.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $775 that will be repaid in a term of 8 months, to purchase merchandise. With your help Porfiria will continue to enjoy her success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Porfiria S. es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 8,15 y 18 años. Su esposo trabaja como soldador. Inició el negocio de ventas de zapatos por catalogo para solventar pagos y necesidades económicas por motivo de un accidente que sufrió su esposo.

Solicita un crédito por US $775 que pagara en 8 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Porfiria seguirá prosperando

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Augusta S., who is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 31. In 2007, Augusta established her fish business. She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of a small local fish called dagaa (similar to anchovies). She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of a small local fish called dagaa (similar to anchovies), for resale at market.

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es:
Maria Otilia started her business to cover her own needs and she was motivated by lack of employment. She needed to support her children economically and to cover the house-hold expenses. She started selling shoes through a catalogue 5 eyars ago and it has all worked out quite well.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $775 that will be repaid in a term of 8 months, to purchase merchandise. With your help Otilia will keep enjoying her success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Otilia inició el negocio para solventar sus necesidades por motivo de desempleo necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos económicamente y apoyar en gastos de casa. Comenzó con a venta de zapatos por catalogo hace 5 años y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien.

Solicita un crédito por US $775 que pagara en 8 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Otilia seguirá prosperando

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Tumaini K., who is married and has one child, aged 7. She also has two other dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 2002, Tumaini established her pharmacy business. Working seven days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, assisted by her one employee, she earns about $170 every month from this business.

Tumaini has already received and repaid four loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to add to her inventory of medicines. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $87. In the future, Tumaini plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add to the inventory of medicines at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Angeles is married and has 6 children aged 20, 22, 24, 28, 30 and 32. She started her business so that she could contribute towards the household expenses given that hers is a large family and given that her husband was unemployed. It was 5 years ago that she started selling home-cooked meals, tacos and hamburgers to local workers and the public at large.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $975 that will be repaid in a term of 6 months to replenish her business and to keep it growing. With your help Mari will continue to enjoy success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María de los Ángeles es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 20, 22, 24, 28,30 y32. inició el negocio para contribuir con el gasto de casa ya que tiene una familia numerosa y su esposo estaba desempleado, comenzó hace 5 años con la venta de comidas caseras, tacos hamburguesas, comidas a trabajadores y publico en general

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para resurtir su negocio y seguir desarrollándolo. Con tu ayuda Mari saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Suzana M., who is married and has three children aged 4, 12, and 14. She has another dependent, her niece, living with her as well. In 2007, Suzana established her textiles business. Working six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, and assisted by her niece, she earns about $60 every month.

Suzana has already received and repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of traditional cloth. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $43. In the future, Suzana plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa E. sells fruit. She is married and has three children. Her business is doing very well and she wants to increase her sales.

She is asking for $125 as additional capital to buy more fruit for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Elena L. lives in her own home, in the Llojeta lader West zone in the city of La Paz with her husband, Mr. Gregorio Vargas and their two children. Mrs. Elena dedicates herself to the decoration of large pillow cushions that she sells to the merchants in the market and her husband is a building worker in private constructions. With previous loans, found through Kiva, she was able to purchase fabric for the decoration of the pillow cases, increasing her capital. The loan that she is soliciting will be invested in the construction of a new room in her home that will be a bedroom for her younger son. This is the sixth time she has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies her and to be granted the loan. Her previous loans have been completely paid back to Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elena L. vive en casa propia, en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Gregorio Vargas y dos de sus hijos. La señora Elena se dedica a la elaboración de fundas de almohadones, que vende a los comerciantes de mercados, y su esposo es albañil en construcciones privadas. Con el anterior crédito, conseguido a través de Kiva, pudo comprar tela para la elaboración de las fundas, aumentando su capital de trabajo. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación nueva en su vivienda, que será el dormitorio de su hijo menor. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. El crédito anterior ha sido cancelado a Kiva en su totalidad.

loans.use: The construction of a new room in her home that will be a bedroom for her younger son.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. sells used clothing. She is married and has three children. Business is doing well and she wants to increase sales.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Mrs. Lorena is 24 years old; she is a single mother and lives in a rented room in the city of La Paz. The business she is in is makeup sales. This was the only source of income she has for herself and her young son, who still goes to school. Today, she would like to expand her market and also sell clothes to her clients, making her dues payable in installments. As far as her payment history, she has demonstrated being a very responsible person; since she began with her loan with our institution, she has not presented any problem making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Lorena tiene 24 años, es madre soltera y vive en una Habitacion alquilada en la Ciudad de La Paz. El negocio al que ella se dedica es el de la venta de cosméticos, esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que tiene para ella y para su pequeño hijo que aun va a la escuela. Ahora ella pretende ampliar su mercado y tambien vender ropa a sus clientes, haciendo que sus pagos sean a plazos. En cuanto a su historial de pago, demostró ser una persona muy responsable, ya que desde que inicio su crédito con nuestra institucion no ha presentado ningun problema en sus pagos.

loans.use: Will purchase clothing to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en:
Helina A. sells used clothing. She is a single parent with three children. Her business is doing well and she wants to increase sales.

She is asking for $425 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is the 25-year-old mother of two school-age children who lives in the town of Nyamasaria Kisumu, Kenya. She is also the proprietor of a food kiosk which she opened in 2004. The business is located along the busy Kisumu -Nairobi highway. Every day, she serves over 500 customers and takes in over Kshs 8000 ($129) in revenue. She has applied for a $700 loan to move her business to a larger space to accommodate increased demand from her clients.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To move her business to a larger space.

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Zabibu R., who is married and has three children aged 8, 12 and 15. In 2000, she established her general store business. Zabibu has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks, such as rice, oil, and soap, in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock, such as rice, oil, and soap, in bulk.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Mr. Reynaldo lives in the house of his parents in the Pisiga Street of the Alto Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz; he has a minibus which he uses to work as public transportation: in the mornings he works with a high school as a school bus. The loan he requests is to better the condition of the mobility of the bus which is an essential requirement to be able to transport children to school. His previous loan history is good and qualifies him to obtain new loans. He has been a client of IMPRO since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Reynaldo vive en casa de sus padres en la calle pisiga de la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene un minibús con el cual trabaja como transporte publico: por las mañanas trabaja con un colegio atendiendo como bus escolar. El crédito que solicita es para mejorar las condiciones de la movilidad ya que es un requisito indispensable para poder transportar niños a las escuelas. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.

loans.use: For the maintenance of his bus so that he can transport children to school.

loans.name: Frederic Segla

texts.en:
Frederic Segla H. is married and has five dependents. He is a provisions distributor and is running out of stock.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Veronica S., who is married and has two children, aged 5 and 8. In 1999, Veronica established her grains business and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, maize, and cocoa in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of maize, rice, and cocoa.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 23-year-old entrepreneur who lives in the town of Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and child. She runs a shop that opened in 2000 and sells basic commodities such bread, flour, cooking oil, sugar, Kerosene, milk and soap. She has applied for a loan of $800 to increase her supply of items in high-demand among her customers.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To increase her supply of items for sale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, 55, sells many different items ranging from kitchen products (such as saucepans) to home decoration products (such as curtains). He sells his products door-to-door and travels by motorbike.

His business has been very successful and he has so many customers that he cannot keep up with demand on his own. As a result, he employs poor people from his neighborhood to help him sell things. He enjoys serving his community and because people in town know that he is a generous person they also want to support him. Consequently, people are more likely to buy his products.

Juan is married to Claudia Penayo. They have three children: two go to college and the youngest is in high school. Juan’s dream is to see his children earn a Bachelor’s degree so they will be well-prepared for the future.

Juan has applied for this loan to buy more products to sell, such as sheets, saucepans, and curtains.

loans.use: To buy sheets, saucepans, curtains and other products

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Mr. Hernan C. lives in his own home in the Rosa Pampa zone of the city of El Alto with his wife, Mrs. Susana Gonzalez and their son. Mr. Hernan is a mechanic and works as an employee in a business in the city of La Paz and his wife is an employee in a store that sells eggs in the same city. With a past loan he was able to construct a renovation of 4 rooms that make up a single-family dwelling. This is the second occasion he has solicited a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies him favorably for the loan. He has been a client of IMPRO since March of 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Hernán C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Rosas Pampa de la Ciudad de El Alto con su esposa, la señora Susana González y su hijo. El señor Hernán es mecánico y trabaja como empleado de una empresa de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa es empleada en una tienda de venta de huevos en la misma ciudad. Con un crédito anterior realizaron la construcción en obra gruesa de cuatro habitaciones que conforman una vivienda unifamiliar. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión de la construcción de la vivienda. Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde Marzo de 2007.

loans.use: For final renovations to his house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Magreth L.. Married, but with no children, in 2007 Magreth established her small retail business. She now requires a loan to purchase in bulk additional stock, such as candy, biscuits, and soap. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional bulk stocks of products such as candy, biscuits, and soap.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Grace N.. Married and the mother of three children aged 5, 9, and 12, Grace established her beauty salon business in 2006, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional haircare products and accessories. She thanks you for your support.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of haircare products and accessories.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Mr. Agustin lives in the area of Cotahuma, which is one of the poorest areas of the city of La Paz. Mr. Agustin is a man who is very committed to himself. Before, he used to sell electric appliances, until he decided to obtain a loan from our institution. With the loan that was awarded to him, and with a lot of work, he was able to buy a taxi cab. With it, he works as of very early hours in the morning in order to bring home a bit more earnings to his home. He still keeps up with his job selling appliances, and that is precisely why he needs more financing- to be able to reach his goals and invest in the maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Agustin vive en la Zona de Cotahuma que es una de las zonas mas pobres de la Ciudad de la Paz El señor Agustin es un señor muy comprometido consigo mismo, antes Él se dedicaba a vender aparatos electrodomesticos, hasta que decidio obtener un crédito en nuestra institucion. Con el crédito que se le otorgo y con mucho trabajo logró comprarse un taxi, con el que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana para poder llevar un poco mas de ingresos a su casa El mantiene el trabajo de vendedor de artefactos eletrodomesticos, y es justamente esta razon por la que necesita de mas financiamiento para poder llevar a cabo sus metas, ademas invertira en el mantenimiento de su vehiculo.

loans.use: Will purchase appliances to sell and will give maintenance to his taxi

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is married and has four children. She sells used clothing. Business is going well and she wants to increase sales.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Faudhia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Faudhia N., who has three children aged 5, 9, and 14. In 2006, Faudhia established her clothing business. Working seven days a week, five to eight hours a day, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $130 every month.

Faudhia has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of traditional cloth and sarongs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $50. In the future, Faudhia plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional cloth and sarongs.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma has a place where she sells candies, cookies and other things and her husband is retired. She has one daughter who is studying at the University and the place allows her to earn an income and support her family. Her home is located in the zone of Llojeta bajo in the city of La Paz and her place is located in the San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz. This is the third time that she has requested a loan, her history qualifies her as client 1 which means that she has been good at repaying her loans. The loan that she requests now will be used to supplement her capital (to purchase sweets, drinks, Kleenex, and other things) to offer her clients. Her work and experience have given her the opportunity to access this loan, furthermore the analysis of her fluid cash shows her ability to repay the loan in the stipulated terms.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma tiene un puesto donde vende dulces, refrescos galletas y otros y su esposo es jubilado. Tiene una hija en que esta en la universidad y el puesto le ayuda para generar ingresos y aportar en su familia. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Llojeta bajo de la ciudad de La Paz y su puesto esta ubicado en la zona de san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Tercera vez que solicita un crédito, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago se su obligación. El crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado para aumentar su capital ( Compra de dulces, refrescos, clinex, y otros) para ofrecer a su clientela. Su trabajo y la experiencia le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito, además de que el análisis de su flujo de caja demuestra su habilidad para repagar la deuda en los plazos estipulados.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise - sweets, drinks, kleenex, etc. for her grovery store.

loans.name: Rozi

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Rozi M., who is married and has one child, aged 5. She has one other dependent, her nephew, living with her. Rozi owns a used clothing business and now requires a loan to purchase additional stocks of used clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything western or modern. While there are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa N. is married and has two children. She sells used clothing. Business is going well and she wants to increase sales.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Sivela

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Sivela K., who is married and has four children aged between 9 and 20. In 2005, Sivela established her poultry business. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional chicks, feeders, and grain. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all that time and space will permit.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks, feeders, and grain.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is married and has seven dependents. She sells food supplies. Business is going very well and she plans to increase sales.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food supplies to sell

loans.name: Effia

texts.en:
Effia B. is married and has six dependents. She prepares palm oil for sale. She wants to buy more raw materials to increase production.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to enable her buy more raw materials for oil production and sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more raw materials for palm oil production and sale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel J., a teacher, is 45 years old and the single mother of a 16-year old girl. They live in the Manuel Fernandez neighborhood. Her aim is to give her only daughter a brighter future, providing for her a quality education so she can survive well throughout life. Mrs. Maribel seeks a loan to build a porch and thus provide more security for her home since it is empty all day long while she works and her daughter is at school.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La maestra Maribel J. de 45 años es madre soltera de una jovencita de 16 años quien reside en el barrio Manuel Fernandez quien tiene como objetivo en la vida darle a su unica hija un mejor futuro, dandole la mejor educacion para que pueda defenderse en la vida. Doña Maribel solicita el prestamo para construir un porche y darle seguridad a su hogar ya que permanece solo todo el dia mientras rtrabaja y su hija anda en clases.

loans.use: To build a porch on the home for added security.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is forty-three years old and the mother of five children. All her children are in school now. She sells cosmetics like face powder, body creams, deodorants, and necklaces, earrings, etc. Csmetics are very useful in the everyday life of the Ghanaian as they go to reduce bad body odour and sweat. Therefore, the demand for such products is high. Mercy wants to use her new loan to buy more products like face powder, deodorants, bangles, necklaces, earrings, etc. This will help her raise income to support her family and pay the children’s school fees.

Mercy is a member of the group called “Gye Nyame” (meaning Only God). Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more costume jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth W. is married and has three children. She owns a provision store but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Erenia Margarita

texts.es:
Erenia Margarita is an enterprising 21-year old young woman who is single and dreams of enlarging her business which she started 3 years ago. She offers home appliances, cell phone accessories, etc. for sale, and works hard at this endeavor so she can improve her living conditions. She seeks a loan so she can buy more merchandise to better supply her business and to provide an enhanced level of service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Erenia Margarita es una joven muy emprendedora con sus 21 años de edad, soltera sueña con tener un negocio grande el cual tiene iniciado desde hace 3 años ofreciendo electrodomesticos, accesorios de celular etc, en el cual trabaja duro para poder mejorar las condiciones en su casa, solicitando el credito para comprar mas productos y acondicionar mejor su negocio y brindarle mejor atencion a los clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of product and improvement of her business.

loans.name: Catalina's Group

texts.es:
Karina, Suly y Catalina have been members of Banco Comunal Perla for 6 months, 1 year and 1 year respectively.

Karina lives with her partner, she is 25 years old and has one child. Karina has some land together with her parents in the Huanta province where she cultivates avocado pears. She also purchases these from other local producers. She sells her produce at the groceries market in Lima. Karina also sells clothes on credit terms to workers from institutions.

Then there is Suly, who is separated, is 24 years old and has a three-year-old daughter. Suly sells grain wholesale and also in small quantities at the Nery García market.

While Catalina is married, she is 49 years old with 6 children. Catalina travels to the market where she sells clothes, and also works Mondays to Fridays as a street trader, selling 'chicha' (a corn liquor).

Karina, Suly and Catalina need a combined loan of $875, which will be invested in the purchase of avocado pears, wheat, barley, corn, skirts, aprons and sweaters.

Karina, Suly and Catalina have three dreams: that their children have the chance to study, to be wholesalers, and that their businesses grow and prosper.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Karina, Suly y Catalina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Perla hace 6 meses, 1 año, 1 año respectivamente.

Karina es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Karina junto a sus padres tienen tierras en la provincia D. Huanta donD. produce paltas y también compra paltas D. los productores D. su zona, sus ventas lo realiza en la ciudad D. Lima a los mercados D. abastos. Además Karina venD. ropa a crédito a trabajadores D. instituciones.

Por otro lado Suly es separada, tiene 24 años y 1 hija D. 3 años, Suly venD. cereales al por mayor y menor en un puesto del mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Catalina es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Catalina viaja a las ferias donD. venD. ropa. Además Catalina venD. chicha D. lunes a viernes D. manera ambulatoria.

Karina, Suly y Catalina necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1200 soles, 450 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. palta, trigo, cebada, maíz, falda, mandiles y chompas.

Los sueños D. Karina, Suly y Catalina son que sus hijos estudien, ser mayorista y su negocio prospere.

loans.use: Karina, Suly and Catalina need a loan of $875 to invest in the purchase of avocado pears, wheat, barley, corn, skirts, aprons and sweaters.

loans.name: Adjowah

texts.en:
A. Adjowah is married and has three children. She sells clothing and shoes but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Felicitas' Group

texts.es:
Elsa, Nancia and Felicitas have been members of the Banco Comunal Tambillo for one year. They come from the Tambillo district which is situated one hour from the city of Ayacucho. They are all employed in the production of grain and root vegetables.

Elsa is a single mother, is 31 years old and has 4 children. She sells food from home and offers rooms to workers from the institutions. With this loan she plans to open a small grocery store.

Then there is Nancia. She is married, is 36 years old and has 5 children. Nancia works raising small farm animals such as guinea-pigs, hens and pigs. She sells her produce at her local market.

Felicitas lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has 4 children. Felicitas has a shop where she sells groceries, fruit and meat. She also has a bakery where she produces bread that is characteristic of her area.

Elsa, Nancia and Felicitas need a combined loan of $850 to invest in rice, sugar, noodles, milk, hens, pork, oil and wheat.

Elsa, Nancia and Felicitas have three dreams - to provide a future for their children, that their businesses prosper and to have a large shop.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa, Nancia y Felicitas, pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tambillo hace 1 año, ellas son del distrito de Tambillo que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Todas ellas se dedican a la agricultura de cereales y tubérculos.

Elsa es madre soltera, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, Elsa vende comida en su casa, da pensión a los trabajadores de las instituciones, con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.

Por otro lado Nancia es casada, tiene 36 años y 5 hijos, Nancia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuy, gallina, cerdo, sus ventas lo realiza en la feria de su Distrito.

Mientras que Felicitas es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Felicitas tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carne. Además Felicitas tiene una panadería donde elabora panes típicos de la zona.

Elsa, Nancia y Felicitas necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche, gallina, cerdo, aceite y trigo.

Los sueños de Elsa, Nancia y Felicitas son sacar adelante a sus hijos, que sus negocios mejoren y tener una tienda grande.

loans.use: Elsa, Nancia and Felicitas need a combined loan of $850 to invest in rice, sugar, noodles, milk, hens, pork, oil and wheat.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence prepares and sells plain rice with either tomato or bean sauce to school children. She also garnishes her dishes with vegetables like carrots, cabbage, cucumbers, etc to make them more appetizing. She is a married woman with two children. The children are in school now.

She wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, gallons of vegetable oil, and vegetables to expand her operation. She hopes to start saving to be able to pay for the children’s education.

Florence is a member of the group called “Gye Nyame” (meaning Only God). Group members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans, vegetables, and gallons of vegetable oil

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.es:
Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin have been members of Banco Comunal Tambillo for 1 year. They come from the Tambillo dsitrict which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho.

Anatolia lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has 2 children. She has a small grocery shop in her home.

Then there is Norma, who is married, is 30 years old and has 2 children. Norma has a shop where she sells groceries, fruit and vegetables. She is also involved in agricultural work and in raising guinea-pigs.

Yasmin lives with her partner, is 25 years old and has 1 daughter. She sells second-hand clothes donated by her friends and family. She also sells food and toys at the Sunday market in San Juan Bautista.

Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin need this combined loan of $850 to invest in the purchase of rice, oil, vegetables, fruit, shoe polish, toothpaste, cooking pots and plates.

Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin have four dreams - to build a house, to open a shop in their house, that their business grows, and that their children become successful in their work.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Anatolia, Norma y Yasmin pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tambillo hace 1 año, ellas son del distrito de Tambillo que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Anatolia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Anatolia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Norma es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Norma tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas. Además Norma se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y la agricultura.

Mientras que Yasmin es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Yasmin vende ropa a pedido a personas conocidas, familiares. Además Yasmin vende comida y jugos en la feria dominical de San Juan Bautista.

Anatolia, Norma y Yasmin necesitan préstamos de 450 soles, 900 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, verduras, frutas, betún, crema dental, ollas, platos.

Los sueños de Anatolia, Norma y Yasmin son construir una casa, abrir una tienda en su casa, surtir su negocio y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin need this combined loan of $850 to invest in the purchase of rice, oil, vegetables, fruit, shoe polish, toothpaste, cooking pots and plates.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma has been a member of Banco Comunal Tambillo for 2 years. She lives in the Tambillos district which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho.

Vilma is married, is 40 years old and has 5 children. Together with her husband she purchases small farm animals and cattle from various local markets to sell at the market in San Juan Bautista. She also raises guinea-pigs, has 10 storehouses and she sells her produce from her own home. In additiona, she cultivates grain and root vegetables.

Vilma needs a loan of $750 to invest in the purchase of pigs, sheep and cattle.

Vilma has two dreams - that her business grows and that her children get a good education.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Tambillo hace 2 años, Vilma vive en el distrito D. Tambillos que queda a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Vilma es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Vilma junto a su esposo compran animales menores y vacuno D. las diferentes ferias D. la región, para luego comercializarlos en la feria D. San Juan Bautista. Además Vilma se dedica a la crianza D. cuyes, tiene 10 galpones, sus ventas lo realiza en su misma casa. También se dedica a la agricultura D. tubérculos y cereales.

Vilma necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerdo, oveja y ganado vacuno.

Los sueños D. Vilma es que su negocio crezca y sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: Vilma needs a loan of to invest in the purchase of pigs, sheep and cattle.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45696

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es:
Maria has been a teacher for 14 years and lives in the Angeles colony in the rural zone, 6km from Nueva Guinea. She’s currently studying to get her teaching degree. With the help of her farmer husband, she’s raising 3 children. Her dreams for her children are that they get a better education and that she is able to provide them with the best living conditions.

Every day Maria rides horseback for 2 hours, showing her enthusiasm for and dedication to teaching the peasant children.

She’s soliciting a loan to improve the conditions of her home, whitewashing walls and putting down a floor.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria se desempeña como docente desde hace 14 años, vive en la colonia los angeles zona rural a 6 km de Nueva Guinea, actualmente esta estudiando para obtener titulo de magisterio , con la ayuda de su marido que es agricultor estan criando a sus 3 hijos ,su deseo es que sus hijos tengan una mejor educacion y proporcionarle las mejores condiciones.

Todos los dias maria viaja a caballo a 2 horas de distancia demostrando su entusiasmo y dedicacion de enseñar a los niños campesinos.

Solicita el prestamo para mejorar las condicones en su vivienda repellando paredes y colocando piso.

loans.use: To improve her home by whitewashing walls and putting down a floor.

loans.name: Assana

texts.en:
Assana A. is married and has four children. She owns a provision store but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel lives in his own home with his son on Guillermo Killman Street in the zone of Alto Chijini in the city of La Paz; he works as a policeman but since his income is low he also works as a taxi driver using his car and this supplements his income so that he can improve his standard of living; the loan that he requests will be used to repair his taxi, to change the tires and battery so that he can work with regularity and keep up his income level. His previous history is good and he qualifies to obtain a new loan. Samuel has been our client since 2000.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Samuel vive en casa propia con su hijo en la calle Guillermo Killman de la zona de Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en la policía pero como sus ingresos son mínimos trabaja con su auto como taxi de transporte publico con lo cual aumenta sus ingresos y puede mejorar su nivel de vida; el crédito que solicita es para reparar su taxi cambiar llantas, batería y oros para que pueda trabajar con normalidad y seguir manteniendo su nivel de ingresos. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Samuel es nuestro cliente desde el año 2000.

loans.use: To maintain his taxi, change the tires, the battery, cables and fluids.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Mrs. Marina lives in her own home with her husband and children on Manuel Jofre Street in the zone of Tacagua in the city of La Paz; she works in an institution where they sell natural medicines and at the same time she has a grocery store that she tends for her mother. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of more merchandise that will help her improve her store and offer a better variety to her clients and generate more income. Her previous history is good and she qualifies for new loans. Marina has been a client of IMPRO since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marina vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle Manuel Jofre de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja en una institución donde vende productos naturales medicinales y a la vez tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual es atendida por su madre. El crédito que solicita es para comprar más mercadería y poder surtir mejor su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y así poder generar mejores ingresos. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Marina es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Encarnación Group

texts.es:
This committee from the barrio San Miguel Centro, of the district of Cambyreta got started thanks to another group of a near by neighborhood, where one of the women invited one of the ladies to contact Fundacion Paraguaya to start their own group.

After having the required meetings the group "Mujeres Unidas de Encarnación" is formed. Nowadays they work with the loans in a responsible and punctual manner.

Currently the committee is formed by 17 hard working women. They work in different areas such as small general stores, dressmaking, hair salons, clothings sales, merchandise sales, food sales, among others. Each member receives an average of Gs. 800.000. The loans will be used to expand their businesses, in other words, to purchase more merchandise and materials such as: fabric, thread, buttons, elastics, zippers, flour, breads, canned goods, drinks, clothing, haircare products, cosmetics, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Este comité del Barrio San Miguel Centro del distrito de Cambyreta ha surgido por contacto de otro grupo formado en un barrio cercano, donde una de las mujeres invito a una de las señoras a contactar con la Fundación Paraguaya y formar su propio comité.

Luego de realizar las reuniones requeridas de presentación surge el grupo “Mujeres Unidas de Encarnación” que hoy día ya trabajan con el crédito solidario de forma responsable y puntual.

Actualmente el comité esta integrado por 17 mujeres trabajadoras. Las actividades de estas señoras consisten en: despensas, costura de prendas, peluquería, venta de ropas, venta de mercaderías, venta de comestibles, y otros. Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de Gs. 800.000. El destino de estos créditos será para la expansión de sus negocios, es decir para la compra de mas mercaderías e insumos como ser: telas, hilos, botones, elásticos, cierres, harinas, panificados, productos enlatados, bebidas, prendas de vestir, artículos para el cabello, productos cosméticos, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, haircare products, materials to prepare food, flour, breads, canned goods, rice, noodles, varied drinks, fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, elastic, lace, cosmetics, shoes and others.

loans.name: María Salomé's Group

texts.en:
María Salomé is thirty-five years old and the mother of four children: three are boys, all of them attend school. Her husband works as a security agent at a country house. To supplement her family’s income, María Salomé sells vegetables and ripe fruits in her hometown, the low-income Cruce Mela community of Yamasá.

María Salomé admits humbly that it is hard to keep up with her children and that maintaining the cash flow is very challenging. Nonetheless, she expects that her business’ growth will help her augment her income so that she can improve her family’s living conditions. María Salomé says that the most important thing for her is to support her children’s studies so that they get a good education. In this way, even the poorest children are given a fighting chance.

María Salomé has applied for a loan together with the following entrepreneurs:

Marta Teresa D. L. S. Gonzalez, who will buy curtains and decorative window dressings.

Grisel V., who will purchase seeds to resell in the community.

Ramona Antonia M. T. has a small business selling cakes and other goods.

Epifania S. will buy materials for a small beauty parlor.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for a small business

loans.name: Jesus Ignacia

texts.es:
The client Jesus Ignacia is soliciting the refinancing of her third loan to invest in building her room. She lives in the 7th zone of Nueva Guinea and is a teacher at the Francisco Aaron School. She has a 2-year-old boy and is pregnant with her second child. Her partner works in construction and helps with the family expenses. With the first loans she received, Jesus was able to buy a lot. Her dream was to build a room and a kitchen on the lot so she could live in her own place since she lives with relatives and her family is growing and needs a bigger place live.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La Clienta Jesus Ignacia esta soliictando refinanciamiento de su tercer credito para invertirlo en construir su cuarto , ella vive en la zona numero 7 de Nueva Guinea, es Docente de la Escuela Francisco Aaron, tiene un niño de 2 años y actualmente esta embarazada , su compañero quien trabaja en la cosntruccion como ayudante de albañil apoyando a su compañera con los gastos familiares, Doña Jesus con los primeros creditos logro comprar un solar en el que su sueño ha sido construir un cuarto y su cocina para pasarse a vivir a su propio hogar ya que actualmente vive con sus familiaresy la familia ya esta creciendo necesitando de su propio lugar.

loans.use: To improve her home.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is married and has three children. She sells used clothing. Business is going well and she wants to increase sales.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Roberta Josefina's Group

texts.es:
Lina, Yolanda and Roberta have been members of Banco Comunal Tambillo for 1 year. They come from the Tambillo district which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho. To make a living they cultivate grain and root vegetables.

Lina is married, is 77 years old and has 8 children, one of whom who lives with her. Together with her son, Lina buys and sells animals. She sells the animals at the market in the city of Ayacucho. She also raises guinea-pigs and hens.

Then there is Yolanda, who is married, is 38 years old and has 2 children. Yolanda sells food on Saturdays at the local market.

Roberta is separated, is 53 years old and has 7 children. She sells clothes in the different villages in her region, which she reaches by foot. She also has a shop where she sells petrol.

Lina, Yolanda and Roberta need a combined loan of $850 to invest in the purchase of cattle, oil, rice, noodles and petrol.

Yolanda's dream is to buy land in the city of Ayacucho, to build a house and that her children study in Ayacucho. Roberta hopes to set up a workshop for her children. Lina would like to expand her business.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Lina, Yolanda y Roberta son socias del Banco Comunal Tambillo hace 1 año, ellas son del distrito D. Tambillo que se ubica a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Todas ellas se dedican a la agricultura D. cereales y tubérculos.

Lina es casada, tiene 77 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 1 vive con ella, Lina junto a su hijo se dedican a la compra y venta D. animales, sus ventas lo realiza en la feria D. animales D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Lina se dedica a la crianza D. cuy y gallina.

Por otro lado Yolanda es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Yolanda venD. comida los días sábados en la feria D. su Distrito.

Mientras que Roberta es separada, tiene 53 años y 7 hijos, Roberta venD. ropa, sus ventas lo realiza caminando por los diferentes pueblos D. su zona. Además Roberta tiene una tienda donD. venD. combustibles.

Lina, Yolanda y Roberta necesitan préstamos D. 900 soles, 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que fue invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno, aceite, arroz, fideo y petróleo.

Los sueños D. Yolanda son comprar un terreno en la ciudad D. Ayacucho para construir su casa y sus hijos estudien en Ayacucho. Por otro lado Roberta sueña con implementar un taller para sus hijos, Mientras que Lina desea que su negocio sea más granD..

loans.use: Lina, Yolanda y Roberta necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que fue invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno, aceite, arroz, fideo y petróleo.

loans.name: Cecilia Ama

texts.en:
Ama Cecilia M. is married and has five dependents. She sells clothing materials and shoes but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more clothing materials and shoes to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the coordinator of a recently created group of five women - all mothers with families that live in the low-income Cruce MeL. community of Yamasá.

Elizabeth has two daughters aged two and four. She explains that her husband works part-time as a heavy truck driver for a company but he doesn’t earn enough money to cover all of the family’s expenses.

Elizabeth plans on using her loan to buy men’s and women’s clothing to resell in the community. She says that she’ll travel to Santo Domingo, the capital, to get the goods at very low prices so that her business will be profitable. Elizabeth says that she’ll put her best foot forward to make her business successful and be able to repay the loan.

Elizabeth has requested a loan together with the following women:

Rosa J., who will prepare homemaD. food to sell in the neighborhood.

Andrea L. F., who wants to start selling women’s clothing.

Florinda M. will buy men’s clothing to sell in the community.

Sandra Margarita C. S. hopes to open a small grocery store

loans.use: To purchase women's clothing to start a small business

loans.name: Seferina's Group

texts.en:
Seferina, thirty-four, lives in the Cruce Mela community of Yamasá, where she runs a small business which helps her keep her five children out of poverty. Seferina sells women’s clothing. She explains that her husband’s job can’t resolve all of the family’s financial problems, as she had expected. “So, it’s one step forward, two steps back,” she added.

Fortunately, since starting her business three years ago Seferina has been able to earn the family some additional money. Nonetheless, her income is still limited and she can’t support all of her children’s studies. So, Seferina has applied for a loan to purchase clothing in bulk in order to increase her sales volume and, consequently, her income.

Seferina has applied for the loan together with four other women, all of whom are entrepreneurs and run businesses in the low-income community. The other members of Seferina’s group are:

Dominga M., who has a small business selling fried vegetables.

Bruna J. D. R., who will use the loan to buy men’s clothing for her business.

Simeona G. S., who plans to buy shoes to resell in her community.

Berkis M. will purchase clothing in bulk.

Order of appearance in the picture, left to right: Seferina M., Dominga M., Bruna J. D. R., Simeona G. S., Berkis M.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is married and has 4 dependents. She sells bread and eggs but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more bread and eggs to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more bread and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn Q. is married and has four dependents. She sells tom brown and wheat but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more tom brown and wheat to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas S. is single and has no children. She is a hairdresser and is focused on expanding her business.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more hairdressing materials. This will allow her to improve the conditions of her service and attract more clients.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more hairdressing materials.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta O. is married and has two childrend. She owns a provision store but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.>/p>

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es:
Roberto B. is 38-year-old farmer who lives in Ticuantepe. He has 2 children with his wife. He and his wife both work very hard to provide basic necessities at home. Through their hard work they’ve been able to develop a small business selling tropigas (propane) for the last 10 years. He’s soliciting a loan to buy agricultural products.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

don Roberto B. es agricultor a sus 38 años de edad reside en Ticuantepe procreo 2 hijos con su esposa, ambos trabajan muy duro para garantizarle las cosas basicas en el hogar , ella lo apoya trabajando como comerciante quienes han logrado con esfuerzos propios tener un pequeño negocio de venta de tropigas desde hace 10 ños. Solicita el credito para comprar insumos agricolas

loans.use: To buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Tomasina's Group

texts.en:
Tomasina is a hard-working woman and the proud mother of two beautiful sons. Recently, Tomasina decided to start a business selling house wares and kitchen items to the women of her community. Her business allows her to supplement the family’s income and helps her husband face their financial burdens. Tomasina plans on using her loan to add new items to her stock in order to increase her sales volume and her income. Tomasina says she’d like to buy a house so that her children can live comfortably, but that’s down the road.

Tomasina has requested this loan together with the following women:

Ana B. L., an active entrepreneur who sells women’s clothing.

Teofila L. S., who will use the money to buy shoes and pants for her small store.

Marileidy J. M., who sells clothing.

Luisa S. G., who will buy clothing in bulk.

Order of appearance in the picture, left to right: Ana B. L., Tomasina T. M., Teofila L. S., Marileidy J. M. and Luisa S. G.

loans.use: To purchase inventory to resell in the community

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is a young entrepreneur and the proud mother of a lovely son. She struggles to earn a living and take care of her family. Shortly after her child’s birth, María was forced to leave school in order to get a job to support her child. As her son’s father doesn’t have a good job, María started a business selling pastelitos (meat or chicken turnovers) in her neighborhood. She explains that this venture has been very profitable because she cooks like nobody’s business.

María is requesting this loan (her second from FSMA) to buy more ingredients so that she can move her business forward and lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to keep producing her delicious 'pastelitos'

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
This client is a woman who has dedicated much of her life to farming. She’s a 56-year-old married mother -- both her children are minors and are in school and her husband is a farmer.

Juana hopes that with her efforts and those of her husband, her children will one day get an education. She and her husband dream of one day enlarging their parcels of land, to increase production and that way augment their income, which will help them guarantee a higher standard of living.

The loan that Juana is requesting will be invested in the purchase of agricultural products for the maintenance of the crop.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta clienta es una persona que se ha dedicado desde hace mucho tiempo a la agricultura, tiene 56 años, es casada, sus hijos son menores de edad, ambos estudian y su esposo al igual que ella es un agricultor.

Doña juana espera que con sus esfuerzos y el de su esposo un dia sus hijos puedan prepararse, ella y su esposo sueñan con un dia aumentar sus parcelas de tierra para incrementar su produccion y de esa manera aumentar sus utilidades que les ayudara a garantizar un mejor nivel de vida.

El prestamo que esta solicitando doña juana seran invertidos en la compra de insumos agricolas para mantenimiento del cultivo.

loans.use: Compra de insumos Agricolas

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida lives in the community of Los Alcarrizzos, and has run a small beauty salon for some time now.  She is asking for this loan so that she can invest money into improving the actual space where she has her business, as well as invest in higher quality products to offer her customers.  People in her community, although poor, appreciate being able to go to a salon that looks nice, and feels nice—and they like being offered a good quality of product.

Brigida says it is her goal to one day be such a successful woman that she manages and owns numerous beauty salons—in her community there is a need for more. She says she knows she would be able to provide them with a good service, and create successful businesses.  Her dream is to be able to provide her five children with a safe and healthy future, one where they can become good people and college-educated professionals.  For herself, she hopes that the income she makes from this loan will help her be able to afford good health insurance, and always be able to provide for her family.
 
On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Brigida herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To invest in improving the her beauty salon, as well as to invest in a better quality product to offer her clients.

loans.name: Elvira's Group

texts.es:
The committee consists of 15 hard working women of the barrio Seminario of the city of Caacupé. The group is currently in the 7th cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (enterprising women) program. The majority of the women are in the retail business, such as small grocery stores, kiosks, sale of cold drinks, sale of new and used clothing, etc.

The aforementioned women manage a line of credit in the amount of gs. 1.000.000 for each member through the committee Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.
