The committee was created thanks to Blanca V., who heard that in her neighborhood a group of women were forming a committee. She then visited the Fundación Paraguaya's office to learn about the program and was able to quickly gather 15 women from her neighborhood. In this manner the committee was formed with the minimum number of members required to start the training. Currently this group is one of the most solid ones in terms of working as a team, solidarity and responsibility.

They have held numerous charitable events with the objective of handling the unexpected necessities of its members. Elvira V. is the president of the committee and along with all the other members, is very happy to be part of a program that seeks the development of people with limited resources. Not only did they receive the loan but they also learned that together the can accomplish important objectives that benefit the community as well as the committee's members.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Seminario de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo esta actualmente en el 7to. Ciclo del programa Mujeres Emprededoras, la gran mayoría de las señoras se dedican al comercio, como ser despensa, kiosko, venta de bebidas heladas, ropas nuevas y usadas.

Dichas señoras están manejando una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 1.000.000 por cada integrante a través del programa de comité de Mujeres Empredoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.

El comité fue creado gracias a que la señora Blanca V. se entero que en su barrio se estaba formando un comité de mujeres, su curiosidad la llevo a visitar la oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya, a fín de interiorizarse del tema, rápidamente logró reunir a 15 señoras vecinas y así se conformó el comités con la cantidad de integrantes mínima requerida para el inicio de las primeras charlas de capacitación, actualmente este comité es uno de los más solidos en cuanto a trabajo en equipo, solidaridad y responsabilidad.

Ya realizaron numerosas actividades benéficas con el objetivo de cubrir las necesidades imprevistas de sus integrantes., Elvira V. es la presidenta del comité y manisfestó estar muy contenta como todas las integrantes de ser parte de un programa que busca el desarrollo de las personas de escasos recursos, ya que no solamente reciben el préstamo, sino también aprendieron a que unidas pueden lograr objetivos importantes que beneficien a la comunidad, y mismo a las integrantes del comités.

loans.use: To Purchase products such as sugar, herbs, milk, cookies, starch, beef, sodas, beer, a variety of drinks, as well as clothing for men, women and children.

loans.name: Rosa Josefa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa is a person of great importance and very humble; she lives in a home that has still not been fully built. Together with her husband, they work sales in order to support their children. She works selling shoes in the city of El Alto, which is one of the poorest cities of our country. During the time that Mrs. Rosa has worked with us, she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with respect to her payments. In addition to being a very charismatic person, full of self confidence, she is also very entrepenourial with many hopes of succeeding.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Rosa es una persona D. procedencia muy humilD., ella vive en una casa que aun no se encuentra muy bien construida. Junto a su esposo ambos se dedican al comercio para mantener a sus hijos, ella trabaja vendiendo zapatos en la ciudad D. El Alto que es una D. las ciudades mas pobres D. nuestro pais. En el tiempo que la señora trabaja con nosotros ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, ademas D. ser una persona muy carismatica y llena D. confianza en si misma, es tambien una persona muy emprendedora y con muchos deseos D. superacion.

loans.use: Will purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a straightforward and humble woman who struggles to make a living and take care of her five children. Sandra lives in a modest house from which she runs a small business selling pants, shoes and underwear to women of the Batey Yaco community of Pedro Brand, Santo Domingo.

Sandra has requested a loan to purchase more inventory and increase her sales volume. Sandra hopes that she can earn enough money in the future so that her children can have a good education.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for a very small business

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.es:
Carmen, Anotonia and Gloria have been members of Banco Comunal Llamocctachi for 3, 4 and 4 years respectively.

Carmen is 33 years old and married with 4 children. Together with her husband she sells slippers in rented premises near the Magdalena market.

Then there is Antonia, who lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Together with her partner, she cultivates vegetables and also purchases vegetables from other producers. She sells her produce at the market in Nery García.

Gloria is 26 years old and is married with 1 child. She has a well-supplied grocery store. She also purchases piglets to sell in the city of Huanta.

Carmen, Antonia and Gloria need a loan of $575 to invest in the purchase of slippers from Iona, scales and piglets.

Carmen, Antonia and Gloria dream of a good education for their children, of having more captial, of purchasing land and of a prosperous business.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen, Antonia y Gloria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Llamocctachi hace 3, 4, 4 años respectivamente.

Carmen es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Carmen junto a su esposo venden zapatillas en un local alquilado cercano al mercado Magdalena.

Por otro lado Antonia es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Antonia junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras, alfalfa y también compra de otros productores, sus ventas lo realiza en el mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Gloria es casada, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Gloria tiene una tienda surtida de abarrotes. Además Gloria compra tara y cochinilla que luego lo comercializa en la ciudad de Huanta.

Carmen, Antonia y Gloria necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 300 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatillas de lona, alfalfa, tara, cochinilla.

Los sueños de Carmen, Antonia y Gloria son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener más capital, comprar terrenos y sus negocios prosperen.

loans.use: Carmen, Antonia and Gloria need a loan of $575 to invest in the purchase of slippers from Iona, scales and piglets.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45721

loans.name: Nora Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is married. Her husband works in transport and her children are now grown and no longer live with her. Even so, she wanted to embark on a project that would allow her to generate more income to help her husband with the household expenses. Three years ago she started selling jewelry from a catalog. At first she sold to relatives and friends; over time her clientele has grown and she has achieved good sales.

Nelly is currently requesting a loan for $575, which she will repay in 6 months and will invest in the purchase of merchandise to sell. With your help Nelly will continue her progress in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly esta casada su esposo trabaja como transportista y sus hijos ya son mayores y ya no viven con ellos, aun así ella deseaba emprender alguna actividad que le permitiera generar mas ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Inicio hace 3 años con la venta de joyería por catalogo, vendiéndole a sus familiares y amigos, con el tiempo su cartera de clientes se ha incrementado y ha logrado buenas ventas.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Nelly seguirá con su negocio

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina started her business 3 years ago buying packages of clothing to sell among her relatives and neighbors. Her husband works as a bricklayer; as a result his earnings are small and she wanted to give her children better quality of life. Thanks to her effort the business has gone very well for her.

Now she is requesting a loan for $575 which she repay in 6 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise, since her sales are increasing and she wants to have inventory in stock for all of her clients. With your contribution Ernestina will move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ernestina inicio su negocio hace 3 años comprando pacas de ropa para vender entre sus vecinos y familiares, ya que su esposo trabaja como albañil por lo que sus ingresos son pocos y ella deseaba darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo la ha ido bien con su negocio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía, ya que sus ventas se están incrementando y desea surtirles a todos sus clientes. Con tu contribución Ernestina saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es:
José Enrique is married and has 4 children, ages 15, 11, 7 and 4 months. He started his business in order to be able to have a better source of income with which to move his family ahead. He started out 20 years ago working as a bricklayer, until with the passing years he acquired experience and began to work on his own and generate more income.

He is requesting a loan for $500 which he will repay in 6 months. With the loan he will buy the materials he needs to finish several construction projects. With your help José will continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

José Enrique es casado y tiene 4 hijos de 15, 11 ,7 años y 4 meses, inicio su negocio para poder tener una mejor fuente de ingreso para sacar adelante a su familia. Hace 20 años empezó como ayudante de albañil hasta que con los años fue adquiriendo experiencia y empezó a trabajar como por su cuenta obteniendo así mayores recursos.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material que requiere para terminar algunos trabajaos. Con tu ayuda José podrá seguir progresando.

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Mr. Juan Carlos is a very hard working and humble man. He works from fair to fair selling items like pens, planners, pencils, notebooks, etc. His wife helps him selling socks for both children and adults. The need to work a lot and put forth more effort each passing day since they have six children who are still school aged. Today he needs more money since he would like to establish a store, increase his capital, and his stock of merchandise. As far as his loan history with our institution, Mr. Juan Carlos has demonstrated a lot of responsibility and commitment with his obligations; to date, he has not presented any problem paying his dues. In addition, he is a very congenial and happy person who wants so much for his children and pushes himself in his work every day because of it.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Juan Carlos es una hombre muy humilde y trabajador, trabaja de feria en feria vendiendo articulos como boligrafos, agendas, lápices, cuadernos, etc. Su esposa le ayuda vendiendo calcetines tanto para niños como mayores, necesitan trabajar mucho y esforzarse cada dia mas ya que mantienen a seis niños que aun se encuentran en edad escolar. Ahora necesita mas dinero ya que desea colocar una tienda y tambien incrementar su capital y tambien su mercaderia. En cuanto a su historial crediticio en nuestra institucion, don Juan Carlos ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad y compromiso con sus obligaciones ya que hasta la fecha no ha presentado problema alguno en el pago de sus cuotas, ademas de ser una persona muy simpatica y alegre anhela mucho para sus hijos, por lo que cada dia se esfuerza mas en su trabajo.

loans.use: Increase his capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Virginia is a very hard working person, and is relatively young. She sells hardware products like light bulbs, cables etc. She has to work every day because in addition to supporting her family, she also has to support her parents, who can no longer work because of their old age. She is a very happy and responsible person; she is very self confident and knows that everything must be achieved through much sacrifice. As far as her work with our institution, she has demonstrated a lot of responsibility considering she has not had any problems up to now paying her loan installments.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Virginia es una persona muy trabajadora y relativamente joven, ella trabaja vendiendo articulos de Ferreteria como focos, cables, etc, Ella tiene que trabajar todos los dias debido a que ademas de mantener a su familia, tambien debe mantener a sus padres que por la edad muy avanzada que tienen ya no pueden trabajar ni mantenerse a si mismos. Ella es una perona muy alegre y responsable, confia bastante en si misma y sabe que todo debe lograrse con mucho sacrificio. En cuanto a su trabajo con nuestra instituion ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad ya que hasta el momento no ha tenido problemas con el pago de sus cuotas

loans.use: Incrementara su Capital - Comprará Herramientas de Trabajo y Mercaderia

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel is married, just like her three children. She began this business in order to help her husband with family expenses. She got this business going three years ago, selling merchanside to family and friends.

She requests a credit of $250 which she will pay back in three months. She will use the money to purchase a bag of clothes because her sales are increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Raquel es casada y sus hijos ya están casados. Inicio su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, inicio hace 3 años comprando una paca de ropa y vendiendo entre sus vecinos y amistades en mercados rodantes.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una paca de ropa ya que sus ventas se están incrementando. Con tu ayuda seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula se dedica la venta de cosméticos, empezó hace 2 años ayudando a una amiga después Ella compro los catálogos y empezó a vender por su cuenta entre familiares y vecinos. Emprendió esta actividad ya que necesitaba de un ingreso extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Esther saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula works selling cosmetics. She started in the field 2 years ago helping a friend. Later, she bought the catalogs and began to sell on her own amongst family members and neighbors. She needed the extra income to help her husband with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan for $250, which she will use to buy merchandise. She will repay the loan in 3 months. With your help Paula will be able to move herself ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Paula se dedica la venta de cosméticos, empezó hace 2 años ayudando a una amiga después Ella compro los catálogos y empezó a vender por su cuenta entre familiares y vecinos. Emprendió esta actividad ya que necesitaba de un ingreso extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Paula saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano and his wife are small producers of cow milk, a product that is sold at the industrial milk plant “PIL Andima”. He also works selling pork meat at the popular fairs/markets of the cities of La Paz and El Alto. Said activities are his main sources of income, which serve to support the family.

Mariano lives in the Ticuyo community in the province of Los Andes (located a few hours from the city of El Alto).

The loan he seeks would be to purchase a milk cow of medium quality, and in this manner he could increase his production and therefore his family’s financial standing.

This is his second credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted indicates he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariano y su esposa son pequeños productores de leche de vaca, producto que vendido a la planta industrial de leche PIL Andina, él también trabaja comercializando carne de cerdo en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de La Paz y El Alto. Dichas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingresos que sirve para cubrir la manutención de su familia. Mariano vive en la Comunidad Ticuyo – Prov. Los Andes (Ubicada a una horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requerido será destinado para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, de esa forma incrementará su producción y aumentarán los ingresos económicos de la familia. Este es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Milpa 1 Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Catarina does not know her age, but she is an elderly woman with many years of work experience. Since she was little she has worked making and embroidering traditional clothing as an artisan. She is sad that, due to many of life’s hardships, she never had the chance to go to school so she does not know how to read. She sees very little at this age.

Currently, she purchases raw materials which other women make and embroider into handicrafts which Mrs. Catarina then sells. With the loan, she would like to purchase spools of colored thread and fabric.

The other members of the group are Maria P. H., who sells fruit and vegetables in Tuxtla Gutierrez; and Catarina P. A., who is an artisan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA CATARINA NO SABE SU EDAD , ES UNA MUJER DE EDAD AVANZADA Y CON MUCHOS AÑOS DE TRABAJO, DESDE QUE ES PEQUEÑA SE DEDICA A BORDAR Y ELABORAR ROPA TIPÍCA, ES ARTESANA, LE DA TRISTEZA QUE NO PUDO IR A LA ESCUELA NO SABE LEER Y CUENTA POR QUE LA VIDA SE LO EXIGIO, ACTUALMENTE YA NO VE MAS QUE SOMBRAS LO QUE HACE QUE COMPRE LA MATERIA PRIMA Y OTRAS MUJERES TRABAJEN EN LA ELABORACION DE LA ARTESANIA PARA QUE ELLA LA VENDA, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR MUCHOS CONOS DE HILOS DE COLORES Y TELA, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: MARIA PÉREZ H., VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN TUXTLA GUTIERREZ Y CATARINA PÉREZ A. ES ARTESANA.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials (thread and fabric)

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia has a small stand where she sells wool coats and jackets, working with her husband who makes them in his workshop working with one helper. With this activity, she is able to maintain her two daughters who are in college and in school. Her house is located in the Alto Tejar zone in the city of La Paz.

She seeks credit for working capital (to purchase raw materials and merchandise), to help increase the family’s income.

It is the fourth loan with IMPRO and the second through Kiva. The analysis conducted indicates she qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia tiene su pequeño puesto de venta donde comercializa abrigos de paño y chamarras, trabaja con su esposo el cual confecciona los abrigos de paño en su taller, emplea a una persona como ayudante. Con esta actividad cubre la manutención de sus dos hijas que están estudiando en la universidad y en el colegio; su vivienda esta ubicado en la Zona Alto Tejar de la Ciudad de La Paz. La beneficiaria solicita crédito para capital de trabajo (compra de materia prima y mercadería), mismo que le servirá para aumentar sus ingresos familiares. Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo vía Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por esta clienta.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Debanhi

texts.es:
Debanhi is single and sells shoes. She began this a year ago when she started to help her friend. Once she generated her own capital she got catalogs and began to sell them herself. She would sell them to family and friends. This business got started because she had a dream of helping her parents, since her dad's salary was not enough to cover daily living expenses.

She requests a loan of $250 which she will pay back in three months. She will use this money to purchase more shoes. With your help she will be able to move on in life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Debanhi es soltera se dedica a la venta de zapatos inicio hace un año ayudando a una amiga a vender y después cuando genero un capital ella compro los catálogos y empezó a vender por su cuenta entre amigos y familiares. Este negocio lo inicio porque desea ayudar a sus padres ya que con el sueldo de su papa no les alcanza para solventar los gastos.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Milpa 2 Group

texts.es:
Catarina is a single mother and does artisan work and plants and sells flowers. She sells her flowers from the state capital. She buys the seed in San Cristobal and resells them in Tuxtla. The cost of transport is a pretty big burden to her. All the income she generates is used to support her family. With the loan she receives she would like to buy more seeds and fertilizers so that she can grow a greater variety of flowers. The other members of Catarina's group are: Rosa H. A., Maria A. H., Maria P. H. and Maria H. P.. They all do artisan work.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

CATARINA ES SOLTERA Y SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA Y A LA SIEMBRA DE FLORES EN PEQUEÑA CANTIDAD, LAS CUALES LLEVA A VENDER A LA CAPITAL DEL ESTADO, ALGUNAS FLORES LAS COMPRA EN SAN CRISTOBAL Y LAS REVENDE EN TUXTLA, SE GASTA MUCHO EN TRANSPORTE DICE, LO QUE OPTIENE DE LAS VENTAS SE DESTINA AL GASTO FAMILIAR, CON SU CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR SEMULLAS Y FERTILIZANTES PARA PODER CULTIVAR MAS VARIEDAD DE FLORES, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: ROSA H. A., MARIA A. H. , MARIA PÉREZ H. Y MARIA H. PÉREZ SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zequentic 6 Group

texts.es:
Maria is 19 years old and since she was little, she has followed the tradition of her mother and sisters making and embroidering handicrafts. She has embroidered since she was little, and now makes shawls, table centerpieces, tablecloths, pillows, blouses, etc. She sells her merchandise in her community and to people who take it to San Cristobal to sell.

With the loan, she would like to buy raw materials (thread, fabric, and dyes). She is single and with the money she will help to contribute to household costs.

The other members of the group are Maria P. V., Juana Elena P. H., and Pascuala P. H. who are artisans.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA TIENE 19 AÑOS DE EDAD, COMO ES TRADICION DESDE QUE ES PEQUEÑA VE QUE SU MAMA Y SUS HERMANAS SE DEDICAN A LA ELABORACION DE ARTESANIAS, ELLA DESDE PEQUEÑA BORDA, ACTUALMENTE ELABORA REBOSOS, CENTROS DE MESA, MANTELES, ALMOADAS, BLUSAS, ETC, SU MERCANCIA ES VENDIDA EN SU COMUNIDAD Y A PERSONAS QUE SE ENCARGAN DE LLEVARLA A SAN CRISTOBAL CON SU CREDITO DECEA COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA(HILOS, TELA Y TINTAS), ES SOLTERA Y EL DINERO EN SU MAYOR PARTE ES DESTINADO A LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: MARIA PÉREZ V., JUANA ELENA PÉREZ H. Y PASCUALA PÉREZ H. SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials (thread, fabric, and dyes)

loans.name: Zequentic 7 Group

texts.es:
Rosa is 40 years old and since she was little, she has worked making and embroidering traditional clothing. She sells her merchandise to wholesalers in the nearest village who then sell it in tourist areas. She uses what she earns to buy more fabric and materials and to provide for her children. With the loan, she would like to buy more thread and fabric to increase her production.

The other members of the group are Rosa H. P. and Juana Catalina P. H., who are artisans; and Rosa Torrez P., who sells groceries out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE QUE ES PEQUEÑA SE DEDICA A EABORAR ROPA TIPICA Y BORDARLA, SU MERCANCIA ES VENDIDA A LOS MAYORISTAS QUE ENCUENTRA EN EL PUBLO MAS CERCANO PARA QUE LO VENDAN EN ZONAS TURISTICAS, LO QUE GANA ES DESTINADO A COMPRAR MAS MATERIAL Y A MANTENER A SUS HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR HILOS Y TELAS PARA INCREMENTAR SU PRODUCCION, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. ROSA H. PÉREZ Y JUANA CATALINA PÉREZ H. SON ARTESANAS, ROSA TORREZ PÉREZ VENDE ABARROTES EN SU CASA.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials (thread and fabric)

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa Mariel M. is a 34 year old single mother. She has a 17 year old son that attends the local public school. He also works with his mother, helping with the business. Teresa is very proud of her son and says that he has been a blessing in her life because even though she did not get any support from his father, her son has taken care of her and has helped her since he was very young. He is her companion and her strength to continue working hard.

Teresa owns a house with all the comforts that are necessary in a home. She is also a brilliant micro entrepreneur, owner of a small grocery store located in the Barrio Las Mercedes. It's been two years since she decided to open her store. She sells basic products used in everyday life such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, canned goods, dairy products, sodas, etc. Teresa has a lot of customers because her store is well stocked and her products attractively displayed in freezers, refrigerated stands, among others.

The loan she is requesting in the amount of Gs 2.000.000 will be sued to purchase merchandise such as flour, cooking oil, herbs, etc. She agrees to pay the loan in 11 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Teresa Mariel M. de 34 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo de de 17 años que estudia en el colegio Nacional de la zona y trabaja con en ella ayudándola en su la despensa, Teresa nos cuenta muy orgullosa que su hijo a sido una bendición muy grande en su vida, ya que aún cuando no contó con el apoyo del padre su hijo la ha cuidado y ayudado desde muy pequeño, el es su compañía y su fuerza para seguir luchando.

Teresa posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar. Teresa además es una brillante microempresaria, propietaria de una despensa ubicada en el Barrio Las Mercedes y ya van 2 años desde que decidió abrir su negocio. En su despensa ella comercializa productos de primera necesidad para el consumo como arroz, azúcar, aceite, harina, productos enlatados, lácteos, gaseosas, etc. El buen equipamiento de su despensa le permite contar con buena clientela ya que su productos están bien exhibidos en heladeras con exhibidor, frizers, entre otros.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es de Gs 2.000.000 para la compra de mercaderías de harina, aceite, arroz, yerba, y otros que se compromete a pagar en 11 cuotas mensuales.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables, fruits, beef, rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, canned goods, dairy products, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Jonathan Arnulfo

texts.es:
Jonathan Jiménez was helping his father in his taco business until he decided to start his own business, motivated by the family's economic situation and his desire to better himself. He started 5 years ago with the aim to provide his parents with economic support for the family while establishing his own economic independence and bettering himself in life. At various times in the past, he had considered going to the USA to work, but his business has motivated him to stay in his community.

He is requesting a loan for $500 which he will repay in 6 months . He will use the loan to buy a property to house his business. With your help Jonathan will continue to build his taco business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jonathan Jiménez le ayudaba a su padre con el negocio de tacos hasta que decidió iniciar su propio negocio debido a la situación económica familiar y al deseo de superarse. Comenzó hace 5 años debido a la situación familiar y con el deseo de brindar apoyo económico a sus padres y lograr tener independencia económica, el deseo de superarse en la vida, aun que había pensado en varias ocasiones irse a los estados unidos a trabajar, pero su negocio lo ha motivado a quedarse en su comunidad.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un mueble para su negocio. Con tu ayuda Jonathan seguirá con su taquería.

loans.use: Buy a property to  house his business

loans.name: San Juditas 1 Group

texts.es:
Teresa is 40 years old and has been running a small clothing business for the past 10 years. She sells clothes mainly to women and children. She buys the merchandise in the state capital, and with the loan she receives she will purchase more clothing to sell. This way she will not have to travel so much. The income will help support both the business and Teresa's two children. The other members of the group are: Maria Margartia R. R. (sells quilts and bedspreads), Fabiola Isabel R. R. (sells groceries), Petra Paola R. G. (breeds chickens), and Hilda J. G. (sells frets).

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

TERESA TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE DIEZ AÑOS DE EDAD TIENE UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO DE VENTADE ROPA EN SU MAYORIA PARA NIÑOS Y MUJERES, LA MERCANCIA LA COMPRA EN LA CAPITAL DEL ESTADO, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR MAS MERCANCIA Y ASI NO VIAJAR TAN SEGUIDO, LAS GANANCIAS SIRVEN PARA MANTENER EL NEGOCIO Y MANTENER SUS 2 HIJOS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. MARIA MARGARITA R. R. VENDE COLCHAS, SABABAS Y COBIJAS POR CATALOGO, FABIOLA ISABEL R. R. VENTA DE ABARROTES, PETRA PAOLA R. G. CRIAZA DE POLLOS Y HILDA J. G. VENDE TRASTES.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Valentín

texts.es:
Valentín is 51 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children. All but one of his children work. The youngest one is just 10 years old and attends a local school.

Valentín and his family live in a house that they acquired, a few years ago, with a lot effort and sacrifice and which was purchased with their children's future in mind.

Valentín earns a living in the construction business. He has been working with an architect for over 15 years as a contract mason. Thanks to his reliability and work ethic he is able to get a lot of work. He is also a perfectionist and is always careful to maintain high standards in his work so that his clients are loyal and seek him out for their construction projects.

He started out as a mason and thanks to his experience and good work he started hiring people to work with him. Currently he has 5 people working for him. He no longer does the heavy work, he now controls and manages the projects he is awarded.

Valentín is now requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle that was offered to him at a good price. The motorcycle would make it much easier and less expensive for him to get around to visit clients, the construction sites, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Valentín tiene 51 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de los cuales todos trabajan, excepto el menor que tiene solo 10 años y aun va a la escuela en un colegio de la zona.

Valentín y su familia viven hace ya varios años en una casa que adquirieron con mucho sacrificio y trabajo, pensando principalmente en el futuro de sus hijos.

Valentín se dedica a la construcción, trabaja con un arquitecto hace más de 15 años, como albañil contratista. Gracias a su responsabilidad y seriedad, posee mucho trabajo ya que su principal virtud es el de ser detallista, cuidando siempre la buena imagen de su trabajo para poder conseguir siempre que sus clientes le sean fiel a la hora de contratarlo para realizar refacciones o construcciones.

Empezó siendo albañil y con su experiencia y buen trabajo fue empleando personas para trabajar con él, es así que hoy día ya cuenta con 5 personales a su cargo y el ya no trabaja duro como antes y se encarga de el control y manejo de los proyectos que recibe.

Valentín hoy día solicita el crédito para la compra de una motocicleta que se le oferto a buen precio, de este modo le resultará mas fácil y menos costosa su movilidad al visitar las obras, clientes etc.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: San Juditas 2 Group

texts.es:
Flor de Maria is 22 years old and for the past two years has been selling soft drinks out of her mother-in-law’s house since she does not own her own home. With the loan, she would like to buy a second hand refrigerator and more soft drinks. With the profits, she will sustain the business and provide for her son.

The other members of the group are Rosa del Carmen S. R., who sells fruit and vegetables; and Maria Elena D. M., who sells soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

FLOR DE MARIA DE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS VENDE REFRESCO EN LA CASA DE SU SUEGRA, YA QUE NO CUENTA CON CASA PROPIA, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR UN REFRIGERADOR DE MEDIO USO Y MAS REFRESCOS, LA GANACIA LA DESTINA A MANTENER EL NEGOCIO Y A LAS COSAS QUE NECESITA SU HIJO, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. ROSA DEL CARMEN S. R. VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS Y MARIA ELENA D. M. VENDE REFRESCOS.

loans.use: Purchase a second hand refrigerator and merchandise

loans.name: Barrio De Candelaria 5 Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Blanca has worked together in carpentry with her husband for the past 15 years. They make chairs, desks and various odds and ends that their customers commission. They have invested a lot in their little business, the main pillar of support for their three children. The income from the business is used for family expenditures and to buy raw materials. With the loan Mrs. Blanca would like to buy wood and materials to make furniture. The other members of her group are Celia J. Yanez (sells shoes) and Martha Yanez (sells chickens).

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

DOÑA BLANCA COMO TODOS LA CONOCEN EN ALTAMIRANO DESDE HACE 15 AÑOS JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN ALA CARPINTERIA, ELABORAN SILLAS, MESAS Y ALGUNAS COSAS QUE LES ENCARGAN LE HAN INVERTIDO MUCHO A SU NEGOSITO DICE, PERO ES LO QUE HA MANTENIDO SUS 3 HIJOS, LAS GANANCIASSON DESTINADAS A LA COMPRA DE MATERIAS PRIMAS Y A LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR MADERA Y MATERIAL NECESARIO PARA LA REALIZACION DE MUEBLES, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. CELIA J. Y. VENDE ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO Y MARTHA Y. T. VENDE POLLO TROZADO.

loans.use: To purchase wood and materials to make furniture

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
The business of selling Andean food products has become the main income of Gregoria and her beloved family. She is a diligent mother, an entrepreneur, and very responsible that with persistence, will, and faith, the family situation will improve. With help from her husband she has always carried out this noble profession; together they acquire the Andean food products in markets in the various villages bordering their city and then sell them at economic prices in one of the principal markets in the city of Juliaca. The dream of this humble couple is to increase the amount of their investment, both believe that increasing and expanding the merchandise volume will improve their income and therefore their quality of life. It is with this objective that they turn to you and respectfully ask for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio D. venta D. productos andinos se ha convertido en el ingreso principal D. doña Gregoria y su amada familia. Ella es una madre diligente, emprendedora y muy responsable que con empeño, voluntad y fe viene sacando adelante a su familia.Con apoyo D. su esposo ha desempeñado siempre este noble oficio, juntos adquieren sus productos andinos en las ferias D. los distintos pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad para luego venderlos a precios económicos en uno D. los mercados más comerciales D. la ciudad D. Juliaca.El deseo D. esta humilD. pareja es incrementar el monto D. inversión, ambos creen que aumentando y amplificando el volumen D. mercadería mejorarán sus ingresos económicos y por enD. su calidad D. vida.Es con ese objetivo que recurren a ti para solicitarte gentilmente un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase of working capital in order to offer greater quantity of products

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45743

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is a woman who dreamed about forming a home where unity, love and tranquility reigned. She yearned to share these dreams with the father of her child, however he did not feel the same and decided to abandon her. Now she has gotten over his deception. In association with her brothers she decided to buy three knitting machines in order to earn a living entirely through this beautiful art that they learned from their humble parents. Lourde’s dream is to increase the volume of production to continue making beautiful garments such as: sweaters, socks, scarves and pants; with the income that she obtains she will improve the quality of life for her and her dear son Cristian, only six years old. With your support Lourdes will be able to buy a large variety of raw materials to make her proposal a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Lourdes es una mujer que soñó con formar un hogar donde reine la unión, amor y tranquilidad, anhelaba compartir estos sueños con el padre de su hijo, sin embargo él no pensaba lo mismo y decidió abandonarla.Ahora ya habiendo superado esa decepción. En sociedad con sus hermanos decidió comprar tres máquinas de tejer para dedicarse enteramente al bello arte que aprendieron de sus humildes padres.El deseo de Lourdes es aumentar el volumen de su producción para seguir fabricando hermosas prendas de vestir como: chompas, medias, chalinas y pantalones, con los beneficios económicos que obtenga mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su querido hijo Cristian de 6 añitos de edad.Con vuestro aporte Lourdes podrá comprar una gran variedad de materia prima para concretar su propósito.

loans.use: Capital increase to acquire more materials of good quality

loans.name: Honoria

texts.es:
Honoria has been a woman of humble heart since she was girl, always persevering, enterprising, and possessing progressive willpower. Currently, at her small restaurant, she is making an effort to reach her goal, together with her loving children. She has already decided to make space and renovate the place completely. During renovation, she started to sell nutritional products from Omnilife and is currently, achieving good results. Since the investment needed for her project is rather large, she needs to increase her working capital in order to reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Honoria es una dama humilde de corazón, desde niña siempre fue perseverante, emprendedora y con gran voluntad de progreso, ahora con su pequeño restaurante está presta a seguir esforzándose para alcanzar su objetivo junto a sus queridos hijos. Y ha decidido implementar su espacio y renovarlo por completo; mientras esto sucede ha incursionado en la venta de productos nutricionales de la marca Omnilife y esta obteniendo muy buenos resultados; debido a que la inversión de dinero en su proyecto es bastante grande le urge incrementar su capital de trabajo para continuar con su anhelo.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Casitas 2 Group

texts.es:
Maria Margarita is a 33 year old single mother with two children. She would like to start a business selling fruit in a shop that she would rent across from the Central Park of Altamirano. With the loan, she will invest in the rent for the space and will purchase a scale and fruit to sell. With her profits, she will repay the loan, buy more fruit, and support her children.

The other members of the group are Anita P. P., who sells groceries; Maria Virginia R. J., who sells fruit and vegetables; Dominga L. P. and Ysodora Luz G. Yanez, who sell clothing; and Leticia del Carmen H., who sells traditional delicacies.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA MARGARITA DE 33 AÑOS DE EDA ES MADRE SOLTERA DE 2 NIÑOS Y DECEA INICIAR UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE FRUTAS EN UN LOCAL QUE DECEA RENTAR FRENTE AL PARQUE CENTRAL DEL ALTAMIRANO, CON EL CREDITO DECEA INVERTIR EN LA RENTA DEL LOCAL Y EN LA COMPRA DE UNA BASCULA ASI COMO DE LA FRUTA QUE DECEA VENDER, CON LAS GANACIAS QUE ADQUIERA PAGARA EL CREDITO, COMPRARA FRUTA Y MANTENDRA A SUS HIJOS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON ANITA PÉREZ PÉREZ VENDE ABARROTES, MARIA VIRGINIA R. J. VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS, DOMINGA L. PÉREZ Y YSODORA LUZ G. Y., VENTA DE ROPA Y LETICIA DEL CARMEN H. VENDE ANTOJITOS TRADICIONALES.

loans.use: Rent a shop and purchase a scale and fruits to sell

loans.name: Casitas 2 Group

texts.es: MARIA MARGARITA DE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD ES MADRE SOLTERA DE 2 NIÑOS Y DECEA INICIAR UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE FRUTAS EN UN LOCAL QUE DECEA RENTAR FRENTE AL PARQUE CENTRAL DEL ALTAMIRANO, CON  EL CREDITO  DECEA INVERTIR EN LA RENTA DEL LOCAL Y EN LA COMPRA DE UNA BASCULA ASI COMO DE LA FRUTA QUE DECEA VENDER, CON LAS GANACIAS QUE ADQUIERA PAGARA EL CREDITO, COMPRARA FRUTA Y MANTENDRA A SUS HIJOS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON ANITA PÉREZ PÉREZ VENDE ABARROTES, MARIA VIRGINIA R. J. VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS, DOMINGA L. PÉREZ Y YSODORA LUZ G. Y.,  VENTA DE ROPA Y LETICIA DEL CARMEN H. VENDE ANTOJITOS TRADICIONALES.

loans.use: RENTAR UN LOCAL , COMPRAR UNA VASCULA Y VERDURAS PARA VENDER.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es:
Peregrina is a very diligent woman, joyful and friendly, for many years she worked at countless activities in order to generate enough income for her beloved family. Nonetheless none of the jobs earned as much as she would have liked, and so at the invitation of one of her friends she decided to sell beauty products through catalogs. At first this business did not seem very profitable, but as she expanded her market base offering her products in other cities, things began to change. Now Peregrina has made this business her major source of income and that of her family. In this opportunity, seeing the large amount of requests that she obtains from month to month and the supply of cosmetics maintained, she would like to take advantage of this by acquiring the products in order to have them in stock and sell them at convenient prices. Your support will allow Peregrina’s hopes to become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Peregrina, es una mujer muy diligente, alegre y amigable, durante muchos años se dedicó a innumerables actividades para generar ingresos económicos suficientes para su amada familia, sin embargo ninguna de las labores que desempeñaba cubrían sus expectativas, es así que por invitación de una de sus amigas decidió vender productos de belleza a través de catálogos, en un principio este negocio no parecía ser tan rentable, pero conforme ampliaba su mercado ofreciendo sus productos en otras ciudades las cosas empezaron a cambiar.Actualmente doña Peregrina hizo de este negocio su más importante ingreso económico y la de su familia, en esta oportunidad viendo la gran cantidad de solicitudes que obtiene mes a mes y la oferta que mantienen los productos cosméticos desea aprovechar en adquirirlos para tenerlos en stock y venderlos a precios cómodos.Tu aporte permitirá concretar los deseos de Peregrina.

loans.use: Capital increase to acquire more products

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia V. is 38 years old. She is the single mother of a son who is currently attending the 7th grade at a local public school. Claudia is the owner of a mini market, a small general store, which she has been running out of her house for the past 8 years.

Claudia is a beloved member of her neighborhood, recognized for her willingness to help her neighbors and for her charisma. These are the powerful reasons why neighbors and friends prefer to shop at her store.

Her store is always well stocked. She is of the opinion that it's better to have a variety of products so that her customers always find what they need. Among the items she offers we can find: beef cuts, sweet treats, dairy products, drinks, etc. She started with a small kiosk that throughout the years and thanks to her investments has grown considerably.

Currently she has a computerized system for her receipts and to control her stocked merchandise. She obtained this system a few years ago thanks to the previous loans she received from Fundación Paraguaya. This system makes it easier for her to do her cash count and to control her merchandise.

A few months ago, Claudia's mother, who lives with her, was ill and the tests and medications were very expensive. In oder to be able to pay for it Claudia had to use the money she had saved to purchase the merchandise for her store.

Claudia is an excellent client of the institution and has been very punctual in paying her previous loans and has invested them well. She now asks for a new loan to be able to replace her stocked merchandise and in this manner keep her customers happy.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Claudia V. tiene 38 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo varón que actualmente se encuentra cursando el 7º grado en un colegio nacional de la zona; Claudia es propietaria de un mini market, la misma esta ubicada en su casa y ya lleva 8 años de antigüedad en el rubro.

Claudia es una mujer muy querida en su barrio, reconocida por su buena predisposición para ayudar a sus vecinos y su carisma, estas son razones poderosas por la cual sus vecinos y amigos prefieren ir a comprar en su negocio.

Su tienda esta bien surtida, ella dice que es mejor tener variedad para que sus clientes encuentren siempre lo que necesiten; entre ellas podemos contar que pose carnicería, golosinas, lácteos, bebidas. Ella empezó con un pequeño kiosco que con los años y su buena inversión hoy ha crecido bastante.

Posee un sistema informático de tiquetes y control de stock de mercaderías que lo adquirió hace unos años gracias a los créditos anteriores que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya, este sistema le facilita su arqueo de caja y control de sus mercaderías.

Hace unos meses, la madre de Claudia, que vive con ella, enfermó y la demanda de los medicamentos y estudios fue muy alta por lo que para costear eso utilizo el dinero que ella ahorro para la compra de mercaderías de su local.

Claudia es una excelente cliente de la Fundación y ha pagado con puntualidad los créditos que ha retirado anteriormente y que los ha sabido invertir bien. Hoy día, ella solicita un nuevo crédito para poder reponer su stock de mercadería y así poder mantener siempre su buena clientela

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as: meat, canned goods, dairy products, sweet treats, cleaning products, breads, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Asuntina

texts.es:
Ausuntina is a loving mother and model wife in the area of Apurimac, because of work she decided to situate herself in the city of Juliaca, with the little money she earns she was able to obtain a tricycle that she can use to sell her delicious vegetable stew in a traveling manner, before her husband worked as a chauffer for a transportation company with the hopes of increasing their income and bettering the quality of life of his beloved family. After saving a sufficient amount with the help of her husband they decided to obtain a place to open a restaurant, nowadays this small but cozy space is being converted into one of the most crowded in her area, because she cordially attends to her customers and above all because of the variety and delicious plates that they prepare. Thanks to this business that they want to improve, this loving pair is able to cover their daily expenses and furthermore the education of their 4 small children.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Asuntina es una madre muy amorosa y ejemplar esposa natural del departamento de Apurímac, por motivos de trabajo decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde entonces con el poco dinero que contaba se dispuso a adquirir un triciclo para vender sus deliciosos potajes en forma ambulatoria, en tanto su esposo trabajaba como chofer en una empresa de transporte con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su amada familia.Luego de ahorrar lo suficiente con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo decidieron alquilaron un local para abrir un restaurante, actualmente este pequeño pero acogedor espacio se está convirtiendo en uno de los más concurridos de su localidad, por la cordialidad con la que atienden y sobre todo por la variedad y deliciosos platillos que preparan.Gracias a este negocio que desean ampliar, esta encantadora pareja está logrando cubrir sus gastos primordiales y sobre todo la educación de sus 4 menores hijos.

loans.use: To increase the space of their restaurant.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira is a popular and admired woman in her family, with a lot of insistence and effort she has successfully concluded her Masters studies, but because of work opportunities in her country she could not practice her profession, because of this she has decided to seek another method of generating her own income and support her husband with the expenses of their home and the education of their 2 adorable children that she diligently cares for by selling clothing. The desire of Elvira and her husband Hermenegildo who works as a professor in a modest school that is far away from the city of Juliaca is to finish renovations on their house; this will give them security and peacefulness; but now Elvira seeing the movement that exists in her business, she hopes to generate more earnings with this investment and bring tranquility to her family. With your contribution you will allow her family to live in an environment full of tranquility and wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira es una dama muy popular, querida y admirada en su entorno familiar y laboral, con mucho empeño y esfuerzo ha concluido con mucho éxito sus estudios supriores de maestra, pero por falta de oportunidades laborales en su país no puede ejercer su profesión, por esa razón decidió buscar la manera de generar sus propios ingresos económicos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus 2 adorables hijos que a pesar de su corta edad la apoyan diligentemente en su negocio de venta de ropa.El deseo de Elvira y su esposo Hermenegildo quien trabaja como profesor en una humilde y lejana escuelita de la ciudad de Juliaca es terminar de refaccionar su casita, pequeña morada que hicieron construir con muchas ilusiones de acoger, brindarles seguridad y tranquilidad a sus retoños; pero ahora doña Elvira viendo el movimiento que existe en su negocio desea aumentar el monto de inversión con el fin de generar mayores ingresos para la tranquilidad de su familia.“Con tu contribución permitirás que esta familia viva en un ambiente lleno de tranquilidad y bienestar”

loans.use: An increase of capital for her work to offer a better quantity of clothing

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45751

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
Cornelia is a humble mother from one of the poorest areas in Peru. Her and her husband's dream is to develop her business and to give her children a better future. 19 years ago they moved to the city of Huancayo. There her husband works in construction and she works for various families during the harvest and is paid in relation to how much she produces. She also makes knitted clothing by hand using a traditional technique from her beloved village. Thanks to the quality of the materials that she uses she has been increasing her production little by little and she now wants to start selling her products at the local Saturday fair in her city. In order to fulfill this dream she is requesting a loan because to be able to start this big project she needs to buy more raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Cornelio, es una humilde madre de familia que proviene de una de las zonas más pobres de Perú, su deseo de progresar y otorgarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos hizo que en común acuerdo con su esposo hace 19 años se establezcan en la ciudad de Huancayo, aquí el se dedica a la albañilería y ella presta su mano de obra durante las épocas de cosecha a diferentes familias por la que obtenga una compensación deacuerdo a su producción. De manera adicional se dedica a elaborar prendas de vestir tejidas a mano y utilizando la técnica ancestral de su querido pueblo, poco a poco gracias a la calidad y a los materiales que utiliza ha ido incrementando su producción y ahora desea iniciar la venta de estos en la feria local de su ciudad los días sábados. A este deseo atiende su solicitud de un préstamo ya que para iniciar este gran proyecto necesita adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima.

loans.use: Invest capital in order to purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian is 35 years old, is married and has three children. Two of her children attend a local school and the third one is still too young to attend. However, Lilian says the two older brothers are already teaching the youngest the basics and he is already looking forward to going to school.

Lilian has been running a small general store out of her house for over 5 years. Today Lilian and her husband tend to it. This business is one of her greatest accomplishments. She always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else.

Lilian has been married to Leoncio for over 10 years. They both come from the city of Encarnación where they were born and raised and where they met as youngsters. Leoncio helps Lilian tending to the store in shifts and buying the merchandise at the city's municipal market.

The loan that the client is requesting will be used to purchase varied merchandise for their store. One of their suppliers is having a sale and they hope to take advantage of it since it would allow them to obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lilian tiene 35 años, vive en pareja y tiene 3 hijos, dos de sus hijos estudian en un colegio de la zona en donde viven y el mas pequeño aún no asiste a clases porque es pequeño y no posee la edad para asistir a clases; Lilian nos cuenta que a pesar de ello sus hermanos ya le enseñan cosas básicas a su hermano más chico quien está muy entusiasmado de ir ya a la escuela.

La señora cuenta con un minimercado en su domicilio propio, ella se dedica a este tipo de actividad hace más de 5 años y que hoy día es atendido por ella y su pareja. Este negocio es uno de sus mejores logros ya que toda su vida soñó con contar con su negocio propio y no depender de nadie.

Lilian está casada con el Señor Leoncio hace mas de 10 años ambos son de la ciudad de Encarnación en donde nacieron y se criaron y que ya de jóvenes se conocieron. Leoncio ayuda a Lilian en el negocio atendiendo por turnos y comprando las mercaderías del mercado municipal de la ciudad.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de mercaderías varias para su negocio ya que se le presento una buena oferta de uno de sus proveedores y no desea desaprovecharla, ya que esto le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as cleaning products, sweet treats, wine, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina works day to day with a lot of insistence to be able to cover all the necessities, she dedicates herself to the shearing of wool from sheep to market it and leather for the shoemakers, if you go to the Huamanmarce annex you will see her there working shearing the wool. This is a small workshop that Maximina has fixed for work, and in the afternoons she dedicates herself to the decoration of aprons. Maximina’s dream is to better her production and to open a store. The loan will be invested as capital.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Maximina día a día trabaja con mucho empeño para poder brindar a los suyos todo lo necesario, se dedica a trasquilar la lana de las ovejas para comercializarlas a los proveedores y el cuero a aquellas personas que hacen zapatos, si van al anexo de Huamanmarca verán allí a una mujer trabajadora trasquilando la lana. Este es un pequeño taller que Maximina ha habilitado para trabajar, y por las tardes se dedica a elaborar mandiles.El sueño de Maximina es mejorar su producción y aperturar una tienda, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando porque desea ver a sus 3 encaminados por la senda del éxito, el préstamo será invertido como capital en su próxima campaña de venta.

loans.use: To increase her capital to increase her production.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Celinda G. J., is associated to the Comunal Bank "Unidad Calzadina". She lives in the region of San Martin, Province of Moyabamba, district of Moyobamba. She sells chicken in an environment built specially for this acivity. Her business is located in one of the main streets in the city, where many clients attend daily to consume the delicious roasted chicken that she prepares.

She started her business selling assorted items, but her attitude of visionary brought her to the roasted chicken business, a very demamded business in her community.

With this S/ 1200.00 loan that she will return in 6 months, she will finish the construction of the floor of her business, and she will also buy chicken, potatoes on bulk, vegetables for salads, and other items that will attract the attention of her clients with high quality and higienic products.

Celinda is a 41-year-old perseverant and very friendly woman, that lives with her husband and two children, who help her to go on and reach her goals. For the future she wishes to improve and expand the environment of her business and improve service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Celinda García J. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unidad Calzadina”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Calzada, su pollería se ubica en un ambiente construido especialmente para esta actividad, a la que diariamente asiste moradores de la comunidad a saborear los ricos pollo a la brasa que prepara. Se inicio en el negocio de la venta de abarrotes, pero su actitud visionaria le llevó a concretar este negocio de pollos a la braza que era muy solicitado en la comunidad en la que vive. Con el crédito de S/.1200.00 que devolverá en un plazo de pago de 6 meses, lo invertirá en el acabado del piso de su establecimiento, también comprará: pollos en javas, papas en sacos, verduras diversas para las ensaladas y otros que harán posible la buena atención a sus clientes con productos de buena calidad e higiénicos. Celinda es una mujer perseverante y muy amigable, tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes la impulsan a esforzarse cada día más y alcanzar sus objetivos, desea para el futuro mejorar y ampliar el ambiente donde desarrolla su negocio y así dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy raw products to prepare the products she sells

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
Irene has many dreams to continue to work in order to help her family. Moved by this desire, she began to sell food at fairs two years ago. She does this on Thursdays and with the earnings she has been able to support her family. She has seen some improvements in her business and now hopes to get her own restaurant. At the moment she will continue to work hard and hopes to purchase a tent and plates. Please support Irene so that she is able to improve her financial life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Irene tiene muchos deseos de seguir trabajando con el propósito de seguir brindándole bienestar a su familia, movida por este deseo decidió hace dos años dedicarse a la venta de comida en las ferias comerciales cercanas a su localidad los días jueves de cada semana, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas se ha convertido en una columna sostenedora de la economía de su hogar y por la constancia de su trabajo ha visto mejoras en su negocio y a raíz de este hecho tiene el anhelo de mejorar su espacio de labor diaria y a futuro tener un restaurante, por el momento seguirá esforzándose en el pequeño puesto de comida que tiene y solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de una carpa y platos para elevar su calidad de atención. Apoya decididamente a Irene para seguir fortaleciendo la economía de su familia.

loans.use: Increase capital to obtain better quality and quantity of foods, also purchas a tent to protect herself better from cold weather and heat

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmela R. B., is a member of the Comunal Bank "Unidad Calzadina". She lives in the San Martin region, province of Moyomamba, district of Calzada. She sells assorted items, vegetables, bread, candy, and soft drinks in her store located in her own house of the street Jr. Indepndencia S/N, in the neighborhood called Barrio Miraflores, and where the neighbours and visitors shop on a daily basis.

She decide to start her business with the support of her husband and with the goal of managing her own profit and improve her economic level and help her children to go on studying.

With this S/. 1000.00 loan, which she will return in 6 months, she ill buy first need products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, preserves, pasta, detergent, and toilet paper, among others, in order to satisfy her customes' needs.

She is a 40-year-old mother of two children who are very supportive of her business and her goals for the future, which are to improve her sales and to fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Carmela R. B. , es socia del Banco Comunal “Unidad Calzadina , vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Moyobamba, distrito de Calzada , se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, panes, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, en su bodega ubicada en su propia casa del Jr. Independencia S/N en el Barrio Miraflores donde acuden diariamente a comprar los moradores del barrio. Decidió iniciar su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo y con la finalidad de manejar sus propios ingresos y aumentar su nivel económico y ayudar a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará, productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, conservas, paquetes de fideos, detergentes y papel higiénico entre otros, para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 40 años y 2 hijos que siempre la apoyan en el negocio, sus metas para el futuro son, ampliar sus ventas y hacer arreglos en su casa.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more products she needs to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Mrs. Adela P. V., is associated to the Comunal Bank "La Amistad Del Dorado". She lives in the region of San Martin, Province of Moyabamba, district of Moyobamba. She sells Salchi-papa and Salchi-pollo (french fries with sausage and french fries with chicken, soft drinks, and candies. Her business is located in one of the main streets in the city, where many clients attend daily to consume this type of food.

She started her business with the help of her husband and children upon realization of their econimic situation.

With this S/ 1500.00 loan that she will return in 6 months, she will buy the raw products/materials to perpare the products she sells: potatoes on bulk, vegetables for salads, oil per liters, sauces such as mayo, ketchup, mustard, and aper plates, plastic forks and glasses, as well as a new cart to sell her products.

Adela is a 45-year-old entusiastic woman, mother of 6 (4 of which live with her), and she is happy to be accomplishing her goals and dreams with starting a roasted chicken business.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Adela P. V. , es socia del Banco Comunal “La Amistad Del Dorado ”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyabamba , distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la venta de Salchi-papa y salchi-pollo , bebidas gaseosas y golosinas, su negocio se ubica en una de las principales calles de la ciudad, donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de esta tipo de comidas. Se inicio en este negocio al ver la situación económica que estaba viviendo, con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos, iniciando comenzó este negocio . Con el crédito de S/ 1500.00, el cual pagara en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los productos que vende como: papas en sacos , verduras para las ensaladas, aceite en litros, cremas como, mayonesa, kepchu, mostaza y platos, tenedores, vasos descartables, también comprará una nueva carpa para su carrito salchipapero. Adela es una mujer entusiasta de 45 años, tiene 6 hijos, 04 viven con ella, se siente contenta de estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos y sueña poner un negocio de pollos a la brasa. .

loans.use: With this loan she will buy the raw products necessary for the preparation of the products she sells

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45758

loans.name: Marilud

texts.es:
La señora Marilud P. Izuza  se dedica al negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. Su tienda se encuentra ubicada en el  Jirón Ambrosio Saavedra S/N del distrito de Puerto Rico, departamento y  provincia de San Martín , ella desarrolla este negocio  hace 03 años. 

El  préstamo de 1000.00, que será pagado en 6 meses,  lo invertirá en la compra de vestidos, polos, pantalones   para  niñas y niños, pantalones jean y polos de diferentes marcas para damas y caballeros. Para surtir su negocio busca satisfacer a sus clientes en todos sus gustos y estar siempre actualizada con la moda.

Ella tiene 29 años de edad, tiene  un hijo. Se caracteriza por ser gentil y muy atenta con sus clientes. Preocupada por sacar adelante a su familia y por ser un ejemplo para  su hijo.

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara mas mecaderia para su venta

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Rebeca is a young mother and has many wishes for progress. To reach her goal, she took the initiative to start work in her home without neglecting her small children. She decided to buy an embroidering machine with which she can optimally spend her embroidering time. This machine greatly helps her work. Thanks to this important tool, she can devote plenty of time, without anxiety, generating sums of money for her family's economic situation. She wants to improve her studio as well as the stables for her bulls and cows by improving the quality of her products and raising living standards for her lovely family.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Rebeca es una joven madre de familia con muchos deseos de progresar y como iniciativa para alcanzar su meta ha decidido trabajar en su propia casa sin descuidar la atención de sus pequeños y ha optado por comprar una máquina bordadora con el fin de optimizar el tiempo del bordado de fustanes ayudándose de este valioso instrumento de trabajo.Gracias a esta importante herramienta de trabajo puede dedicarse plenamente y sin temores generando interesantes sumas de dinero a su economía familiar. Quiere mejorar su taller y de paso mejorar también el establo de toros y vacas con el propósito de incrementar la calidad de sus productos y elevar el nivel de vida de su amada familia.

loans.use: to increase capital to improve the quality of her artistic handiwork

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
Mrs. Purificacion R. D. R. is a member of the « Las Victorias » Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region, province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located in her home on Jr. Loreto Nº 111, where she sells groceries, office and school supplies.

With the support of her husband and her children, she has managed to increase her business considerably, securing many clients.

With a loan of $575.00 that she will repay in 6 months, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, detergents, soaps, and general cleaning supplies along with soft drinks, and various snacks among other things to supply her business and meet the demands of her customers.

Purificacion is 50-years-old and she works hard every day to meet the goals she has set for herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Purificacion R. D. R. es socia del Banco Comunal “ Las Victorias” vive en la región D. San Martín provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres , distrito D. Juanjui , su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Loreto Nº 111 y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, artículos D. oficina y útiles escolares Con el apoyo D. su esposo y sus hijos, ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, logrando fidelizar gran cantidad D. clientes. Con el crédito recibido D. S/.1500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: arroz, azúcar en bolsas , leche, aceite, en cajas, detergentes, jabones y útiles D. limpieza en general, gaseosas, golosinas diversas, entre otros, para surtir su negocio y cubrir la demanda D. su basta clientela. La señora Purificacion tiene 50 años, se esfuerza cada día por lograr cumplir con sus metas trazadas, desea para el futuro ampliar su bodega.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Mrs. Edith R. P. is a member of the “Vision 2000” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region in the Picota province in the district of San Hilarión. She sells salchi-papa (sausage with fries), salchi-pollo (chicken with fries), and soft drinks from her home, where a large number of customers who enjoy these types of dishes come daily. Her husband, who helps her financially with the sales, encouraged her to start this business. Today she has secured her daily sales. With a loan of $1,125.00 that she will repay in 6 months, she will buy: chairs and tables to increase her business and provide her customers with better service and comfort and ingredients to prepare the sausage and chicken dishes. Also, she will install a glass case in her beauty salon to display the beauty products that she sells. Edith is an enthusiastic 47-year-old woman with 2 children, one of whom lives with her. She is happy to be achieving her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Edith R. P., es socia del Banco Comunal “Vision 2000”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota, distrito de San Hilarión , se dedica a la venta de Salchi-papa ,salchi-pollo y bebidas gaseosas, desarrolla su negocio en su casa en un ambiente especialmente acondicionado, donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de esta tipo de comidas. Se inicio en este negocio motivado por su esposo quien la ayudó económicamente en la venta, hoy en día tiene asegurada su venta diaria. Con el crédito recibido de S/ 3000.00 el cual será en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará: sillas y mesas para ampliar su negocio y brindar una mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes y los insumos para la preparación de salchi papas y salchi pollos, además implementara con una vitrina su salón de belleza para exhibir los productos de belleza que vende. Ediht es una mujer entusiasta de 47 años, tiene 2 hijos, uno de los cuales vive con ella, se siente contenta de estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos.

loans.use: To purchase products for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Trinidad Guervara L. is a member of the “Vision 2000” Communal Bank. She sells groceries, vegetables, and other products is her own home located on Marginal Avenue, Fernando Belaunde Terri Nº 374 Road, in the district of San Hilarión, Picota Province. She studied infirmary technology, but she always like business, so she decided to start her own business to support her two children. With a loan of $925.00 which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a variety of groceries such as: sacks of rice, sugar, various soups, boxes of different brands of soap, packaged toilet paper, canned fish, oil by the liter, cartons of eggs, and boxes of milk. She is 41-years-old and she always stood out as a fighter -- responsible, hard-working and persistent. She dreams of being a dairy producer and selling to other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Trinidad G. L., socia del Banco Comunal “Vision 2000”, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras y otros productos, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa ubicada en la av. Marginal , carretera Fernando Belaunde Terri Nº 374, del distrito de San Hilarión ,departamento de San Martín, Provincia de Picota. Estudió enfermería técnica, pero a ella siempre le gustó el negocio, así que decidió poner algo propio y así sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos. Con el crédito de S/. 2500.00, para ser pagado en 6 meses, comprará, diversos abarrotes como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades, cajas de jabón de diferentes marcas, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, huevos en javas, leche en cajas. Tiene 41 años siempre se a destacado por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora responsable y perseverante, sueña con ser productora de leche y comercializar a otras ciudades.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Emerlith

texts.es:
Mrs. Emerlith T. S. is a member of the "Vision 2000" Communal Bank. She lives in San Martin Region, Picota province in the district of San Hilarion. She sells prepared meals daily to provide good customer service. She started her business to provide a better education for her children, but she previously had a kiosk. Now, she sells food in her restaurant and offers a variety of dishes in this rented space. Thanks to her perseverance and her desire to succeed she was able to acquire what she has now. With a loan of $750.00 to be paid within 6 months, she will invest in equipping the restaurant with new kitchen utensils, such as pots in various sizes, crockery and cutlery, and also buy non-perishable ingredients to prepare the various dishes that she offers her customers daily. Emerlith is an enthusiastic and cheerful 53-year-old woman. Together with her husband and with humility that she shows, she wants to contribute to the progress of the community who gave her a chance to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Emerlith T. S., es socia del Banco Comunal “Vision 2000”, vive en la Región San Martín Provincia Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, se dedica a la venta de comida diaria acondicionado para brindar buena atención al cliente, La necesidad de dar una mejor educación a sus hijos la impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio ,ya que anteriormente tenía un kiosco , y ahora se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante con la preparación de variedades de comidas tipo menú , en un ambiente alquilado, gracias a su perseverancia, ganas de salir adelante, pudo obtener lo que ahora tiene. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 a ser pagados en 6 meses lo invertirá en la implementación el restaurante con utensilios nuevos de cocina, como ollas de diferentes tamaño, vajilla y cubiertos, así también comprará los insumos no perecibles, para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su basta clientela. Emerlith es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con 53 años, que junto a su esposo y con la humildad que demuestra quiere contribuir al progreso de la comunidad que le dio la oportunidad de salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase products such as utensils, cookware, and non-perishable food items for her restaurant.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45764

loans.name: Olguita

texts.es:
Mrs. Olguita R. Y. is a member of the "Vision 2000" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region of the Picota province in the district of St. Hilarion. She provides good customer care with a variety of foods. The need to provide better education for her children prompted her to start a business of preparing meals in her small home. Thanks toher perseverance, she has achieved her goal. With the loan of $750.00 to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy non-perishable items like sugar, rice, a variety of soft drinks, and preserves, vegetables, meats, and fruits for the preparation of various dishes that she offers daily to her customers . Olguita, who is 35 years old, is a very enthusiastic and cheerful woman and she longs to have a bigger and better equipped restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Olguita R. Y., es socia del Banco Comunal “Visiòn 2000”, vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, brinda a sus clientes una buena atención con variedades de comidas. La necesidad de dar una mejor educación a sus hijos la impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio de la preparación de comida tipo menú en un pequeño ambiente de su casa, gracias a su perseverancia, ha logrado lo que tiene como meta . Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 a ser pagados en 6 meses, comprará los insumos no perecibles como azúcar, arroz, menestras gaseosas de diferentes marcas y sabores, conservas, verduras, carnes, frutas para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su basta clientela. Olguita, es una muy mujer entusiasta y alegre con 35 años, que anhela tener un restaurante mas grande y mejor implementado .

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for meal preparation.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45765

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos C. A. is a member of the "Workers"communal bank and a native of the province of San Martin in the district of Juanjui. For the past nine years, she has run a general store because she was unable to find job following her studies at the Technical Nursing School. Her aunt encouraged her to start this business and also taught her how to manage it. With this loan of $450 that will be repaid 6 months, she will buy items such as needles, thread, ribbons, lace, colognes, powders, deodorant, medicines, ointments, menthol, alcohol, hair accessories and dozens of toys. This way, she can supply what her customers want. She is 36 years old with one child and she is happy that she feels more accomplished, independent, eager to move forward and have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Santos C. Arévalo, es socia del banco comunal “Trabajadoras” , es natural de la provincia de San Martín y distrito de Juanjui , hace 9 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio de artículos de mercería y pasamanería., en su puesto que tiene en el mercado central de esta ciudad, Estudio Enfermería Técnica y al no encontrar un puesto de trabajo, decidió dedicarse a esta actividad, motivada por una tía que lo enseño el manejo del negocio.
