She and her husband want to open a place where they can wash motor-bikes for the people in her community. Recently, this couple has taken out a loan to purchase an automatic motor-bike washer to run her new business.

Furthermore, she believes her business is blooming and generates better income because there will be a lot of unclean and muddy motor-bikes coming to her during this rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase an automatic motor-bike washer to start a new business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-one years old and a young married woman. She has been retailing mobile phone credit cards for the past two years. In Ghana many of the city and town dwellers use mobile phones but are unable to pay for full credit. Therefore selling rechargeable cards in smaller units to phone users serves as an alternative way to enable users to afford credit on their phones.

Beatrice wants to use her loan to buy more rechargeable cards to retail them. She hopes that this loan will help her to save some money from her income to get herself back into school again.

Beatrice is a member of the group called “Gye Nyame” (meaning: except God). Members of the group agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy phone rechargeable cards and credit

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella W. runs a store where she sells provisions and food. She is married and has 1 child. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan of $525 buy more goods for resale.

loans.use: To stock a small store.

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru:
Abduvohid A. lives in Rudaki region. He is 43 years old, married and has 2 children. He has a high school diploma. He finished school and opened his own farming business. Abduvohid has a large plot of land where he raises vegetables. Soon, it will be potato collecting season, and after that he will need to plant new potatoes. For this purpose he needs seeds and fertilizer. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months. Abduvohid's business ensures that markets have ecologically clean goods.

Абдушукуров Абдувохид живет в районе Рудаки. Ему 43года , он женат и имеет 2 детей. Образования среднее. Он закончил школу и занялся частным предпринимательством в сфере сельского хозяйства.. Имеет большой участок земли. Там он сей и выращивает овощи. Скоро начнется сбор картофеля и землю нужно будет засеить снова. Для этого нужно подготовить семена и удобрения. Для этого он хочет получить кредит. Погасить его он сможет в течении 12 месяцев. Его деятельность позволяет обеспечить рынки экологически чистыми продуктами.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: George

texts.en:
A. A. George sells footwear. He is not yet married. He is focused on establishing himself in this business, but he is running out of stock.

He is asking for a loan of $525 to buy more footwear for resale.

loans.use: To buy footwear for resale.

loans.name: Veronica's Juhudia Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 24 years old and is married. Veronica is a vegetable seller. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sinoritha, who has a food vending business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace buys large quantities of charcoal and sells the charcoal in bulk to people living in the bigger towns and cities. Charcoal still remains the topmost source of fire for cooking in Ghana. The price of gas has gone up and therefore the demand for charcoal is overwhelming. Grace wants to buy more bags of charcoal to enable her serve her loyal customers. She is fifty-one years old and has three children.

Grace is a member of the group called “Eye Nyame” (meaning it is God). Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Grace's photo was taken at a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45869

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en: Phoem C., age 52 years old, is a widow and has resided in Kampong Cham with her two children since they were born. Mrs. Phoem C. works as a house wife and stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. Her daughter, Sim Phally, age 23, owns a plot of farmland growing yams. On average, she makes around $2.50 a day. The other child is married and lives away from home. To make their business produce more output, she would like to take out a loan from Kiva to purchase good yam seeds to grow in the next season and the remaining loan to hire a farm worker to grow the yams. (Picture: Mrs Phoem C. and her daughter)

loans.use: To purchase good yam seeds

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is 35 years old and is single with 1 child, age 10 years old. She also takes care of a 60-year-old person. Zubeda owns a small food store, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 7:15am to 6pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 33 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 12 and 8. Fatuma owns a small food vendor store, which she opened in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $100 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en:
Ngen A., age 50, is a mother of three children and has two plots of farmland. This is her business that supports the household. One child is married and works selling fish in a busy market, making approximately about $200 a month in revenue; her other child is a farmer helping her parents and the last child is a student. Everyday, Mrs. Ngen A. and her husband always go to the farmland to take care of their crops. They not only grow rice but also plant a variety of beans. They normally earn about $2 per day of profit.

Even though Cambodia used to be the number one rice exporter, right now most of the people are disappointed with the weather, especially in the rainy season. Sometimes in the rainy season there is no rain so farmers do not have enough water for their crops. To help this family have no difficulties, they would like to take out a loA. from Kiva to purchase good rice seeds, beA. seeds, fertilizers and a water pump to water the crops in the dry season, in case there is a lack of water.

In the future, they also plA. to build a stable house and purchase a motorbike to transfer their output to sell in the market. (Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To purchase rice, bean seeds, fertilizers and a water pump

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy D. and her husband married in 2004 and have one son. They live with her mother and one sister. The family lives along National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanthy has been a scarf weaver since last year. It’s skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to wholesalers in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a scarf weaver as well. She hopes that her business can support her family to get better from day to day.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase cotton for weaving scarves.

loans.use: To purchase cotton for weaving scarves

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun S., 52, and his wife married in 1978. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. One of their children married and lives outside the family home. Of their daughters, one works in a garment factory and other one is in school. Of their two sons, one has full time employment and other one does construction work with his father. The family is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Saroeun has been a mason for twenty-seven years. He does his work in his village and in nearby villages. His wife stays at home takes care of children.

Mr. Saroeun is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to use for work.

loans.use: For purchasing a motorbike to use for work

loans.name: Chaileang

texts.en:
Mrs. Chaileang S. is divorced and has three children; two sons and one daughter. All of her children are in school. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chaileang has been a silk weaver for twenty one years. It’s skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middle-man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chaileang is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat Y., 56, is widow with three children; two sons and one daughter. All of her children are married. Two live outside the family home and the youngest one lives with her. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sinat has sold silk products since 1997. She buys the finished products from weavers in her village and the nearby province for resale in other provinces. Before stating this business she wove silk at home.

Mrs. Sinat is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase silk products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk products for resale

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S. and her husband married in 1979. They have three children; one son and two daughters. Her son is in school and her daughters are weaving silk at home. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Phalla has been in the business of selling grocery items for four years. She bought them from market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in front of her house. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for eight years.

Mrs. Phalla is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase grocery items for resale and for buying silk materials for her daughters' weaving.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale and for buying silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr:
Born on July 28, 1972 in LOKOSSA, Ms. Nathalie B. is originally from metropolitan LOKOSSA in the south-west of Benin, where she spent her entire childhood before getting settled in Cotonou for some twelve years at her husband's side. Together, they had twins, Daline and Dalina, both in seventh grade, and Sergio, age 8, in second grade. Two years ago, she lost her husband and is now a widow. Since then, she has had trouble finding the necessary financial means to be able to meet her children's needs. Let us recall that Ms. B. is a shoe seller at the DANTOKPA marketplace, the largest market in Benin. She is applying for this loan to restock her inventory in order to achieve her objectives and to meet the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 28 juillet 1972 à LOKOSSA, dame B. Nathalie est originaire de la cité urbaine de LOKOSSA au sud-ouest du BENIN où elle a passé toute son enfance avant de s’installer à COTONOU depuis une dizaine d’année aux côtés de son mari avec qui elle a eu 2 jumelles Daline et Dalina toutes deux en classe de cinquième et Sergio 8 ans en classe de CEI. Il y a deux ans elle a perdu son mari, donc veuve. Depuis ce temps elle a du mal à trouver les moyens financiers nécessaires pour pourvoir aux besoins de ses enfants. Rappelons que dame B. Nathalie est revendeuse de chaussures au marché DANTOKPA, le plus grand marché du BENIN. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner afin d’atteindre ses objectifs et de satisfaire ses clients.

loans.use: To buy a half bail of shoes

loans.name: Akuffu

texts.en:
Akuffu is forty years old and the mother of five children. Four of her children are in school. She has been buying beans, rice and groundnuts (peanuts) from the northern part of Ghana. She then travels to Koforidua, the eastern part of Ghana, to sell her products. She travels twice a week to buy her products and it takes her twelve hours to arrive in the north. She therefore wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of beans, groundnuts, and bags of brown rice to avoid price hikes and also to reduce her frequent travel.

She is a member of the group called “Eye Nyame” (meaning it is God). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Akuffu’s photo was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more beans, bags of rice, and groundnuts

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45880

loans.name: Refija

texts.en: Refija was born in 1988 and lives with her husband in the town Visoko. They have one child. Refija's husband sells vehicle parts and earns about 800 KM monthly. This is her first loan, in the amount of 1450 KM, and she wants to invest it in expanding her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy additional vehicle parts.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Born around 1967 in ZANGNANADO in ZOU county in central Benin, Ms. Marie D. is married and a mother with one child to take care of. She is a distributor, wholesale as well as retail, of pagnes (colorful printed fabrics) of wide-ranging quality. An energetic individual, she has very good advantages in terms of selling power. Also, she enjoys a fair amount of fame among those close to her. Currently, she is experiencing some trouble because the demand is very strong, and the necessary goods to meet it are lacking, due to financial means. And so she is applying for this loan to resupply her inventory in order to meet the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née vers les années 1967 à ZANGNANADO dans le département du ZOU au centre du BENIN, dame D. Marie est mariée et mère d’un enfant à charge. Elle est une distributrice en gros comme en détail de pagne de diverses qualités. Très dynamique, elle possède de très bons atouts en termes de force de vente. Aussi, jouit elle d’une notoriété non moins négligeable dans son entourage. Actuellement, dame D. Marie éprouve des difficultés car la demande est très forte et les produits nécessaires à cet effet manquent, faute de moyens financiers. Pour cela, elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’approvisionner afin de répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 25 lengths of pagne

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is twenty-six years old and the mother of two children. Her two kids are currently in school. She travels to buy cartons of fresh fish from the largest man-made lake in the world, Lake Volta in the Volta Region of Ghana. She then comes back to Koforidua and smokes the fish for the market. Smoked fish is a delicacy for most Ghanaians. She wants to use her new loan to buy more cartons of fish to expand her business and also to reduce her frequent trips to Volta as she presently travels twice a week to the fishing village.

She is a member of the group called “Eye Nyame” (meaning, it is God). Members happily guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Esther’s photo was taken at a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy boxes of fresh fish

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45883

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr:
Born on July 3, 1960 in APLAHOUE in MONO county in the south-west of Benin, Ms. Lucie G. is married and the mother of two children. She sells various goods, such as canned food, soap, liquor, and other items. She has a lot of experience in selling diverse goods which enables her to have many customers each day. She is applying for this loan to widen her field of business and to meet the expectations of her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 3 juillet 1960 à APLAHOUE dans le département du MONO au sud-ouest du BENIN, dame G. Lucie est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de produits divers tels que les boîtes de conserve, les savons, les liqueurs et autres. Elle a une grande expérience dans la vente des produits divers ce qui lui permet d’avoir beaucoup de clients par jour. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour élargir son champ d’activité et pour satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of soap, 5 cartons of table wine, 12 cartons of canned food, 2 cartons of liquor, and 3 cartons of cookies

loans.name: Zineta

texts.en:
Zineta was born in 1957 and is married with two children, one of which goes to primary school. She is from a small village, Čajno, near the town Visoko. Neither she nor her husband have a job. Together they do agricultural work, and this is their only source of income. They can earn about 700 KM monthly.

This is Zineta's first loan, in the amount of 1450 KM, and she will use this loan to buy food for the livestock.

loans.use: To buy food for livestock.

loans.name: Matha's Ngarani Group

texts.en:
Matha is 49 years old and is married with 6 children whose ages range from 9 to 20 years old. Matha owns a small shop, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (like sugar, salt, blue band) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in food vending, fish sales, and soap sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (such as sugar, salt, and blue band) for her business.

loans.name: Lea's Ngarani Group

texts.en:
Lea is 30 years old and is married with 4 children, whose ages range from 2 to 10 years old. Lea is a fish seller. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 11am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in soap sales and fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Stanislas

texts.fr:
Born around 1952 in PORTO NOVO in the political capital of Benin, Mr. Stanislas C. is married and the father of five children. Schooling and other expenses for his children are his responsibility to meet. Having good morals, he is on his fifth loan with our institution for which he is requesting 500,000 francs CFA to buy red oil and various chemical products for making soap. Each day he produces an average of 120 bars of laundry soap, which he sells at 100 francs each. His soap lathers up very nicely and is in high demand by his customers. This loan will enable him to increase his production capacity and to meet the expectations of his customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né vers les années 1952 à PORTO NOVO dans la capitale politique du BENIN, monsieur C. Stanislas est marié et père de 5 enfants. La scolarité et autres charges de ses enfants sont à sa charge. De bonne moralité, monsieur C. Stanislas est à son cinquième prêt au niveau de notre institution pour lequel il demande 500 000 en vue de l’achat d’huile rouge et de divers produits chimiques servant à la fabrication de savons. Il produit par jour en moyenne 120 pains de savon de lessive qu'il vend à 100 FCFA l'unité. Ses savons moussent très bien et font l'objet d'une grande demande de la part de ses clients. Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter ses capacités de production et de satisfaire au mieux ses clients.

loans.use: To buy 250 liters of palm oil (red oil) and different chemical products

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en: Jasmina is from a small village Čajno, near the town Visoko. She is 30 years old and married. Jasmina and her husband are buying metallic and non-metallic raw materials and then resell it to the recycling factories. They want to expand this business with this loan in order to increase their monthly income.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Catherine's Ngarani Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 36 years old and is single with 3 children, ages 9, 7, and 4 years old. Catherine is a fish seller. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 1am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Esta, who has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Faizali

texts.ru:
Faizali S. lives in Rudaki region. He is married and has 3 children. He has not finished high school Faizali has a business. He has a large car, which he uses as a taxi. He works at a local market transporting goods for customers. He has been in this business for 4 years. The taxi brings him enough profit to live. Currently, this is the only source of income for his family. Any serious problem with a car puts his family in a financial crisis.

Now, Faizali needs to do serious car repairs, which costs money. This is why he came to us to apply for a loan. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Сафаров Файзали живет в районе Рудаки. Женат , имеет 3 детей. Образования не имеет . Но имеет свое дело. Имеет автомашину – грузовой москвич, использует который как такси. Работает на рынке и перевозит грузы покупателей. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 4 года. Такси приносит ему доход , который хватает на жизнь. Сейчас это единственный источник дохода его семьи. Поэтому любая поломка машины приводит к финансовому кризису. Сейчас ему необходимо произвести капитальный ремонт автомобиля, для которого нужны деньги. Ему пришлось обратится к нам за кредитом. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 22 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 4 and 1 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other people, ages 14, 29, and 31. Monica owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 39-year-old married woman from Tojšići, a small village near the town Kalesija. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 700 KM.

Fatima does agricultural work and cattle breeding as an additional source of income. She has two children, 12 and 14 years old. Fatima will use this loan in the amount of 600 KM to buy chickens to fatten. She intends to then sell the chickens and earn enough money to provide education for her older son.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Janeth's Masuguru C Group

texts.en:
Janeth is 45 years old and is widow with 3 children whose ages range from 20 to 34 years old. Janeth is a fish seller. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Hawa, Subira, and Saumu, who have businesses in soap and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy mor fish for her business.

loans.name: Šemsa

texts.en:
Šemsa is a 35-year-old married woman from the small village Tojšići, near the town of Kalesija. Her husband is a seasonal construction worker and earns about 600 KM monthly.

Šemsa earns additional money for her family by doing agricultural work and breeding cattle. She intends to buy chickens to fatten and sell in order to expand her agricultural business and earn enough money to support her two children, who go to primary school.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is 27 years old and is married with 2 children, 9 and 5 years old. Sauda is a fish seller. She started her business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa was born in 1970 and lives with her husband in a small suburb of the town Kalesija. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 400 KM. They earn additional income by doing agriculture and breeding cattle. Hanifa will use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM to buy more cattle in order to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Hai Arapi 2044-3 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret P.. She is currently in the business of selling breads and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Margret is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children ranging from age 12 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Margret is joined in her small group by Agnes P., Esther G., Margret A. , and Madelina M.. Agnes P. has a bar business and wants to expand her bar. Esther G. is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to expand the hotel. Margret A. operates a business of making tea and wants to expand the business. Madelina M. is currently in the business of selling alcohol and is requesting a loan to educate her children.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 30 years old and is single. She take care of one person who is 80 years old. Saumu is a coconut seller. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more coconuts for her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Zineta

texts.en:
Zineta was born in 1976 and is from the town Kalesija. Her husband is a seasonal worker; when he works he can earn about 1000 KM monthly. They live with Zineta's mother-in-law and their three children, two of whom go to primary school.

Zineta breeds cattle and earns money by selling the milk to dairy plants. This is her first loan, for 600 KM. Zineta will buy chickens to fatten. Her wish is to increase monthly income and to improve the living standard for her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is 26 years old and is single. She takes care of one person, who is 18 years old. Shida owns a small shop, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 9am to 20pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Mwansiti's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Mwansiti is 39 years old and is married with 4 children whose ages range from 9 to 20 years old. Mwansiti is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 9am to 10pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in clothing sales and soft drink sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara is a married woman with 3 children, ages16, 11, and 1 years old. Zahara is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr:
Mr. D. is a professional tailor in the big open-air market called Ndoumbé DIOP. He has been in this business for 40 years.

As he gets older, he has specialized in sewing traditional African women's clothing since that is less stressful and quite profitable without calling for a lot of expense.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mr D. est tailleur de profession dans le grand marché « Ndoumbé DIOP », il exerce cette profession depuis 40 ans. Rattrapé par l’age, il s’est spécialisé dans la confection de pagnes pour dame car il produit moins d’efforts et la rentabilité là dessus est relativement intéressante, et ne nécessite pas beaucoup de dépenses.

loans.use:
to purchase cloth and other sewing necessities

Pour acheter des tissus et autres produits entrant dans la fabrication.

loans.name: La Amistad De San Miguel Group

texts.es:
This committee from the La Amistad San Miguel neighborhood resulted from contact with a group from another neighborhood. They have held meetings to organize themselves and the committee is currently made up of 15 working women who take out loans as a group, always repaying on time.

The activities of these women include: general store, seamstress, sale of clothing, sale of cosmetics, sale of a variety of goods, sale of natural remedies, sale of vegetables, newstands, sale of jewelry and others. Each member receives an equal part of the loan to purchase goods for their businesses.

Now they would like to acquire a new loan, which will allow them to continue investing in their businesses, which form the basis of their family economy since all are wives and mothers who contribute to the household income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Este comité del Barrio La Amistad San Miguel ha surgido por contacto de otro grupo formado en un barrio vecino. Se han realizado las reuniones requeridas para la conformación y actualmente el comité esta integrado por 15 mujeres trabajadoras que retiran créditos de forma solidaria pagándolas siempre con puntualidad.

Las actividades de estas señoras consisten en: despensas, costureras, venta de ropas, venta de cosméticos, venta de mercaderías varias, venta de remedios naturales, venta de verduras, kioscos, venta de bijouterie, y otros. Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de G. 550.000 para reinvertirlos en sus negocios en compra de mercaderías para sus negocios.

Hoy ellas desean adquirir un nuevo crédito que les permitirá seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios que son la base de su economía familiar, ya que todas son esposas y madres que aportan para los ingresos de sus hogares.

loans.use: Purchase products for their businesses, such as clothing, cosmetics, footwear, sewing notions, flour, bakery goods, canned products, rice, pastas, drinks, fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, lace, jewelry, seeds for growing vegetables, natural remedies and others.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
This elderly lady lives in the outskirts of Diourbel, in the Ndayane neighborhood. She is a housewife and mother of 7 children. When she has leisure time, she sells couscous which she prepares at home. She has a problem with local cereal grains that she uses to make the product she sells. During the bad rainy season, the cereal prices are very high and she needs to stock up in order to make a profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Cette vieille dame habite la banlieue de Diourbel, dans le quartier de Ndayane. Elle est ménagère et mère de 7 enfants à charge. Dans ses heures creuses, elle vend du couscous qu’elle prépare à son domicile. Elle est confrontée à un problème de céréales locales qui sont les intrants dans la fabrication du produit. Avec le mauvais hivernage, les cours des matières sont très élevés et pour faire des économies il faut constituer un stock.

loans.use:
purchase of local cereals

Achat de céréales locales

loans.name: María Felipa

texts.es:
María B. is married and the mother of 2 children. They live in a rented house in Encarnación. María was born and raised in another city, but when she was older came to live with her husband and started her own business.

Previously María and her husband sold different goods by request, which they brought from Ciudad del Este and sold in Encarnación. After seven years and thanks to good profits generated by their sales, they were able to start up their own store. Today, after three years of operation, the business has grown quite a bit and they now have a van which they use for deliveries and to buy their goods.

The name of their store is "Nueva Esperanza" and they sell a variety of merchandise such as articles for the home like plates, flatware, pitchers, pictures and other various goods such as toys, flip flops, shoes, dolls, wading pools, etc. They have two employees to take care of the store and, thankfully, things are going well and they are able to support their family.

Now they are requesting a new loan to buy more merchandise so they can keep a greater variety of stock in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María B., es casada y madre de 2 hijos, ellos viven en una casa alquilada en Encarnación, María nació y creció en otra ciudad, pero de grande vino a vivir con su esposo y monto su propio negocio.

Anteriormente, María y su esposo, se dedicaban a la venta bajo pedido de artículos varios que traían de Ciudad del Este y que vendían en Encarnación; luego de siete años y gracias a las buenas ganancias generadas de sus ventas, ellos montaron su propio negocio fijo. Hoy día ya el comercio ha crecido bastante luego de tres años de funcionamiento y ya tienen también una camioneta que lo utilizan para repartos y compras de mercaderías.

El nombre de su tienda es “Nueva Esperanza” y en la misma comercializan distintos tipos de mercaderías como artículos para el hogar como platos, cubiertos, jarras, cuadros; artículos de bazar como juguetes, zapatillas, zapatos, muñecas, piscinas de plásticos, entre otros. Ellos emplean a dos personales más para la atención del negocio que gracias a Dios marcha muy bien y les permite ganarse el sustento para la familia.

Hoy día solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar más mercaderías para de este modo poder mantener mayor variedad de stock en el negocio.

.

loans.use: Purchase plates, glassware, flatware, toys, shoes, flip flops, frames, tablecloths, wallets, stationery supplies, etc.

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr:
This young woman lives in the outskirts of the town of Diourbel, to be precise in the neighborhood of Ndayane. She has a problem in that she has no place to sell her products from, so she does ambulant sales. She makes and sells incense, but she also gets products on credit from shopowners such as soaps and other personal care products. She wants to reinforce her little business venture.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Cette jeune dame habite la banlieue de la ville de Diourbel, précisément le vieux quartier de Ndayane, confrontée à un problème local pour abriter ses produits, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce ambulant. Elle fabrique et vend de l’encense, mais aussi, elle travaille avec les boutiquiers qui lui donnent des produits à crédits comme les savons, et autres produits de nettoyage. Elle veut renforcer ses activités

loans.use:
to reinforce her little business venture

Renforcer ses activités

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #45908

loans.name: Cecundina Vicenta De

texts.es:
Cecundina is 50 years old and is in the business of buying and selling potatoes, which she she has been doing in the area of Gran Poder for the past 17 years. She has lived with her family in the Villa Juliana neighborhood for the past 11 years. Her son does bodywork and painting for cars and has 4 years of experience.

Her business is her own and she developed it with the help of her huband, their sales are at the wholesale level. Although is a lot of competition, Cecundina and her husband have a great deal of experience and in addition, give preferential treatment to their clients, which allows them to be able to count on loyal customers.

This current loan request is to to buy potatoes to sell at wholesale. Cecundina does not have an unfavorable credit history and is considered a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Cecundina de 50 años de edad se dedica a la compra y venta de papa, misma que la comercializa en la zona del Gran poder desde hace más de 17 años atrás. Cecundina vive junto a su familia en la zona Villa Juliana desde hace más de 11 años atrás, su hijo se dedica a la chapería de autos y cuenta con 4 años de experiencia.

El negocio es propio y lo desarrolla con la ayuda de su esposo, ya que la comercialización se la realiza al por mayor. Si bien existe competencia en este rubro, Cecundina y su esposo cuentan con mucha experiencia además que dan un trato preferencial a sus clientes lo cuál les permite contar con clientela fija.

La presente solicitud será para la adquisición de papa, para poder comercializarla al por mayor. Cecundina no tiene malos antecedentes crediticios, por lo que se la considera una persona responsable.

loans.use: Purchase goods.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
She is married and the mother of 6 children. She sells her products in the big open-air market of Diourbel. Her business consists in buying locally grown fruit to retail, such as mangoes, oranges, bananas, and local cereals. She would like to reinforce this business venture.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants, elle fait du commerce dans le grand marché de Diourbel. Cette activité consiste à acheter des fruits du pays pour les revendre au détail, comme les mangues, oranges, bananes et autres céréales locales pour renforcer ses activités.

loans.use:
to reinforce her business venture

Pour renforcer ses activités

loans.name: Maria Fidencia

texts.es:
Maria started the business, a small general store, 4 years ago with the hope that she could contribute to paying household expenses and to building an extra room for her parents who live with her. They're a large family for a small house and space is tight. Maria is married and has 2 children, 14 and 12. Her husband is a construction worker.

Maria is applying for a US$400 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, Maria can move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María Fidencia inicio el negocio hace 4 años una pequeña tienda de abarrotes lo realizo con la ilusión de poder contribuir económicamente a los gastos del hogar y construir un cuarto ya que viven en casa de sus padres y son muchos de familia para esa casa, por lo que viven en condiciones limitadas. Ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años, su esposo trabaja como albañil.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu contribución María seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda is 29 years old and works in the production and sale of stoves and solar ovens. Her family is made up of 3 children, 10, 7 and 3 years old, respectively. Leonarda is responsible for taking care of her children and the business. She receives some help from her mother to care for the children and for attending to the business.

Leonarda has been in this business for a long time. She herself produces the stoves and solar ovens, which she then sells in the provinces. She has some competition; however, her products are of good quality and are well accepted. Leonarda has found her market niche because her products are so different.

With a loan, she will buy raw materials for making her stoves and solar ovens. One of the materials she needs is wool, which she buys at the border with Peru, where price and quality are better.

This is her fifth loan, and all previous loans were repaid without problems.

It should be noted that on a visit of KIVA officials to Cochabamba, Bolivia, they had the opportunity to meet this micro-businesswoman in our central offices.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Leonarda de 29 años de edad se dedica a la producción y venta de cocinas y hornos solares. Tiene una familia que está compuesta por 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 3 años respectivamente. Leonarda es quien cuida de sus hijos y atiende el negocio, tambien recibe alguna ayuda de parte de la mamá para el cuidado de los hijos y para la atencion del negocio.

Leonarda se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho. Ella misma es quien produce las cocinas y hornos solares los cuales comercializa despues en las provincias. Cuenta con alguna competencia, sin embargo sus productos son de muy buena calidad y tienen bastante aceptacion. Leonarda ha encontrado un nicho en el mercado. Por lo novedoso de sus productos.

Con el credito obtenido, procedera a la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de sus cocinas y hornos solares. Una de las materias primas que ella necesita es la lana de oveja que adquiere en la frontera con Perú, ya que ella consigue mejores precios y calidad.

Es la quinta secuencia de la cliente. Los anteriores creditos los canceló con normalidad.

Se hace notar que en las visitas de funcionaR. de KIVA por Cochabamba - Bolivia tuvieron la oportunidad de conocer a nuestra microempresaria en la oficina central.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Coumba L. is a housewife with some training gleaned from the PDEF literacy project in Ndayane. She proposes to open a little grocery store in her neighborhood. She is able to keep quite clear accounts and needs capital to expand her stock of merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Coumba L. est une dame ménagère, avec quelques formations glanées au niveau du projet PDEF de Ndayane sur l’alphabétisation, elle s’est proposée d’ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation dans son quartier. Elle tient une comptabilité assez claire et voudrait un fonds pour renforcer son stock de marchandises

loans.use:
to open a little grocery store in her neighborhood

Pour ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation dans son quartier.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De San Pedro Group

texts.es:
This committee from the San Pedro Vivienda neighborhood resulted from contact made in the office in Encarnación with one of the first groups of this type. After a series of informational meetings about the project, the women enthusiastically formed their committee.

The committee is made up of 15 working women and houswives who carry out different activities to help with their family income and provide education and food for their children. Among the various activites they do are: general store, bakery, bar, sale of clothing, sale of cosmetics, sale of a variety of goods, sale of food, jewely, chipas (a typical dish form Paraguay), sale of cleaning supplies and others. Each member receives an equal amount of the group loan.

Their previous loans were paid on time. This group is very united and organized, as in addition to their businesses, they organize various activities to raise funds which they divide up for their personal savings. They would like a new loan to invest in their businesses and to continue to grow as micro-businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Este comité del Barrio San Pedro Vivienda ha surgido por contacto realizado con uno de los primeros grupos formados en la oficina de Encarnación. Luego de realizarse las reuniones de información del proyecto requeridas, las señoras formaron su comité con mucho entusiasmo.

El comité está conformado por 15 mujeres trabajadoras y amas de casa que realizan sus diferentes actividades para colaborar con los ingresos de la familia y proveer de educación y comida a sus hijos. Entre las diversas actividades que desempeñan están: despensas, repostería, cantinas, venta de ropas, venta de cosméticos, venta de mercaderías varias, venta de comidas, bijouterie, chipas (comida típica de Paraguay), venta de artículos de limpieza, entre otros. Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de G.880.000 como crédito.

Los créditos anteriores fueron pagados con puntualidad, el grupo se caracteriza por ser muy unido y organizado, ya que además de las ventas que realizan, ellas organizan actividades diversas para recaudar fondos que se dividen para sus ahorros personales.

Ellas desean adquirir un nuevo crédito para reinvertirlo en sus negocios y de este modo seguir creciendo en el ámbito microempresarial.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, cosmetics, flour, bakery goods, canned products, rice, pastas, drinks, jewelry, footwear and other goods.

loans.name: Tamarindo 3 Group

texts.es:
Irma is 32 years old and has five children. Two years ago she started a business from home, a grocery store where she offers sugar, salt, pastas, cookies and soft drinks to the general public. She buys her goods in a nearby town, Ixtapa, which is located 30 minutes from her town. She belongs to the "Tamarindo 3" Solidarity Group, along with Julia Pérez Pérez (sale of clothing) and Juana Pérez González (sale of food typical of the region, tamales). With their loans, they will buy goods so they can expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

IRMA TIENE 32 AÑOS DE EDAD Y TIENE CINCO HIJOS. HACE DOS AÑOS INICIO UN NEGOCIO EN SU CASA, TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN DONDE OFRECE AL PUBLICO EN GENERAL AZUCAR, SAL, PASTAS, GALLETAS, REFRESCOS. SU MERCANCIA LO ADQUIERE EN EL PUEBLO MAS CERCANO, IXTAPA UBICADO A 30 MINUTOS DE SU LOCALIDAD. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO TAMARINDO 3 JUNTO CON SUS COMPAÑERAS JULIA P. P. (VENTA DE ROPA) Y JUANA P. G. (VENTA DE COMIDA TIPICA DE SU LOCALIDAD, TAMALES). CON SUS PRESTAMOS ADQUIRIRAN MERCANCIA PARA AMPLIAR SUS NEGOCIOS.

loans.use: Purchase goods for their businesses.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Bùi Thị M., 58 years old, joined TYM as a member in 2002. She lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her husband and their 3 children. Her main occupation is tending her rice field and raising poultry. Before joining TYM, she had only a dozen of chickens. Her monthly income was 30 USD. Today, there are about 200 heads in her chicken coop. These are egg laying chickens as well as for their meat. Her income has increased to 130 USD a month. Her husband is a peasant farmer. He always helps her out when she needs a hand. This time she is requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy feed for her chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị M., 58 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2002. Chị sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Công việc chủ yếu của chị là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi gà. Lúc trước chị M. chỉ có khoảng trên dưới chục con gà, thu nhập từ chăn nuôi chỉ có 30USD/tháng. Sau khi vào Quỹ, lượng vốn đầu tư tăng lên, hiện trong chuồng nhà chị có hơn 200 con gà thịt và gà đẻ. Thu nhập hàng tháng cũng tăng lên 130USD. Chồng chị M., một người nông dân hiền lành, chất phác, luôn giúp đỡ chị trong công việc đồng áng và chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD để mua thức ăn cho đàn gà của mình.

loans.use: Buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đào Thị Huê, 30 years old. She is a 7th year TYM member. She raises pigs and brews rice wine. Her husband, Mr Đảm, owns a retail business in animal feed so it is very favorable situation for Mrs Huê. She has a dozen of pigs, each weighing about 100 kg. Her family income is 230-250 USD a month. They are able to provide good education for their 2 children. She has never been late in her payment during 7 years. This time she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to expand her business: she will buy more piglets and feed for the herd.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Huê, 30 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 7 của Quỹ Tình thương. Công việc của chị là chăn nuôi lợn kết hợp với nấu rượu. Anh Đảm, chồng chị, chuyên kinh doanh thức ăn gia súc, gia cầm nên công việc của chị Huê càng thêm thuận lợi. Đàn lợn hơn chục con của chị Huê con nào cũng trên dưới 1 tạ. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình 230-250USD. Kinh tế phát triển, hai con của anh chị luôn được tạo điều kiện học hành chu đáo. Trong suốt thời gian tham gia chưa bao giờ chị Huê chậm trễ trong việc hoàn trả tuần. Vòng vốn này chị Huê xin vay 1200USD để đầu tư mở rộng chăn nuôi. (mua lợn và thức ăn gia súc)

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Tạ Thị Hòa is 50 years old. She has been raising pigs for the last 10 years. She lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her husband and their 3 children. Before joining TYM, she did not have enough capital to invest in a business so she was only able to make enough money to live. After joining TYM, she had the opportunity to expand her pig raising business with the loans. Today, she has a few dozens pigs. Every year, she sells 5 batches of pigs worth 10000 USD. She is very confident in her business so she always applies for max loan every time. She is requesting 1200 USD this time.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tạ Thị Hòa, 50 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi được 10 năm nay. Chị đang sống cùng chồng, một nông dân, và 3 người con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Công việc của chị là chăn nuôi lợn, bò sinh sản phục vụ cho người dân nơi chị sinh sống. Trước khi vào Quỹ do lượng vốn đầu tư ít nên lợi nhuận thu được chỉ đủ chi tiêu trong gia đình và để ra không đáng kể. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ chị Hòa có điều kiện mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi của mình hơn. Trong chuồng nhà chị luôn có vài chục con lợn. Mỗi năm chị Hòa cho xuất chuồng 5 lứa lợn trị giá trên dưới 10000USD. Phấn khởi trước những kết quả đạt được, chị luôn đề nghị mức vốn tối đa tại các vòng vốn. Số vốn chị định vay lần này là 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Hà Thị N., 52, is a 7th year member of TYM fund. She has 2 children: 30 and 25 years old. TYM has given her the opportunity to build up a business which would provide her a stable income and be self sufficient. She raises pigs and brews rice wine. She has a lot of successes with her pigs: they are always in good health and meaty. The money generated by her rice wine brewing business is used to make the weekly payment, sometime with the help of her husband. After 5 years of doing this, her monthly income has increased to 150 USD. Since she's being successful, she is requesting a new loan of 1200 USD to buy breeding pigs and pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hà Thị N., 52 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 7 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chị có 2 con: 30 và 25 tuổi. Tham gia Quỹ, không chỉ được vay vốn, chị N. còn được đào tạo và tự xây dựng cho mình được một kế hoạch hợp lý cho việc làm ăn chi tiêu hàng ngày. Dự án của chị là nấu rượu kết hợp với chăn nuôi lợn. Nhờ mát tay nuôi nên đàn lợn của chị luôn béo tốt, khỏe mạnh. Nguồn hoàn trả tuần được lấy từ tiền bán rượu và sự hỗ trợ của chồng. Sau 5 năm làm dự án này thu nhập bình quân của chị N. đạt 150USD/tháng. Sử dụng vốn vay tốt, hoàn trả thuận lợi, vòng vốn này chị xin vay mức 625USD để mua lợn giống và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Mujeres En Pregreso Group

texts.es:
This partnership from the neighbourhood of Santo Domingo emerged when the members of another group from the same neighbourhood broke up. The majority of the members formed a new group. They have held the necessary meetings for the formation of a partnership. It is currently made up of fifteen hardworking women involved in the following activities: food preparation, hairdressing, sale of clothing, other retail businesses such as groceries, food, natural remedies, vegetables, baked goods, clothing, the raising of poultry, etc. Each group member receives an average of 300,000 Gs that she reinvests by buying merchandise or ingredients for making various products to sell.

These women are real go-getters. As well as running their businesses, they are also wives and mothers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Este comité del Barrio Santo Domingo ha surgido por medio de las integrantes de otro comité del mismo Barrio el cual se ha desintegrado, pero la mayoría de sus integrantes formaron un nuevo comité. Se han realizado las reuniones requeridas para la conformación y actualmente el comité esta integrado por 15 mujeres trabajadoras. Las actividades de estas señoras consisten en: comedores, peluquería, venta de ropas, Venta de mercaderías varias, venta de comestibles, venta de remedos naturales, venta de verduras, repostería, venta de ropas, cría de pollos y otros. Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de 300.000 Gs. que lo reinvierten comprando mercaderías o insumos para la elaboración de sus productos a vender.

Estas son mujeres luchadoras que además de llevar adelante sus negocios, también deben cumplir sus roles de madres y esposas en sus hogares.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, hair products, ingredients for the preparation of food, flour, baking products, canned goods, rice, noodles, drinks, baby chicks, natural medicines, ingredients for cakes, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is forty-five years old and she is a married woman with five children. All her children are in school. She sells foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, fresh yams, palm nuts, etc in her village in the eastern region. Janet buys the farm produce from a neighboring village and retails them in Koforidua.

She wants to use a new loan to buy more foodstuffs to expand her operation so that she raises enough income to support her children’s education. She is a member of the group called “Eye Nyame” (meaning "It is God"). Members exert peer pressure on themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

Janet’s photo was taken at the group’s meeting.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like cassava, plantain, fresh tubers of yam

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45921

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Hoàng Thị Lộc, 55 years old, lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her husband and their 3 children. They have been raising cows for the last 5 years. This type of business requires a lot of capital. When she was able to qualify for a big loan, she started to invest into this business. Usually she buys calves, raises them and sells them after a few months or whenever she could get good prices for her animals. Her monthly revenue is about 100 USD after expenses. Her husband, Nguyễn Đình Lệ, is a construction worker. He and their oldest son take care of the weekly payment of the loan for her. Together, their family income is 200-220 USD a month. Since her business is successful and it suits her perfectly (not physical) she continues to apply for a loan from TYM. This time she requests 950 USD .

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Lộc, 55 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Gia đình chị làm nghề chăn nuôi bò từ 5 năm nay. Đây là một công việc đòi hỏi nguồn tài chính tương đối lớn nên sau khi được phép vay mức vốn cao chị Lộc mới đầu tư cho dự án này. Chị thường mua nghé, nuôi trong vài tháng, đến khi trưởng thành hoặc được giá, chị bán lại. Sau khi trừ các khoản chi phí trung bình một tháng chị Lộc lãi khoảng 100USD. Nguồn hoàn trả hàng tuần do chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Đình Lệ, một thợ xây và người con lớn hỗ trợ. Thu nhập của cả gia đình khoảng 200-220USD/tháng. Công việc tiến triển thuận lợi, lại phù hợp với lứa tuổi của chị nên vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay để tiếp tục đầu tư vào dự án. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Lộc là 950USD.

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Bé, 53 years old, lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her family. She has 2 children: 1 son and 1 daughter, both are grown up. She owns an internet cafe. Since people use internet as a mean of communication, her cafe is always busy. Since it is open all day long, her husband and her children would drop by and help her out whenever they have free time. The income form her internet cafe is stable so making the weekly payment is not a problem for her. The internet cafe brings in, on average, 220 USD a month. She wishes to expand her cafe e.g. buy more computers. She is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to expand her business to better serve her customers and to increase her revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Bé, 53 tuổi, sống cùng gia đình tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Chị có hai con, 1 trai, 1 gái đều đã trưởng thành. Công việc của chị là kinh doanh dịch vụ internet. Trong thời buổi hiện nay, nhu cầu tìm hiểu thông tin rất nhiều nên cửa hàng của chị Bé luôn đông khách. Cửa hàng mở cửa cả ngày nên chồng và các con những lúc nhàn rỗi luôn phải hỗ trợ trông coi. Thu nhập đều đặn nên việc hoàn trả tuần cũng thuận tiện. Hàng tháng chị Bé thu trung bình khoảng 220USD. Công việc kinh doanh phát triển nên chị luôn muốn mở rộng quy mô dự án. Vòng vốn này chị Bé xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm máy mới đáp ứng thêm nhu cầu người dân, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Thơ is 50 years old. She joined TYM fund 5 years ago. She lives in Lương Bằng with her husband and their 3 children. Their children are all adults now. She raises pigs and grow fruits. Her land is filled with dates, guavas, apples ... There are 2 crops a year. The revenue from the sales of the pigs and the fruit is a few thousands USD a year. She is a hard working woman and her husband is very supportive of her. With the help of her husband and her children, she has never been late in her payment. This time she is requesting a loan of 625 USD to buy new fruit plants and pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Thơ, 50 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chị sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại thị trấn Lương Bằng. Các con chị đều trên 18 tuổi. Công việc chính của chị là chăn nuôi lợn và trồng cây ăn quả. Vườn của chị chủ yếu trồng các loại táo, na, ổi ... mỗi năm cho thu hoạch 1 đến 2 vụ. Thu nhập hàng năm từ vườn cây và chăn nuôi lên đến vài nghìn USD. Nhờ cố gắng của bản thân cộng với sự hỗ trợ tích cực của chồng con nên chị Thơ luôn tham gia sinh hoạt và hoàn trả đầy đủ cho Quỹ. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 625USD mua thêm một số giống cây mới và mua thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy fruit plants and pig mash

loans.name: Concepcion De

texts.es:
Concepción is 64 years old and sells food in the Villa México market. She also rents out crockery. She lives with her husband and 30-year old son. Her husband helps her out in the business as well working in construction. Her son lives with his parents but is completely independent. Concepción and her husband have managed the business for a long time. She prepares the food in her own home and then goes to the market to sell it. She’s had more than 17 years of experience selling food and also gets income from her crockery rental business. There isn’t a lot of competition since not many people are in this line of business, and as she’s been around for a long time, she has a permanent stall in the market. She is well known by both customers and the shopkeepers. With the loan she plans to build a roof on her house. This is Concepción’s third loan. Her previous loans were paid back as planned although it should be mentioned that they were a few days late.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Concepción de 64 años de edad se dedica a la venta de comidas en el mercado de Villa México y también al alquiler de vajilla. Concepción vive sola con su esposo y su hijo de 30 años. El esposo es quien le ayuda en las actividades del comercio, tambien se dedica a la construccion. Por otra parte, el hijo solo vive con sus padres ya que es completamente independiente. Concepción se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo junto a su esposo. Las comidas las prepara en su domicilio particular, para luego ir a venderlas en el mercado, cuenta con mas de 17 años de experiencia en la venta de comidas. Adicionalmente cuenta con ingresos del alquiler de vajillas. Cuenta con competencia moderada, ya que no son muchas las vendedoras del mismo rubro. por otra parte, tiene un puesto fijo en el mercado por ser antigua. Y es bastante conocida en el mercado por clientes y comerciantes. Con el credito obtenido, efectuará trabajos de techado en su domicilio. Es la tercera sencuencia de la Concepción. Los anteriores créditos los canceló con normalidad, cabe mencionar que tuvo algunos días de retraso.

loans.use: Roof construction

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
María Teresa is originally from Guadalupe, Nuevo León, México. She is married and has four children. Her husband works for a trash collection company and earns very low wages. When Maria Teresa would bring lunch to her husband at work, his co-workers started asking to buy food from her as well. Because her food is very good, she soon had many paying customers. This is how she started her business four years ago.

Maria Teresa wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $675 to pay back in 6 months, which she will use to buy a new stove in order to cook many different foods at the same time, and offer more variety to her customers. You can help Maria Teresa to improve her business and help her to give her family the best quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new stove

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret fries fish and chicken thighs and retail them in the market. She has been in this operation for the past twenty-five years. She travels twice a week to Tema Harbour to buy her frozen products. Her working capital has gone down due to price hikes both in the products and transportation costs. She therefore wants to use her new loan to buy more cartons of fish and chicken thighs so that she can increase sales and income to support her family of seven children, with four currently in school.

She is a member of the group called “Eye Nyame” (meaning "It is God"). Members agree in principal to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

Margaret’s photo was taken at the group’s meeting.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of frozen fish and chicken thighs.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 45927

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia is 40 years old and has been married to Victor for 15 years. He is 42 years old. Together they have three lovely children aged 20, 12, and 8.

Basilia notes that she only completed three years of secondary school as she came from a very poor family.

Through her own efforts and some financial assistance, some thirteen years ago Basilia was able to open a small store in her home. Her husband meanwhile works for a company specializing in the erection of telecommunication towers.

Because of her store and the income that her husband brings in, today they own their home and a vehicle. Currently the business generates a good profit, and Basilia dreams of opening a minimarket one day. Right now she needs the loan for the purchase of items such as sugar, rice, flour, baked products, milk products, and thus increase the range of products in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Basilia tiene 40 años, está casada hace 15 años con Victor que tiene 42 años de esta unión nacieron 3 hermosos hijos de 20, 12 y 8 años respectivamente.

Basilia comenta que solo pudo terminar sus estudios hasta el 3er. Curso de la secundaria debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde.

Basilia gracias al esfuerzo y un capital pudo montar una pequeña despensa hace mas de 13 años en su casa, mientras que su esposo trabaja en una empresa especializada en montajes de torres para antenas de celulares.

Gracias a su despensa y a los ingresos que aporta su esposo, hoy día cuentan con casa y vehiculo propios, actualmente el negocio le genera muy buenas ganancias y sueña con poner algún día un minimercado>p> En esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: azúcar, arroz, harina, panificados, lácteos y así surtir mejor su despensa.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, different types of drinks, rice etc.

loans.name: Melissa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. S. G. lives in the Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan, house # R-22, where she lives together with her family, which is compose of her husband and two school-aged children, one in the fifth grade of primary school and the other, eight years old and in the third grade. Through her own effort she has been able to establish a beauty salon in her home, which allows her to provide services to local customers and provide home service including hairstyling, cuts, manicures and decorations for hands and feet. This provides her with an income to guarantee the wellbeing of her family and consolidate her small business. Because her clientele demands it, she is available twenty-four hours. Her husband works as a customer assistant in a supermarket and helps sustain the household. She is requesting a loan of $1,100.00 to buy an chair for her beauty salon that would help with haircuts for both men and women; this would improve her income and the conditions of her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. S. G. habita en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan, casa # R-22, donde habita junto a su familia compuesta por su marido y 2 hijos en edad escolar, 10 años en 5to grado de primaria y el otro en 3er grado, de 8 años de edad; por esfuerzo propio ha logrado establecer un salon de belleza en su casa de habitacion, lo que le permite brindar servicio a clientes locales y brinda servicio a domicilio realizando peinados, cortes, manicure y decoraciones de mano y pies, lo que le brinda ingresos para garantizar el bienestar familiar y consolidar su pequeño negocio; está disponible las 24 horas, ya que su clientela asi lo demanda; el marido labora como despachador en supermercado y apoya a la sotenibilidad del hogar, solicita credito por C$.20,000.00 para adquirir una silla adecuada para su salon de belleza. Y así poder mejorar la atención a sus clientes y por ende los ingresos familiares

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for her busines

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Hiền is 26 years old. She is married and has 2 young children. They live in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. She owns a store selling glasses and watches. Not only she sells the products, she also counsels her customers what kind of watch/glasses to wear based on their style. Her store is quite popular. Her income is about 200 USD a month. Her husband, Mr Sáng, helps her out around the house with the choirs so that she would have more time at the store. Despite the fact that she is very busy with her store, she always participates in her group activities. Facing increasing demand, she is requesting a new loan of 1200 USD to buy more merchandise for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hiền, 26 tuổi, sống tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương được 5 năm nay. Công việc chủ yếu của chị là bán kính và đồng hồ. Không chỉ bán hàng, chị Hiền còn tư vấn cho khách hàng những kiểu kính, đồng hồ phù hợp với từng người nên cửa hàng của chị luôn thu hút đông khách. Mức thu nhập bình quân của chị Hiền khoảng 200USD/tháng. Anh Sáng, chồng chị, những khi rãnh rỗi luôn giúp vợ những công việc gia đình để chị có thời gian bán hàng. Tuy công việc bận rộn nhưng chị Hiền luôn tham gia đầy đủ những sinh hoạt của Quỹ Tình thương. Trước nhu cầu ngày càng lớn của khách hàng, vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD mua thêm hàng về bán.

loans.use: Buy glasses, watches

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Janet is a married mother with two children. She has been buying and selling children’s used clothing for the past fifteen years. She buys her products from Accra the capital city of Ghana. Janet says prices of used clothing has gone up and therefore she wants to use her loan to buy more bales of children’s used clothing since it sells faster in the market.

She a member of the group called Royal Priesthood. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar’s family consists of two children, a one-year old and a 3-year old. They live in the township of Mineros. Julio Cesar works in store and draws monthly wages there, but he also has a motorcycle that he rents out on a daily basis. In both lines of work he has many years of experience, and although there is a lot of competition, his business is really successful. There is also increasing demand in the area at certain times of the year for motorcycle taxis. The loan will be used for motorcycle maintenance and to acquire a line of cosmetics priced according to quality and the product itself. Currently Julio has another small debt, but in general he has shown that he is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Julio Cesar está conformada por 2 hijos de 1 y 3 años respectivamente. Esta familia reside en una localidad de Mineros. Julio Cesar es una persona que trabaja como dependiente por lo que percibe ingresos mensuales, por otra parte también tiene una moto la cual la renta para poder percibir ingresos de renta diarios. En ambos rubros tiene muchos años de experiencia y si bien la competencia es elevada, él se destaca por desempeñarse muy bien en la empresa y por el otro lado la demanda de mototaxis incrementa en estas épocas de safra en la zona. El crédito esta destinado para efectuar mantenimiento a la moto y para adquirir mercadería de cosméticos que tienen precios variados en función a la calidad y al producto. Actualmente tiene otra deuda pequeña, pero en general Julio Cesar demostró ser una persona responsable.

loans.use: Operating capital and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Trần Thị Phương and her husband are both 31 years old. They have 2 children who are attending school. She tends a store selling basic goods and grocery: candies, cookies, beers, cigarettes ...etc. Her husband is a farmer. Her store attracts a lot of customers because she is very friendly. Her monthly income is 150 USD. For the past 5 years, all her loans from TYM were well invested. This time she is requesting a loan of 625 USD to replenish her store. Her wish is to expand her store to include cooked food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Hai vợ chồng chị Trần Thị Phương năm nay đều 31 tuổi. Anh chị có 2 con đều đang học cấp 1. Công việc của chị Phương là bán hàng tạp hóa, còn anh Xoan, chồng chị làm nông nghiệp và phụ giúp chị trong công việc kinh doanh. Cửa hàng của chị kinh doanh chủ yếu các loại mặt hàng như bánh kẹo, rượu, bia, thuốc lá ... Luôn có thái độ niềm nở ân cần với mọi người nên hàng của chị Phương bán rất chạy. Thu nhập hàng tháng của cửa hàng khoảng 150USD. Trong suốt 5 năm tham gia, chị luôn là thành viên sử dụng vốn hiệu quả của Quỹ TYM. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị xin vay 625USD để mua thêm hàng bán. Mong muốn trong tương lại của chị là sẽ mở rộng kinh doanh sang các lĩnh vực khác như bán hàng ăn.

loans.use: Buy wine, beer, confectionery for grocery store

loans.name: Tamarindo 6 Group

texts.es:
Ana P. Dias is part of the group "Tamarindo 6". She is 27 years old, has four children, and runs a convenience store out of her home. She sells drinks, oils, cookies, sugar, coffee and other items, and thanks to this business she also doesn't neglect her family. With the loan she plans to enlarge her store and increase the sale of her products, which will help her support her husband with household expenses. The other members of the group are: Magdalena P. Giron, Antonia H. D. and Andrea H. Dias are dedicated to the sale of fruits and vegetables, selling them door to door and to the surrounding areas.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

ANA P. D. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO TAMARINDO 6. ELLA TIENE 27 AÑOS, CUATRO HIJOS Y TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN DONDE VENDE: REFRESCOS, ACEITES, GALLETA, AZUCAR, CAFÉ. CON ESTE NEGOCIO ELLA NO DESCUIDA SU FAMILIA. CON SU PRESTAMO PRETENDE AMPLIAR EL LOCAL Y LA VENTA DE LOS PRODUCTOS YA QUE CON ELLO TAMBIEN APOYA A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. SUS COMPAÑERAS: MAGDALENA P. GIRON, ANTONIA H. D., ANDREA H. D. SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS OFRECIENDO DE CASA EN CASA Y A LOCALIDADES ALEDAÑAS.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of food products / INVETIR EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES

loans.name: Martha Josefina

texts.es:
Martha started her business so that she could be financially stable and because she was looking for a type of business that would generate income. Her neighbor told her about selling shoes through catalogs and little by little her income has increased. Now she also sells clothing, which she buys in bulk. She has been selling shoes for 5 years and now with her clothing sales she is earning enough income to support her family. Since she is separated she must support her family alone.

She is now asking for a loan of $500, which she will repay in 6 months to by a frame and canvas to set up a stall in markets. With your help Martha will be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Martha inicio el negocio para tener una mejor solvencia económica buscando una actividad que le permitiera generar ingresos, una vecina le comento respecto a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, poco a poco han mejorado sus ingresos, y ahora también esta vendiendo ropa, que compra por pacas, desde hace 5 años esta en la venta de zapatos y ahora complementado con la otra actividad esta recibiendo buenos ingresos para su familia ya que ella esta separada de su pareja.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una estructura y lona para establecerse en los mercados. Con tu ayuda Martha seguirá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase canvas and frames

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
Maria is 52 years old and prepares and sells lunches and dinners in her guesthouse. She has both sons and daughters, but it is the daughters who help her in the guesthouse that forms part of her home, which she owns. Maria has many years of experience in this type of work. There is little competition since she owns the only guesthouse in the area. Her speciality is a la carte and set menu meals. She sells full lunches for 8 bolivianos and dinners for 6 bolivianos. Currently she owes money to another financial institution, but she doesn’t pose a big risk as Maria has demonstrated that she fulfils her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de 52 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de almuerzos y cenas en su pensión. Tiene hijos e hijas, las hijas son las que ayudan en la pensión que se encuentra instalada en el domicilio que es propio. Maria tiene muchos años de experiencia en este rubro y el nivel de competencia es bajo ya que es la única pensión por la zona. Su especialidad son platos a la carta y los menus del día, los almuerzos completos los vende a 8 bolivianos y la cena a seis bolivianos. Actualmente tiene una deuda con otra institución financiera, pero no representa un riesgo mayor, Maria demostró ser una persona responsable con sus obligaciones.

loans.use: Restaurant expansion

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Thấm, 50 years old, lives with her husband, a son and a daughter, both are still in school. Her everyday activities include brewing rice wine and grinding bean to sale. They are hard work but earn her regular income. Her husband is a farmer who helps her in his spare time. Since her joining the TYM Fund, she uses the loans to invest in her businesses. Her monthly income is about 200USD. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to buy a new mill and also more rice for brewing.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Thấm, 50 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con 1 trai, 1 gái. 2 con của chị đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc hàng ngày của chị là nấu rượu và xay đậu bán. Công việc tuy khá vất vả nhưng giúp chị Thấm có thu nhập thường xuyên. Chồng chị là một nông dân chuyên chăn nuôi, làm ruộng. Anh rất chịu khó giúp đỡ chị trong công việc nhà khi có thời gian rảnh rỗi. Từ khi T. gia Quỹ Tình thương, có thêm vốn đầu tư vào sản xuất nên nguồn thu cũng tăng lên đáng kể. Thu nhập một tháng của gia đình chị Thấm khoảng 200USD. Sử dụng vốn hiệu quả, vòng này chị Thấm xin vay 950USD để mua thêm máy xay mới và gạo nấu rượu phục vụ bà con.

loans.use: Buy new mill and rice for brewing wine

loans.name: Marsella 1 Group

texts.es:
Dolores is 23 years old and has two children. Along with her husband she has a business making brooms, which she has done for 10 years. She sells her products in nearby cities like Tuxtla, Ixtapa and Bochil. With the loan, she will acquire rolls of plastic and wood since those are the prime materials needed to continue production and increase family income. She belongs to the group "Marsella 1" along with Maria H. Giron, who sells pots, saucepans, cups and plates; Juana P. H., who makes and sells brooms; and Martha H. P., an artisan who makes and embroiders blouses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

DOLORES TIENE 23 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS. JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO TIENE EL NEGOCIO DE HACER ESCOBAS, UTENSILIO QUE SE UTILIZA PARA EL ASEO DE LAS CASAS. LLEVAS 10 AÑOS CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD Y SUS PRODUCTOS LOS VENDE A LAS CIUDADES CERCANAS COMO TUXTLA, IXTAPA, BOCHIL. CON SU PRESTAMO ADQUIRIRAN ROLLOS DE PLASTICO Y MADERA YA QUE ES LA MATERIA PRIMA PARA CONTINUAR CON LA PRODUCCION Y LA FUENTE DE INGRESO FAMILIAR. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MARSELLA 1 JUNTO CON SUS COMPAÑERAS MARIA H. GIRON (VENTA DE OLLAS, CACEROLAS, VASOS, PLATOS), JUANA P. H. (HACE Y VENDE ESCOBAS) Y MARTHA H. P. (ARTESANA, HACE Y BORDA BLUSAS CON TELA DE MANTA).

loans.use: Purchase raw materials / INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trương Thị Bằng, 46 years old, lives with her husband, 46, and two children, 18 and 20. She sells charcoal. Her family has been in this business for 5 years now. Two or three times a week she buys wholesale coal then resells to those restaurants in the area. It is hard work but makes her happy and independent. Her motto is honesty in business that earns her a lot of customers. Her average monthly income is about 150-170USD. She’s been with the TYM Fund for 7 years. She would like to apply for a loan of 625USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trương Thị Bằng năm nay 46 tuổi, còn chồng chị 47. Anh chị có 2 cháu, 18 và 20 tuổi. Công việc chính của gia đình chị Bằng là bán than. Gia đình chị làm nghề này được 5 năm. Cứ 2 đến 3 lần 1 tuần, chị mua buôn từ các cơ sở sản xuất than về bán lại cho các hộ gia đình và cửa hàng ăn trong vùng. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng chị Bằng luôn rất vui khi đồng tiền kiếm được thực sự do công sức mình làm ra. Trong bán hàng chị luôn giữ uy tín nên có đông khách quen đặt mua hàng.
