Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình từ 150-170USD. Sau 7 năm tham gia Quỹ sử dụng đồng vốn hiệu quả, vòng này chị làm đơn xin vay 625USD để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy wholesale charcoal to resell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is a young 28-year old baker. He has lived with his partner Lilian for four years; they don’t yet have any children. Francisco started work in his father’s bakery at the age of fifteen. Five years ago he opened his own bakery but using his father’s equipment.

He notes that the work is very demanding, as he has to get up every day at 3am in order to make bread and the other baked products that he sells. He admits to the dream of opening his own fully-equipped bakery in the not too distant future.

At this time he needs a loan to buy sacks of flour so that he can increase production and sell more bread and other baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco es un joven panadero de 28 años de edad. Vive en pareja con Lilian hace 4 y aún no tienen hijos. Francisco comenzó a trabajar en la panadería de su papá a la edad de 15 años. Hace 5 años que trabaja por cuenta propia pero utilizando las maquinarias de su padre.

Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque debe levantarse todos los días a las 03:00 a.m.para elaborar sus productos que consisten en todo tipo de panificados. Confiesa que su sueño a mediano plazo es montar su propia panadería totalmente equipada.

En esta oportunidad necesita un crédito para la compra de harinas en bolsas para de esa manera aumentar su producción y vender en cantidades mayores.

loans.use: To purchase flour.

loans.name: Marsella 2 Group

texts.es:
Manuela M. H. is an artisan who makes blouses with coarse cotton and afterward she embroiders the collar and shirt sleeves with flowers of diverse colors. She's done this activity for four years and she takes her products to sell in the city of San Cristobal, two hours away from her home. She usually travels every 15 days, taking a supply of four dozen blouses. With the loan, she will purchase cones of threads and fabrics to increase production. She belongs to the group "Marsella 2" along with Carmela G. Dias, who runs a convenience store, and Maria P., who also embroiders blouses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MANUELA M. H. ES ARTESANA, HACE BLUSAS CON TELA DE MANTA Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS BORDA EN COELLO Y MANGAS CON FLORES DE DIVERSOS COLORES. LLEVA CUATRO AÑOS CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD Y SU MERCANCIA LO LLEVA A VENDER A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS UBICADO A DOS HORAS DE SU LOCALIDAD. VIAJA COMUNMENTE CADA 15 DIAS LLEVANDO UN PROMEDIO DE CUATRO DOCENAS DE BLUSAS. CON SU PRESTAMO COMPRARA CONOS DE HILOS Y TELAS PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARSELLA 2 JUNTO CON CARMELA G. D. (TIENDA DE ABARROTES) Y MARIA P. P. (ARTESANA, HACE Y BORDA BLUSAS DE MANTA).

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of threads and fabrics / INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE CONOS DE HILO Y TELA

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Mr. C. Conrrado lives together with his family, which is composed of three people including his wife and a nine-year-old daughter who is in her third year of primary school. Mr. C. is the only financial provider of his family; through his own force and a long period of time he worked as a driver and was finally able to acquire a local taxi line in the city of Juigalpa, which allows him to guarantee his family their daily bread. As part of his role as a sole source of income, with this loan request he hopes to be able to change his vehicle's tire and provide his clientele with a better sense of safety. Early in the morning, at 4:00 a.m., he begins his eight-hour shift, and in spite of the competition he has been able to carry his family forward. His primary goal is to develop as a small business owner and as the head of a family.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. C. Conrrado habita junto a su familia compuesta por 3 personas, su esposa y una hija de 9 años que cursa el 3er grado de primaria; el Sr. C. es el unico sosten familiar, por esfuerzo propio y mucho tiempo de trabajo como conductor, logró adquirir una linea de taxi local en la ciudad de Juigalpa, el que le permite garantizar el pan de cada dia a su familia; consistiendo en su unica fuente de ingreso, con la presente solicitud pretende realizar cambio de llantas al vehiculo y presentar mayor seguridad a su clientela. Temprano a las 4:00 a.m. comienza su turno el que tiene duracion de 8 horas, a pesar de la competencia ha logrado sacar adelante a su nucleo familiar, su principal obtetivo es desarrollarse como pequeño empresario y como padre de familia.

loans.use: Vehicle Maintenance (Source of Work)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vũ Thị Q., 28 years old, lives with her husband, 31, and two small children in Lương Bằng, Hưng Yên. Her family business is selling construction materials. Two years ago, when the demand for construction in the area starts higher, she made a loan and together with her own saving she started this business. The business is booming, the family’s economy improves significantly. Her average monthly income is about 220-250USD. She would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Vũ Thị Q. sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Hưng Yên. Chị Q. năm nay 28 tuổi còn chồng chị 31 tuổi. Ngành nghề kinh doanh chính của gia đình là buôn bán nguyên vật liệu xây dựng. Cách đây 2 năm khi thấy nhu cầu xây dựng trong vùng tăng cao, chị Q. đã xin vay mức vốn lớn từ Quỹ kết hợp với nguồn vốn tự có buôn xi măng, sắt thép ... Hiện nay thu nhập hàng tháng của cửa hàng từ 220-250USD. Kinh tế phát triển giúp chị Q. có điều kiện chăm sóc 2 con được cẩn thận hơn. Chị cũng sắm sửa được thêm nhiều vật dụng có giá trị trong nhà. Hiện tại, khi đã quen với các mối làm ăn, điều cần thiết nhất với chị Q. lúc này là có thêm nhiều vốn đầu tư mua hàng. Với mục tiêu đó, vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 950USD mở rộng sản xuất.

loans.use: Buy cement, iron, steel to resell

loans.name: Marsella 3 Group

texts.es:
Lidia P. Nuñez makes tamales, a tradition dish in Soyalo, Mexico. She sells them two or three times a week, taking them to the surrounding areas. Since she has been cooking since she was very young, but only started selling her goods three years ago. People say that her food tastes great. She's 25 years old and belongs to the group "Marsella 3" along with Flor de Maria Sebastiana G. S., who sells fruits and vegetables, and Juana H. Diaz, who also makes tamales. Each one plans to invest in their businesses and thus increase their earnings so they can continue growing and expanding them.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

LIDIA P. N. PREPARA TAMALES, COMIDA TRADICIONAL DE LA COMUNIDAD DE SOYALO. ELLA VENDE DOS O TRES VECES POR SEMANA Y LOS LLEVA A VENDER A LAS COLONIAS ALEDAÑAS. DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA APRENDIO A COCINAR, PERO DE SALIR A VENDER HACE TRES AÑOS. DICEN POR AHÍ QUE DOÑA LIDIA ¡ TIENE UN BUEN SAZON¡ . ELLA TIENE 25 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS Y PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARSELLA 3, JUNTO CON DOÑA FLOR DE MARIA SEBASTIANA G. S. (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS) Y JUANA H. DIAZ (PREPARA TAMALES). CADA UNA DE ELLAS INVERTIRAN EN SUS NEGOCIO Y ASI OBTENER GANACIAS QUE LES PERMITA SEGUIR CRECIENDO Y AMPLIANDO EL NEGOCIO.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of ingredients for tamales / INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MAIZ, HOJAS DE PLATANO Y ELOTE E INGREDIENTES.

loans.name: Jeamileth  Del Carme

texts.es:
Mrs. A. lives in Barrio La Morenita No. 2 together with her family, her husband and one daughter. Through her own efforts she has successfully built a small home in which she hopes to construct a small room to divide into a living room, for which she is requesting $1,100.00. By her own efforts, she has created a traveling business selling children's clothing and cosmetics, successfully going forward in life together with her family. Her husband is a conductor in the merchandise transportation sector, through which he earns an income that allows him to help his wife maintain the home. Her main goal is to improve their home's condition as she is currently four months pregnant and, as a result, she must prepare the house in such a way that she can present her new baby with the basic conditions of life and family togetherness.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. A. habita en el Barrio La Morenita Nº 2, junto a su familia, su esposo y 1 hija; por esfuerzo propio han logrado construir una pequeña vivienda, en la que pretenden construir una habitacion para compartimentar la de la sala, para lo que solicitan C$.20,000.00, por esfuerzo propio realiza venta ambulante de ropa de niños y cosméticos, logrtando salir adelante en la vida junto a su familia, su marido es conductor de transporte selectivo, donde obrtiene ingresos que le permite apoyar a su esposa en el sosten del hogar, su objetivo principal es mejorar las condiciones del hogar, ya que en la actualidad cuenta con 4 meses de embarazo, por lo que debe preparar condiciones que le permitan recibir a su nuevo bebé con las condiciones básicas de vida y unidad familiar.

loans.use: Home Improvement

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Everyone in the area knows Mrs. Đoàn Thị Tân’s nursery which caries all kinds of flowers. She has been in this business for 15 years. She is 50 years old, lives with her husband, a farmer. They have three grown up children. Two of them are married and moved out. The nursery not only earns her income, it brings her happiness. Mr Quang, her husband, helps his wife in his spare time. Her average annually income is about 2500USD. She would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to stock more fertilizer and new flowers.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Phần lớn người dân trong thôn đều biết đến vườn hoa của chị Đoàn Thị Tân. Trong vườn trồng đủ loại như: mẫu đơn, huệ, hồng, ... cùng nhiều loài hoa quý khác. Năm nay 50 tuổi, chị Tân đã có kinh nghiệm 15 năm trong nghề trồng hoa nên vườn hoa của chị luôn nhiều màu sắc và đầy sức sống. Chị Tân hiện đang sống cùng chồng, một người nông dân hiền lành. 3 người con của chị đều đã trưởng thành, 2 trong số đó đã có gia đình riêng. Vườn hoa không những mang lại thu nhập cho gia đình mà việc chăm hoa còn là một thú vui của chị Tân. Anh Quang, chồng chị, ngoài việc đồng áng cũng dành thời gian hỗ trợ vợ chăm sóc vườn hoa. Mỗi năm thu nhập từ hoa của gia đình khoảng 2500USD. Vòng vốn tới chị Tân xin vay 950USD từ Quỹ Tình thương để mua thêm phân bón và một số giống hoa mới.

loans.use: Buy new flowers and fertilizer

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
The group called La Amistad , or Friendship, began on March 6, 2008, in the Anahi 2 neighborhood, in the city Capiatá.

Justina F. is the president of the group; she began to learn about the form in which the Committees work as a member of the Commitee of Mujeres Emprenderoras, and she also learned the requirements to consider in order to create a group. Once she found out how the Committee system worked, she began to talk to her neighbors and friends. Thus she was able to join the 16 women who make up the Friendship group. They chose this name because they were all already very good friends.

The members of the group will use their loans for the sale of food, sweets, ice cream, cosmetics, the vegetable mandioca, coal, preparation and sale of hand woven articles, among others.

They are all very unified and they work together in order to achieve their goals and thus, little by little, improve the quality of life for themselves and for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El grupo denominado LA AMISTAD, se constituyó el 06 de marzo del 2008,en el barrio Anahi 2 de la ciudad de Capiatá.

La Sra. Justina F. actual Presidenta del grupo,comenzó a averiguar acerca de la forma en que se trabaja dentro del Comité de Mujeres Emprenderoras y los requisitos a tener en cuenta para formar parte de la misma; una vez enterada del sistema de trabajo del Comité, empezó comentarle a sus vecinas y amigas; y asi logró juntar a 16 mujeres las cuales integran el grupo LA AMISTA,ellas eligieron este nombre ya que todas ellas son muy buenas amigas.

Las integrantes del grupo destinan su crédito a la venta de comidas, golosinas, helados, cosméticos, mandioca, carbón,confección y venta de Ao Poí, entre otros.

Todas ellas son muy solidarias y trabajan en forma conjunta para el logro de sus metas y así de a poco; mejorar su calidad de vida y de los miembros de sus familiares.

loans.use: The sale of food, sweets, ice cream, cosmetics, the vegetable mandioca, coal, preparation and sale of hand woven articles, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Iris

texts.es:
Mrs. Blanca Iris, a native of Juigalpa, lives in the area called Nuevo Amanecer, Second Stage, where she lives together with her three children, two of whom are studying in their fourth and fifth years of secondary school and one who works with and helps his mother, who, as a single mother, has had to take on the roles of both father and mother for her children. She has been able to do this through dedication and constant work. Currently, she earns her living as a receptionist for a non-govermental organizations, where she earns a monthly income to take care of her family's expenses. Mrs. S.'s dream is to build a room so that she can divide it into rooms for her and her children; for this, she is soliciting a loan. She wishes to build three walls for a room in her house and continue advancing her children's development; the latter is her main goal in life.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Blanca Iris, originaria de Juigalpa, habita en el barrio Nuevo Amanecer 2ª etapa, donde convive con sus 3 hijos, 2 estudiando 4to y 5to año de secundaria, y 1 que trabaja y apoya a su mamá, quien como madre soltera le ha tocado jugar el papel de padre y madre para sus hijos, lo que ha logrado crear con dedicacion y constante trabajo; en la actulidad se desempeña como conserje de una ONG, donde persibe ingresos mensuales para el sosten de los gastos familiares, el sueño que la Sra. S. tiene es de construir una habitacion para compartimentar habitacion de ella y sus hijos, para lo cual solicita el credito, y construir 3 paredes para un cuarto en su hogar y continuar avanzando en la formacion de sus hijos que es su objetivo principal en la vida.

loans.use: Improvement of her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel T. began her business, a clothing shop, 15 years ago. She is a mother to four children: Jesus, Jose, Ma. De los Angeles and Hilda Barco T.. She wanted to work so that she could contribute to her family’s income but worried about neglecting her children. For this reason, she decided to launch her own business.

She is requesting a loan of US $500 which she will repay in 6 months so that she can purchase merchandise and remodel her shop’s structure. With your assistance, Maribel will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Maribel T. inicio su negocio, un bazar de ropa desde hace 15 años. Es madre de 4 hijos Jesús, José, Ma. de los Ángeles e Hilda Barco T.. Ella deseaba trabajar para contribuir en la economía familiar pero le preocupaba descuidar a sus hijos por los horarios que manejan las empresas por esta razón decidió emprender su negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y remodelar la estructura de su local. Con tu ayuda Maribel saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Marbelly Del Socorro

texts.es:
Young Marbelly lives in the Hector Ugarte neighborhood in zone # 7 together with her family, which is composed of four people: two children, one who is three years old and the other, who is nine months, and her husband, Douglas Diaz Zamora. Together, they work on the property they own, and she has dedicated herself to the business of making tortillas and selling cottage cheese. In addition to selling common fast food, which permits her to earn her own income and not depend on her spouse's income, which is very low, and which helps with the family's household goods expenses, the profits from her business have aowed her to improve her home. At this moment, she is interested in changing the roof and buying materials to better set up the place where she works and give better attention to the customers who visit her.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

La joven Marbelly habita en el barrio Hector Ugarte de la zona # 7 junto a su familia compuestas por 4 personas, 2 hijos, uno de 3 año y otro de 9 meses y su esposo Douglas Diaz Zamora, el mismo trabaja en finca y ella se dedica al negocio de producir tortillas y vender cuajadas, ademas que vende comida rapida corriente que le permite obtener ingresos propios y no depender del ingreso del marido que es muy bajo y lo que ayuda es utilizado en los gastos del consumo familiar, producto de su negocio ha procurado mejorar su casa; en este momento le interesa cambiar el techo y comprar materiales para acondicionar mejor el local donde trabaja y darle una mejor atencion a los clientes que la visitan.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to improve her home and her place of business at the same time.

loans.name: Deyling

texts.es:
Mr. M. is a master builder who resides in the city of Juigalpa, specifically in the section called Barrio Pedre Miguel. His nuclear family includes two children, six years old and three year old respectively, and his wife. Through his daily work, he supports his family; through loans, he has been able to improve his home. However, he now needs to repair the kitchen, which is in bad shape, and he urges you to help him make this repair before wintertime arrives. In addition to his daily work, Mr. M. has a small factory that manufactures cement products like washtubs, blocks, concrete posts, and fireboxes, as well as decorations made of this material. He counts on this to give him the ability to repay the loan and so provide his family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. M. es constructor empirico (maestro de obra) reside en esta ciudad de Juigalpa, propiamente en el Barrio Pedre Miguel, reparto Mitch casa # 2 en el 3er anden, su nucleo familiar son 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años respectivamente y su esposa; el con su trabajo diario mantiene a la familia; a traves de creditos ha logrado mejorar su casa, sin embargo aun le falta repara la cocina que esta en mal estado y le urge esa reparacion antes que llegue la epoca del invierno. El Sr. M. ademas de su trabajo diario tiene una pequeña fabrica de productos de cemento como lavanderos, bloques, postes de concreto y fogones, como tambien adornos de ese material, por lo que cuenta con la capacidad de pago para el credito y asi brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

loans.use: To make improvements to his home

loans.name: Otila

texts.es:
Otila has a convenience store where she sells a little of everything. She has three children: Juan Manuel, Daniel and Ricardo who help her attend to customers. She began the business when she was going through a divorce and needed to look for a way to increase her income and pay for her children’s education. This occurred five years ago. Currently, things are going well thanks to the support of her sons.

Otila is requesting a loan of US $450 which she will repay in 6 months. It will be used for the remodeling of the façade of her business. We are contributing to the development of Otila’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Otila tiene una miscelánea donde vende un poco de todo, tienen 3 hijos Juan Manuel, Daniel y Ricardo que le ayudan a atender los clientes en el negocio. Este lo inicio cuando se estaba divorciando entonces ella necesitaba buscar la manera de incrementar los ingresos económicos y así poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, esto hace 5 años, actualmente le ha ido muy bien gracias a el apoyo que sus hijos le han dado.

Solicita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar la fachada del negocio. Contribuyamos al desarrollo del negocio de Otila.

loans.use: Remodel the façade of her business.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
This client, Carlos Javier, is asking for his fifth refinancing in order to invest in improving his home. With this loan he intends to put-in a drain and improve his home’s hygienic conditions. This client works has worked for the Health Ministry as an Auxiliary Nurse for the last 18 years: he is the father of 2 daughters, the elder daughter is 11 years old and is currently studying in the first year of secondary school and the younger is a baby of seven months. His wife also works as a nursing auxiliary, and both share the family expenses. Despite the fact that both work, the salary that they earn is very small, and it is for this reason that Carlos is asking for this loan in order to be able to construct a waste-disposal system and improve his family’s conditions of life. Additionally this client works as a taxi-driver in his free time. This man is a responsible father who is fighting in order that his family not lack basic facilities in their home. It is important to mention that the previous credits authorised by AFODENIC have improved his home in great measure and he has a good credit history: for these reasons we are asking that you help with this credit.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El cliente Carlos Javier está solicitando su quinto refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, con este préstamo pretende hacer un sumidero y mejorar las condiciones higiénicas en su hogar, este cliente trabaja para el MINSA como Auxiliar de Enfermería desde hace 18 años, es padre de 2 hijas la hija mayor tiene 11 años actualmente estudia 1 er año de educación secundaria y una bebe de 7 meses, su esposa también trabaja como auxiliar de enfermería, ambos comparten los gastos familiares a pesar que los dos trabajan el salario que estos devengan es muy poco, es por esta razón que don Carlos esta solicitando este préstamo para así construir los servicios higiénicos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, además esté cliente en las hora libres trabaja en un taxi. Este hombre es un padre responsable que lucha para que su familia no le falte lo básico en el hogar, es importante mencionar que este con los créditos anteriores otorgados por AFODENIC ha mejorado su vivienda en gran medida, y ha tenido buen comportamiento crediticio por esta razón solicitamos se le apoye con este crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a drain

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar is a single mother who has two children: Mari José and Gustavo. She launched her business three years ago in order to provide a better education and quality of life for her children. Seeking to generate more income, she launched her business from her home recently selling chemical products for the home.

Now, she is requesting a loan of US $500 which she will repay in 6 months in order to buy a new awning for her business. With your support, María will continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

María del pilar es madre soltera tiene dos hijos, Mari José y Gustavo. Emprendió el negocio hace 3 años para dar una mejor educación y calidad de vida a sus hijos buscando generar mejores ingresos emprendió el negocio de bazar en su casa y hace poco venta de productos químicos para el hogar.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US$500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un toldo nuevo para su negocio. Con tu apoyo María seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase an awning.

loans.name: Jesus Guillermo

texts.es:
Jesus began his business four years ago when he was a student and needed money to pay for school and for his personal expenses. He has always like cars and so he dedicated himself to vehicle repair by opening a mechanic shop. In this manner, he was able to pay for school and his housing expenses.

Now he is requesting a loan of US $500 which he will repay in 6 months in order to purchase tools that he needs for his job. With your support, Jesus will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Jesús empezó su negocio cuando era estudiante y necesitaba dinero para pagarse la escuela y solventar sus gastos personales hace 4 años. Siempre le han gustado loa autos así que se dedico a la reparación de vehículos, abriendo poco a poco un taller mecánico. Es así como puedo costear la escuela y contribuir a los gastos de la casa.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US$500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar herramientas de trabajo que necesita. Con tu apoyo Jesús saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his job.

loans.name: Melvin Alonso

texts.es:
This client, Melvin, is asking for a third credit refinance in order to invest in home improvements (Plastering and placing a floor in the kitchen). He works for the National Farmer’s Union, he also cultivates at his mother’s finca on the weekends, as he is a hard-working and responsible man who has worked in the fields and is from a peasant family, and in this way he obtains basic foodstuffs which provide additional help to support his income. His family is composed of two children: the elder son is 14 years old and studying the first year of secondary school and the younger daughter is 12 years old and studying in the sixth grade of primary school: his wife works as a volunteer in a community childcare centre, caring for children from deprived backgrounds. His dream is to have a home with all the comforts that her family merits, and that his children study so that in the future they become excellent professionals and have job security.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El cliente Melvin está solicitando un 3er refinanciamiento de crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar y echarle el piso a la cocina), Trabaja para Unión Nacional de Agricultores y Ganaderos, también se dedica a cultivar en la finca de su mamá los fines de semana, ya que ha sido un hombre trabajador y responsable que ha trabajado en el campo y es de origen de familia campesina y de esta forma obtener los alimentos básicos como apoyo a los ingresos que el obtiene; su familia esta compuesta por dos hijos, el hijo mayor de 14 años estudia 1 er año de educación secundaria y la niña menor de 12 años estudia 6to grado de educación primaria, su esposa trabaja como voluntaria en un centro Infantil comunitario cuidando niños de escasos recursos económicos, su sueño es tener una vivienda con todas las condiciones que la familia amerita, y que sus hijos estudien para que el futuro lleguen a ser excelentes profesionales y tener estabilidad laboral.

loans.use: Home improvements, placing floor in the kitchen

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago is a single man but he has three children. Eleven years ago he began selling fruit and vegetables from a tricycle. When he found himself unemployed, he learned this occupation from a brother-in-law who taught him and little by little, he began generating income. He wishes now to sell hot dogs, also.

Santiago is requesting a loan of US $350 which he will repay in 6 months to purchase a hot dog cart. With your help, Santiago will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Santiago es soltero pero tiene 3 hijos, hace 11 años el empezó vendiendo frutas y verduras en un triciclo al quedarse desempleado este oficio lo aprendió de un cuñado que le enseño, y poco a poco fue generando ingresos. Ahora desea vender también hot dogs.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un carrito para vender hot dogs. Con tu ayuda Santiago saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase a hot dog cart.

loans.name: Jamileth

texts.es:
This client is asking for her third AFODENIC refinancing, in order to invest in improving her homes which 8 years ago she secured with an inheritance from her father: with this loan she is thinking of adding ceramics to her house in zone 5 of New Guinea. She has worked for the last 11 years, as the secretary of the National Union of Farmers, with great responsibility and enthusiasm. She is currently studying at University and is in the second year of a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration. She relies on the support of her husband who is a teacher at the URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea University. They have two children, the elder is 11 years old and in sixth grade and their daughter is 7 years old and studying second grade in primary school.

It is important to explain that this woman is wage earner with scarce economic resources who has struggled to improve her home since she bought it, in order to have a dignified home for her family. Her dream is that her sons will continue studying to become something in life: every day Jamileth gets up at 4.30am to leave breakfast prepared for her family and in the afternoons Jamileth returns home to finish the household tasks. Jamileth feels very grateful towards AFODENIC and has already managed to improve her home with previous credits.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Esta clienta esta solicitando su tercer refinanciamiento con AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda que hace 8 años obtuvo de una herencia de su papá, con este préstamo piensa echarle la cerámica a su casa ubicada en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, esta se desempeña desde hace 11 años como secretaria en la Unión Nacional de Agricultores y Ganaderos con gran responsabilidad y entusiasmo, actualmente esta estudiando en la Universidad segundo año de Lic. En Administración de Empresas, cuenta con la ayuda de su marido quien es docente de la Universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, tienen dos hijos, el mayor de 11 años esta cursando su sexto grado y la niña de 7 años estudia 2 do grado de educación primaria.

Es importante explicar que esta señora es una mujer asalariada y de escasos recursos económicos que ha luchado por ir mejorando su vivienda desde que la obtuvieron para tener un hogar digno para su familia, su sueño es que sus hijos estudien para ser alguien en la vida, todos los días Jamileth se levanta a la cuatro y treinta de la mañana para dejar el desayuno hecho a su familia y, por las tardes doña Jamileth llega a su casa a terminar de hacer los quehaceres del hogar. Jamileth se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado su vivienda.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Auralila Del Socorro

texts.es:
Auralila is asking for her third refinancing in order to invest in the purchase of construction materials to plaster her house located in zone 5 of New Guniea: she has worked as a secondary school teacher for the last nine years at the Rubén Darío institute. She has two sons, the elder is 17 years old and is in the fifth year of his secondary school studies, and her other son is fifteen years old and in the fourth year of his secondary school education.

This client is a single mother who has fought for her sons in order to give them all the necessities of life, both materially and spiritually: despite having no support from anyone else they are a united family, who share the daily household tasks. Auralila is an example to all women who fight for the well-being of their family, showing that being a single mother is not an obstacle to fighting for your dreams. Her main dream is to have a house with better living conditions, and stable employment in order to continue supporting her children.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Auralila esta solicitando su tercer refinanciamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción, para repellar la casa ubicada en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea se desempeña como docente de educación Secundaria labora desde hace 9 años como docente del Instituto Rubén Darío, tiene dos hijos, el mayor tiene 17 años de edad estudia 5to año de educación secundaria y el otro hijo tiene 15 años estudia 4to año de educación secundaria.

Esta clienta es madre soltera que ha luchado por sus hijos para darle todo lo necesario tanto en lo material como espiritual, a pesar que no tienen la ayuda de nadie son una familia unida, esta pequeña familia comparten los quehaceres del hogar, Auralila es un ejemplo para todas las mujeres que luchan por el bienestar de su familia ya que no es impedimento ser madre soltera para seguir luchando por sus sueños. Su principal sueño tener una casa con mejores condiciones y estabilidad laboral para seguir ayudando a sus hijos.

loans.use: Improve dwelling

loans.name: Yenis

texts.es:
Yenis is divorced and has two children: a 4-year-old daughter and a 4-month-old baby. Since her work wasn't enough to cover her children's needs, she search for another way to earn additional income. 4 years ago when she became unemployed she started to sell footwear and little by little developed a good clientèle and earned more income.

She is requesting a loan of $575, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy display cases for her merchandise. With your help Yenis will be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Yenis actualmente esta divorciada y tiene dos hijos una niña de 4 años y un bebe de 4 meses, como con su trabajo no completaba para los gastos de sus pequeñas buscaba la posibilidad de generar otros ingresos. hace 4 años al quedarse desempleada empezó a vender calzado y poco a poco ha hecho una buena cartera de clientes y ha logrado mejor sus ingresos.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar exhibidores para la mercancía que tiene. Con tu ayuda Yenis saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase display cases

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
José is married and has two children: José Eduardo who is 24 years old and Mario is 19 years olds. His sons do not help him in his business because they are students.

He started a business because he wanted to have his own workshop because at the time he was unemployed and needed money. That was five years ago. He had this opportunity in his friend's workshop, where he trained for a while and then became independent.

He is asking for a loan of $400, which he will repay in 6 months, to purchase a special tool kit for installing carburetor parts. With your support Don José can continue to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

José esta casado, tiene dos hijos José Eduardo de 24 años y Mario de 19 años, ellos no le ayudan en el negocio porque son estudiantes

El emprendió un negocio con el deseo de iniciar su propio taller, ya que en ese momento estaba desempleado y necesitaba dinero, esto fue hace cinco años, le dieron la oportunidad en un taller de un amigo, de aprender por un tiempo, y luego se independizo.

Solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un kit de herramienta especial para la instalación de equipos de carburación. Con tu apoyo Don José seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Comprar herramienta

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita is a widow and has one son who is already an adult. For this reason she started her business to be able put her son through school since her husband passed away five years ago. Since then she and her neighbors have been selling tamales and then started a shop to sell traditional dishes such as chile relleno, menudo, gorditas and others.

She is requesting a loan of $575, which she will repay in 6 months, that she will use to buy a griddle to make tacos so that she can sell them in the evening. Let us support Juanita so that she can continue to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Juanita es viuda, tiene un hijo ya mayor de edad, por el cual inicio su negocio, para sacarlo adelante en sus estudios ya que su esposo falleció hace 5 años, desde entonces inicio vendiendo con sus vecinas tamales, después puso un puesto para vender chiles rellenos, menudo, gorditas, etc.

Solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses y le va a servir para comprar una plancha para elaborar tacos, para empezar a venderlos por las noches. Apoyemos a Juanita para que su negocio siga creciendo.

loans.use: Comprar una plancha

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es:
Oralia is divorced and has two children. She started her business to help her children get ahead because she and her husband have been separated since their children were very small and she was unemployed. This was 30 years ago and since then she has started her business selling food, which has provided her with the income she needs to support and raise her children, who are now adults.

She is requesting a loan of $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy a new stove and a grill. With your support Oralia will continue to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Oralia es divorciada, sin embargo tiene dos hijos. Inicio su negocio para sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que se separo de su esposo desde que eran pequeños y ella estaba desempleada. Esto fue hace 30 años el tiempo que tiene con su negocio de comidas que le ha dado los ingresos para poder mantener y formar a sus hijos, ahora adultos.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses y le va a servir para comprar una estufa nueva y una parrilla. Con tu apoyo Oralia seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase a stove and a grill

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia M. started her business to be able to contribute to household expenses because she has a big family. Also, her husband had an illness which affected his speech and she needed to support her children so that they could get ahead financially and have what they needed. For over 8 years she has made and sold flour tortillas

She is requesting a loan of $575, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy a tortilla maker, which will helf her to increase her production. With your support Alicia will continue to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Alicia M. inició el negocio para contribuir con el gasto de casa ya que son de familia numerosa y su esposo tuvo enfermedad por lo que quedo limitado en el habla y ella necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos económicamente y apoyar con el sustento del mismo. Hace mas de 8 años se dedica a la fabricación y venta de tortillas de harina.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US$ 575 que pagara en 6 meses para una maquina para hacer tortillas que le permitirá producir mas producto. Con tu apoyo Alicia seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase a tortilla maker

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
The group called Mujeres Emprendedoras from the city Itá had their beginning in May, 2006. It was formed by Marciana O., who contacted her neighbors to make up the group. They all have activities in the commercial realm. The group is very organized and united, they made it through the 7th cycle with excellent payment history.

It should be emphasized that all of them are very unified, within the group emphasizes the friendship and solidarity between them.

These women will use your loans for different activities like: the sale of food, underwear, clothes, coal, and basic articles for the home, etc.

They all understand the importance of fulfilling the commitment to the Committee and the importance of good relations between the members in order to achieve the objectives of the group and of course their personal objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El Grupo denominado Mujeres Emprendedoras de la ciudad de Itá tuvo su inicio en el mes de Mayo del año 2.006. El mismo fue formado por Marciana O., quien contactó con sus vecinas para la constitución del grupo, todas poseen actividades en el ámbito comercial. El Grupo es muy organizado y unido, pasaron al 7º ciclo con un comportamiento de pago excelente.

Cabe destacar que todas son muy solidarias, dentro del grupo resalta la amistad y la solidaridad entre ellas.

Las mismas destinaron sus créditos a diferentes actividades como: venta de comidas, mercería, ropas, carbón y articulos básicos para el hogar, etc.

Todas consideran la importancia de cumplir con los compromisos del Comité y el buen relacionamiento entren las integrantes para concretar los objetivos del grupo y por supuesto sus objetivos personales.

loans.use: Sale of clothing, underwear, food, basic household items, etc.

loans.name: Lamaranah

texts.en: Lamaranah is  21 years old, married, and has two children.  She sells dried fish in Dogolia village in the Koinadugu District of Sierra Leone.  Lamaranah needs to increase her income to better care for her children.  She is hopeful that by strengthening her business she will be able to accomplish her goals.  She is requesting a loan of Le 800,000.  Lamaranah is the entrepreneur on the right in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: Rugiatu is 37 years old, married and has two children.  She owns a food stall in the market of Dogolia in Sierra Leone.  She is not able to contribute to her childrens' education and well-being from the meager salary she earns from her small business.  She is requesting a loan of Le 800,000 to expand her business and buy a larger variety and quantity of grocery items to sell in her market stall.  Rugiatu is on the left in the photograph.

loans.use: to expand her stock of food items and expand her business

loans.name: Lamaranah

texts.en: Lamaranah has been a member of the Aldi Forty group for a while now and has been participating only in the savings group.  She is now ready to access a loan to both grow her business and satisfy her clients' demands.  She owns a small food items kiosk in the Dogolia market in Sierra Leone.  She needs business capital to purchase sufficient amounts of food items to sell.  She is therefore requesting a loan of Le 800,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies for her food stall

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva started her business 25 years ago making only dresses and suits for children. Over time her business was a success and so she decided to expand and used one of the rooms in her house and a space to open a general store. Little by little she has been investing in her business and she now has her general store and makes clothing for children, women and men and has all types of novelties.

Now she is requesting a loan of $400, which she will pay back in 6 months, to purchase merchandise and thus provide her customers with better service. Minerva has faith that she will receive support through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Minerva inicio su negocio hace 25 años haciendo solamente costuras y vestidos para niñas, con el tiempo le fue bien, entonces decidió ampliarse y utilizo uno de los cuartos de su casa como local para poder poner una mercería. Poco a poco le ha estado invirtiendo al negocio y ahora tiene la mercería, pero también hace costura para niños, damas caballeros y tiene todo tipo de novedades.

Ahora esta solicitando de un crédito de por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para compra de mercancía y así darle mejor servicio a sus clientes, tiene fe en que recibirá el apoyo de Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 38 years old and he has been married to 35 year old Sonia for 17 years. From their union they have given birth to three children, now 16, 11, and 8 years old respectively. All of them are students and they still live with their parents.

Carlos said that he began selling 18 years ago, beginning work as an employee. But after 10 years as a prize for this dedication and sacrifice he obtained his independence. Today he has his own established company. Nevertheless he remembers that his beginnings were very hard because he made his routes on foot. At this time, he has his own truck that makes his work much easier. He carries merchandise of all the types there are: shirts, jeans, jerseys, jackets, etc. of many brands to different interior cities.

He has already achieved a good number of clients, who each time have a greater demand for his merchandise. It is for this opportunity that he needs a loan in order to complete all his orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos tiene 38 años y está casado hace 17 años con Sonia que tiene 35 años. De la unión de ambos nacieron tres hijos que hoy tienen 16, 11 y 8 años respectivamente. Todos ellos estudian y aún viven con sus padres.

Carlos comenta que se dedica a la venta hace 18 años, comenzó a trabajar como empleado, pero hace 10 años como premio a esa dedicación y el sacrificio logró independizarse. Hoy día ya tiene su propia empresa formada, sin embargo recuerda que sus inicios fueron muy duros debido a que sus recorridos los hacía caminando.

Actualmente ya cuenta con una camioneta propia que le facilita mucho su trabajo. Lleva mercaderías de todo tipo como ser: remeras, jeans, championes, camperas,etc.de diversas marcas hasta distintas ciudades del interior.

Ya cuenta con buena cantidad de clientes por lo cada vez tiene mayor demanda de sus mercaderías. Es por eso que en esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para cumplir con todos sus pedidos.

loans.use: To buy jackets, jeans, jerseys, etc.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is a woman who works hard to help support her family.  She works many hours trying to earn a meager income from her food stall in the market of Dogolia village.  She sells basic food items and produce.  She is ready to expand her business and access a loan.  She needs Le 800,000 to begin the much needed expansion of her business so that she can meet her customers' needs and demands.  Having a well stocked market will allow her to establish a reputation as a reliable retailer in her community.

loans.use: to expand her collection of food items and stock

loans.name: Sorie P.

texts.en: Sorie is 41 years old, married and has four children.  He runs a pharmacy business in Makeni town. He has been running this business for more than 5 years at a very small scale.  Sorie would like to expand his stock and is requesting a loan of Le. 3,500,000 to do so.

loans.use: to purchase more of the most frequently requested medications and supplies

loans.name: Marqueza 1 Group

texts.es:
The group "Marqueza 1" consists of Nery M. H., who runs a convenience store; Ariely L. D., who sells chicken; Carmen M. G., who also runs a convenience store; and Guadalupe G., who start her perfume, cosmetic and lotion business three years ago. She sells her products to all the women she knows, especially the ones who are more wealthier because she collects her bills weekly or every other week depending on her finances. With the loan Guadalupe, who is 37 years old and has three children, will invest in the purchase of more products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO MARQUEZA 1 ESTA INTEGRADO POR: NERY M. H. (TIENDA DE ABARROTES), ARELY L. D. (VENTA DE POLLO), CARMEN M. G. (TIENDA DE ABARROTES) Y GUADALUPE G. G. QUE INICIO SU NEGOCIO DE PERFUMES, COSMETICOS Y CREMAS DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS. ELLA OFRECE SUS PRODUCTOS A TODAS LAS MUJERES QUE CONOZCA Y SEPA QUE SON PAGADORAS YA QUE LOS PAGOS SON SEMANALES O QUINCENALES DEPENDIENDO SU ECONOMIA. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTOS Y CONSIDERA QUE ES BUENO QUE UNA MUJER SE DE “ UNA MANITA DE GATO “. ELLA TIENE 37 AÑOS Y TIENE TRES HIJOS.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of perfumes, lotions and cosmetics / INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE PERFUMES, CREMAS, COSMETICOS

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is 29 years old, married and has two children.  Musa started his business seven years ago after dropping out of school.  He started the business at a very small scale and expanded it with previous loans.  He is requesting a loan of Le. 3,500,000 to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marqueza 2 Group

texts.es:
Martha H. G. is 27 years old and has three children. Since she was very young she learned the art of making brooms and shopping bags called "Morraletas". Now that she has started her own family she opened a store out of her home selling plastics of different colors. She sells them by the kilo as raw material that is used to make brooms and shopping bags. In this way she helps her husband with household expenses. She gets her materials in the town of Tuxtla Gutierrez two hours away from her home, and with the loan she will be able to purchase more plastics to offer her customers. Martha belongs to the "Marqueza 2" group along with Maria Luisa P. H., who sells fruits and vegetables, and Carmen C. P., who sells chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARTHA H. G. TIENE 27 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS. DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA APRENDIO EL OFICIO DE HACER ESCOBAS Y MORRALETAS, AHORA QUE HA FORMADO SU PROPIA FAMILIA ABRIO UN LOCAL EN SU CASA EN DONDE SE VENDE PLASTICO EN DIFERENTES COLORES Y LOS VENDE POR KILO MATERIA PRIMA QUE SE UTILIZA PARA HACER ESCOBAS Y MORRALETAS (ACCESORIO PARA IR AL MERCADO DE COMPRAS), DE ESTA MANERA APOYA A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. LOS PRODUCTOS SON COMECIALIZADOS A TUXTLA GUTIERREZ. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE MAS PLASTICOS PARA OFRECER A SU CLIENTELA YA QUE PARA ADQUIRIRLOS TIENE QUE VIAJAR DOS HORAS DE SU LOCALIDAD. PERTENECE AL GRUPO LLAMADO MARQUEZA 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA MARIA LUISA P. H. (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS) Y DOÑA CARMEN C. P. (VENTA DE POLLO).

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of plastics / INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE PLASTICOS

loans.name: Marqueza 3 Group

texts.es:
Josefa G. Espinosa is 22 years old, has three children and belongs to the “Marqueza 3” group along with Delma P. M., who sells plasticware, and Yeri De Jesus M. P., who sells perfumes and cosmetics. Josefa has dedicated herself to selling plasticware for the past two years, offering her customers cups, plates and other plastic items in different colors and sizes. She acquires her supplies in the town of Tuxtla Gutierrez, located two hours from her home. She installed her business in her home and she has thus been able not to neglect household chores and help pay the bills. With the loan, she will purchase more plasticware in order to offer her clients new products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

JOSEFA G. ESPINOSA TIENE 22 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS Y PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MARQUEZA 3 JUNTO CON DOÑA DELMA P. M. (VENTA DE TRASTES DE PLASTICO) Y DOÑA YERI DE JESUS M. P. (VENTA DE COSMETICOS Y PERFUMES). DOÑA JOSEFA SE DEDICA DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS A LA VENTA DE TRASTES DE PLASCTICO, OFRECE A SU CLIENTELA VASOS, PLATOS, Y PLASTICOS EN DIFERENTES FORMAS, TAMAÑOS Y COLORES. SU MERCANCIA LO ADQUIERE EN TUXTLA GUTIERREZ UBICADO A DOS HORAS DE SU LOCALIDAD. SU NEGOCIO LO TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA Y DE ESTA FORMA NO DESATIENDE SU HOGAR Y OPOYA CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE MAS TRASTES PARA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES NUEVOS PRODUCTOS.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of plasticware / INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE TRASTES DE PLASTICO

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Alpha K. sells second-hand clothes in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  His business is the main source of income for his family.  With five children in school, Alpha needs to generate more income to meet their expenses.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 2,000,000 to expand his business to generate more profit.

loans.use: to further expand his clothing business by purchasing additional merchandise

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban is 44 years old and he is a carpenter. He has been married to 39 year old Mirian for 18 years. They have one 7 year old child who is going to school at the moment.

Esteban said that he began his carpentry 14 years ago but formerly he worked as a farmer. Nevertheless, he left this activity because he realized that his calling was carpentry, and it was thus that he began to work in the profession. Now he makes furniture, kitchen utensils, clothes hangers, and all types of crafts in wood that soon he returns to resell at the big supermarkets, primarily of the Capitol.

Now he needs a loan in order to buy wood for the creation of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Esteban tiene 44 años de edad y es carpintero de profesión, está casado hace 18 años con Mirian quien tiene 39 años. Tienen un solo hijo que tiene 7 años de edad que actualmente va a la escuela.

Esteban comenta que montó su carpintería hace 14 años pero que anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura. Sin embargo dejó dicha actividad debido a que se dió cuenta que lo suyo era la carpintería y fue así que comenzó a trabajar en la profesión.

Actualmente fabrica muebles, utensilios de cocina, perchas para ropas y todo tipo de trabajos en madera que luego vuelve a revender a los grandes supermercados, principalmente de la capital.

Ahora necesita un crédito para la compra de maderas para la elaboración de sus productos.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: Abu is 41 years old, married and has 4 children.  Abu serves a very important role in his community.  He runs a small pharmacy in Makeni town that supplies much needed medication to its' customers.  He needs an additional loan to ensure that he has an adequate stock of medications.  For five years, he could not improve his business due to a lack of capital.  Abu approached SMT and requested a loan of Le. 3,500,000 to increase his stock of medicines.

loans.use: to ensure he has an adequate stock of medication in his pharmacy

loans.name: Sebedon Group

texts.en: Mohamed K. is 70 years old, married, and has 6 children. His children are still young and in school.  He is the leader of the group and has been farming his whole life.  All of the group members would like to expand theirs farms and cultivate rice, sweet potatoes and vegetables.  They are therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1,500,000 to hire labourers and purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: to expand their farms and cultivate greater amounts of vegetables and rice

loans.name: Koyuma Group

texts.en: Omaru T. is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is the leader of the group and has 4 hectors of farmland.  The other group members have 3 – 5 hectors each.  All of the group members cannot cultivate all of their land due to a lack of cash with which to purchase fertilizer and hire labour. This has reduced their ability to cultivate sufficient crops for consumption and income generation.  The group therefore approached SMT for a loan of Le. 2,500,000, which amounts to Le. 500,000 each for hiring labourers and purchasing fertilizer and vegetable seeds.

loans.use: to producing sufficient crops to meet their needs

loans.name: Matanyaro Ii Group

texts.en: The Matanyaro ll Group is comprised of farmers.  They are mainly youths, ages 20 – 26, who have decided to make a living working on a farm.  These energetic young men would like to plant rice, cassava and vegetables to earn an income and become self-employed.  The group is requesting a loan of Le. 2,000,000.  They will spend Le. 500,000 each on seeds, labour and fertilizer.  Mohamed M. M. is the group leader and is 26 years old.  He has 4.5 hectors of farm land.

loans.use: to scale up their farms and produce a sufficient amount of crops

loans.name: Quintin

texts.es:
Quintin is a known tailor in the city of Itá. He has been married to María Cristina for 25 years. Together they have raised 5 children, who are between the ages of 12 and 25.

Quintin said that he began working with his father when he was 10 years old. At 15, he found work in a well known store in the capitol city, where he sewed clothes for the company. A few years later, he had changed himself into one of the best of his profession. Because of this he formed his own clientele until he became independent and began his own factory that to this day he runs from his home. At this point, he has 10 sewing machines and gives work to many people.

He says that things are going very well and that his business is growing more each day. For this opportunity, he needs a loan in order to buy fabric and thread, because he has a lot of demand and he wants to meet it.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Quintin es un conocido costurero de la ciudad de Itá, está casado con María Cristina hace 25 años, juntos han criado a 5 hijos que tienen entre 12 y 25 años de edad.

Quintin comenta que comenzó a trabajar a la edad de 10 años con su padre. A los 15 años consiguió trabajo en una conocida tienda de la ciudad Capital en donde cosía ropas para dicha empresa. Luego de varios años fue convirtiéndose en uno de los mejores en su profesión por lo que iba formando su propia clientela hasta que logró independizarse y montó su propio taller que funciona hasta hoy día en su casa propia.

En la actualidad ya cuenta con 10 máquinas de coser y le da trabajo a muchas personas.

Cuenta que le va muy bien y que su negocio va creciendo cada día más.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para la compra de telas e hilos debido a que tiene mucha demanda y desea cubrirlas.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Doni Doni Group

texts.en:
Foday B. K. is the leader of the Doni Doni group, which is from Sukrallah village. He is 27 years old, married, and has 3 children. The group has been informally rotating their savings to raise small amounts of cash to assist each member in cultivating their individual farm.  All of the group members are engaged in farming rice and cassava and would like to expand their farmland.  They are therefore requesting a loan of 
Le.3,000,000, which amounts Le.500,000 each.

loans.use: to expand their farms

loans.name: Sonney

texts.en: Sonney is 28 years old, married, and has five children.  With a previous loan from SMT, Sonney increased the stock at her store and also increased her profit.  She is able to provide her family with daily meals and pay her childrens' educational expenses.  She would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia is 25 years old and she has been married to her husband Cándido for 5 years. From this union they have given birth to two children, 4 and 3 years old respectively.

Cynthia's work is to make cigars (made with tobacco and branded as habanos). She began this activity 13 years ago helping her mother in the beginning, who also does the same work. Later, and with practice, Cynthia also acquired the profession.

This was how she took over the business when her mother moved away, looking for work. Today, she has a good clientele formed, and it is going well.

Cynthia's dream is to build her own house. For this reason she has acquired land where she is thinking to build in the near future. For this opportunity she needs the loan in order to buy the tobacco in large quantities as there is a large demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Cynthia tiene 25 años y está casada hace 5 años con Cándido de dicha unión nacieron dos hijos de 4 y 3 años respectivamente.

Cynthia se dedica a la fabricación de cigarros (hecho a base de tabaco y parecido al habano). Cuenta que comenzó hace 13 años en la actividad ayudando en un comienzo a su madre que también se dedicaba a lo mismo. Más adelante y con la práctica ella también fue adquiriendo la profesión.

Fue así que cuando su madre viajó al exterior en busca de trabajo ella se hizo cargo del negocio.

Hoy día ya cuenta con muy buena clientela formada y le va bastante bien.

El sueño de Cynthia es construir su casa propia, para tal efecto ya ha adquirido un terreno en donde piensa edificar en un futuro no muy lejano.

En esta oportunidad necesita de el préstamo para la compra de tabaco en grandes cantidades debido a que cuenta con una gran demanda.

loans.use: To buy bundles of tobacco

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
For three years Daysi has been running a small grocery store-come-bookshop from her house. She is 35 years old and has 3 kids, for whom she has to get up and work every day so that they never want for anything. Despite relying on help from her husband, who is a welder in a company, she knows that there will always be times of emergency when you need to be able to count on an additional income to supply your needs.

She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman, with a good vision for business. These are skills that allow her to start businesses wherever she can. She is part of an association with some friends, where they meet monthly to plan how to obtain extra income, whether this be baskets of supplies or money. In the future she plans to implement a transport company with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace tres años Daysi se en carga de manejar una pequeña bodega-librería dentro de su casa. Ella tiene treinta y cinco años de edad y tres hijos por quienes levantarse cada día y trabajar para que no les haga falta nada. A pesar de que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja como soldador en una empresa, ella afirma que siempre se presentan algunas emergencias y que es necesario contar con un ingreso adicional para suplir esas faltas. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Habilidades que la llevan a iniciar negocios cada vez que puede. Muestra de ello es la asociación que tiene con un grupo de amigas, donde planifica mensualmente diversas formas de obtener un recurso adicional, ya sean canastas de víveres o juntas de dinero. Más adelante planea instituir una empresa de transportes junto con su esposo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to put in the shop window/Comprar mercadería  para abastecer las vitrinas de su bodega

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy leather, string, paint, and footwear.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
Pablina is married and has 4 children. She is the owner of a business, Despensa, a general store, located in one of the most crowded and busiest neighborhoods in the city of Itacuribi in the Cordilleras.

Pablina comments, that apart from the store, she also has six cows, which she takes care of, and part of her income comes from the sale of their milk.

To manage her multiple jobs, Pablina has the help of her daughters at the general store.

She and her daughter have undertaken projects in cheesemaking, and selling them in the city of Eusebio Ayala y Caacupe.

With the loans provided by the Paraguaya Foundation, Pablina could buy merchandise to supply for sale at a good price, and in quantity, including sugar, milk, meat, oil, cheese, cookies, and all kinds of drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

Pablina esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a las venta de productos de consumo diario (Despensa), su negocio esta úbicado en uno de los barrios mas concurridos y con mucho movimiento de gente de la ciudad de Itacuribí de las Cordilleras.

Pablina comenta, que aparte de la despensa, también tiene 6 vacas lecheras al cual también le dedica su atención y es mas forma parte de una de las actividades que le genera ingresos como la venta de leche.

Para hacer frente a las múltiples ocupaciones, las señora es ayudada por una de sus hijas en la atención de la despensa.

Tiene proyectado conjuntamente con su hija la de fabricar quesos, y proveerles a los fabricantes y vendedores de chipas de la ciudad de Eusebio Ayala y Caacupé.

Con los prestamos que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar mercaderias para surtir su despensa a un buen precio y en cantidades importantes, entre la que podemos detallar son azúcar, leche,carne vacuna, aceite, quesos, galleta, y bebidas de todo tipo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as cookies, sugar, yerba (tea), coffee, all times of drinks, meat, oil, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira and her husband, Pedro, started their business, a restaurant, 4 years ago. They had always had the idea of starting their own business, and after saving for quite some time they decided to open a restaurant as they thought this would be a good opportunity as there was a grill from a public transport office near their house. Although the business belongs to them both, the money they make goes to Elvira as it is her who is in charge of the restaurant's administration and outgoings. Her husband, on the other hand, works for a transport company, and has 2 buses that he rents to work on.

Thanks to both of their efforts, in a short amount of time they got a juicer in their restaurant. Their plan is to keep expanding and progressing so that they can give their kids, who are 17 and 9, a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Elvira y Pedro, su esposo, hace cuatro años iniciaron una empresa juntos: un restaurante. Siempre tuvieron la idea de poner un negocio. Después de ahorrar durante una temporada decidieron abrir un restaurante ya que creyeron que sería una buena oportunidad al ver que cerca a su casa se encontraba el paradero de una empresa de transporte público. Si bien el restaurante es de ambos, todos los créditos recaen en Elvira ya que ella es la que se encarga de la atención y administración del restaurante. Su esposo, por otro lado, trabaja en una empresa de transportes y además tiene dos ómnibus que los alquila para que sean trabajados. Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos, dentro de poco implementarán su restaurante con una juguería. Su plan es continuar creciendo y progresando. Esto con la idea de darle una buena educación a sus dos hijos menores de 17 y 9 años.

loans.use: To buy some new furniture to improve the ambience of their restaurant/Comprar nuevo mobiliario para mejorar el ambiente de su restaurante

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Mr. Ramon O. is a 32 years old bachelor, and lives in a neighborhood a few kilometers from the city of Encarnacion in his own house with his 60 year-old father, Silvio O., and with his only son, who is in 9th grade at the local highschool.

Ramon is the owner of shop in the Lower Zone (the market area of the city), where he has been selling fruits and vegetables for 11 years, with the help of his father. Ramon has a truck, with which he manages distribution in accordance with demand, while his father attends to local clients.

Ramon is a very dedicated person, who since he was small helped his father move forward and today sacrifices a lot in order to care for his father and son, so that they live and struggle day by day together.

Ramon is hoping for this loan to buy merchandise such as corn, beans, soy beans, fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Ramón O. de 32 años de edad es soltero y vive en un Barrio retirado a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Encarnación en su propia casa y vive con su padre Silvio O. de 60 años de edad y con su único hijo que esta estudiando en un colegio del Barrio que esta cursando el 9ª grado.

Ramón es propietario de un puesto en la Zona Baja (Mercado Municipal de la ciudad) en el ramo de ventas de frutas y verduras con una antigüedad de 11 años y que es atendido por su padre y por el mismo. El Señor Ramón posee un camión con el cual realiza los reparto a domicilio de acuerdo a los pedidos que tiene mientras que su padre lo ayuda con la atención de los clientes en el local.

Ramón es una persona muy sacrificada, que desde muy pequeño ayudó a sus padres para poder salir adelante y que hoy día se sacrifica de la misma forma para cuidar a su padre y a su hijo pues son ellos tres los que viven y luchan día a día juntos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías como: maíz, poroto, harina, soja, frutas y verduras.

loans.use: Merchandise such as corn, beans, flour, soy beans, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.en:
Ivelisse is a soft-spoken, but hard working woman in her mid-thirties. She lives with her husband and two children in the small rural town of Consuelo. In Consuelo, she is surrounded by agriculture and vegetables such as yucca, a variety of other tubers (which have a close resemblance to potatoes), plantains, and plenty of sugar cane.

She is asking for this loan so that she can afford to purchase some of these vegetables in bulk quantity, fresh from the local farmers. After being able to purchase them, she will then re-sell them to smaller vendors at a marked-up price; as such she will be able to integrate herself into the food supply chain, and as a result, begin earning money for her family.

Her dream is to one day have enough money to purchase and own her home and vehicle. Consuelo is a beautiful town, but somewhat disconnected from the rest of the island—a vehicle would allow her and her children to more frequently visit family members living in other areas, family members that she says she misses dearly.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Ivelisse herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco lives in his own house in the street 27 de Mayo of the San Juan Cotahuma area of the city of La Paz. He is married and he has children. His main occupation is in construction (contractor). Equally, he works with his wife who is a seamstress. She makes suits and others. The requested credit is to acquire a sewing machine and fabric to make the suits. Francisco's history is good, therefore he is qualified to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor vive en casa propia en la calle 27 de mayo de la zona de San Juan Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene hijos. Su ocupación principal es la albañilería (contratista). Igualmente, trabaja con su esposa que es costurera. La pareja confecciona trajes y otros. El crédito solicitado es para adquirir una máquina y tela para la elaboración de trajes. Los antecedentes de Francisco son buenos, por lo cuál él esta calificado para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel is a married man with three children. He is the owner of a well-stocked general store in one of the busiest areas of the city, Caacupe, which he manages day-to-day with the help of his wife.

His business is located out of his household, and with this loan from the Paraguay Foundation, he will use one part to finish the floor of his business, and the other part to buy merchandise such as beer, sodas, meat, oil, flour, sugar, wine, crackers/cookies, coffee, and yerba, among other necessary products.

Miguel comments that sales have slowed a bit, perhaps because in February and March, there are costs around school supplies, school enrollment, and uniforms.

The sales that never falter are the drinks, and each weekend, there are high sales of these products, especially weekends in which the temperature is high.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

Miguel, es un señor casado y tiene 3 hijos, es dueño de una despensa bien surtida y equipada, en unos de los barrios más poblados de la ciudad de Caacupé, la atención de la misma lo realiza con su señora quien día a día lo apoya y conjuntamente administran el negocio.

Su despensa esta úbicada en su domicilio y con el préstamo que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya, una parte lo invirtió en la terminación del piso del negocio y la otra parte en la compra de mercaderías como cervezas, gaseosas, carnes, aceite, harina, azúcar, vino, galletas, café, yerba, entre otros productos de primera necesidad.

Comenta Miguel que últimamente las ventas disminuyeron un poco, quizas porque los meses de febrero y marzo son temporadas donde los gastos familiares se orientan más a la compra de útiles, pagos de inscripción, compras de uniformes, etc.

No obstante el rubro que nunca disminuye es el de las bebidas y cada fin de semana se registra buen movimiento en la venta de estos productos y especialmente los fines de semana cuando la temperatura es muy elevada.

loans.use: To buy sugar, yerba, milk, soda, meat, and all kinds of drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, yerba, milk, soda, and beef.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
As he is always looking for ways in which to earn more money for his family, Orlando O. spends all his time looking after businesses. He now has a grocery store and a sweet shop, which is a recent addition as he used to have a mechanic workshop which, unfortunately, he had to close due to competition. He therefore started the sweet shop with his wife, who is a primary school teacher.

Orlando, who has 1 son, is not afraid of any business, and he has a great vision for the progress of all his businesses. The wellbeing of his family is what motivates him everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Siempre con la idea de buscar formas de obtener ingreso económico para mantener a su familia, Orlando O. emplea todo su tiempo para el manejo de sus negocios. Actualmente tiene una bodega y un taller de confección. Este último lo cambio no hace mucho por un taller de mecánica que tenia. Lamentablemente por el exceso de competencia decidió por cerrar su taller de mecánica y empezó un taller de confección con la ayuda de su esposa, quien labora como profesora de primaria. Orlando, padre de un hijo, no le teme a nada cuando de negocio se trata, tiene la visión de progreso bien en claro y la búsqueda del bienestar familiar es lo que lo motiva a seguir trabajando día a día.

loans.use: To finish building his house and to build some rooms to rent/El qusiera poder terminar de construir su casa y construir habitaciones para alquiler

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila is a married woman and has five children. For over 10 years, she has owned a general store which she operates out of her household in the Santa Ana neighborhood in the city of Caacupe. She comments that some of those years were very difficult, when the sales slowed in the financial crisis that affected the country in the nineties. Today the economic situation is again looking bad, and a large amount of young neighbors and clients at the store are migrating in the search of work. However, one of her hopes is that with this new government, which will soon be elected, the economic situation of the country will improve and there will be more opportunities for work, preventing the family of Paraguay from dividing and keeping the youth of the country working at home and preventing them from migrating.

The loans from the Paraguay Foundation will be used to increase stock of yerba, sugar, crackers/cookies, milk, eggs, meat, wine, and coffee, among other needed products. Also, Lucila has thought of turning a percentage of the loan to buy iced drinks of all types.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

Lucila, es una señora casada y tiene 5 hijos, ella posee una despensa en su domicilio en el barrio Santa Ana de la ciudad de Caacupé, el negocio lo tiene ya hace mas de 10 años, y comenta que algunos años fueron muy difíciles ya que las ventas disminuyeron bastante producto de la crisis financiera que afecto al pais en los años 90, actualmente también la situación no es muy buena comenta la señora Lucila, ya una buena cantidad de jovenes vecinos y clientes de sus despensa viajarón al exterior en busca de trabajo, no obstante uno de sus anhelos es que con este nuevo gobierno, que será electo la situación economica del pais mejore y haya mas fuentes de trabajo y asi evitar que la familia Paraguaya se divida y los jovenes puedan obtener trabajo y dejen de migrar.

Los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya lo invirtió en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su despensa, como: yerba, azúcar, galleta, leche, huevo, carne, vino, café, galletas, entre otros productos de primera necesidad.

Tiene pensado invertir un buen porcenteje del préstamo en la compra de bebidas heladas de todo tipo.

loans.use: To buy cookies/crackers, sugar, yerba, milk, soda, beef, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa lives with her husband (who is a police officer) and her three children in the street " CH " of the Progreso zone located in the city of El Alto. Felipa produces along with her eldest daughter alpaca wool gloves, which are sold to intermediaries. Felipa is requesting the loan to buy production supplies for her business. This is her third loan IMPRO, due to her history record she is qualified to receive another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa vive junto a su esposo (cuyo trabajo es ser policía) y sus tres hijos en la calle “CH” de la zona Progreso ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Junto a su hija mayor, Felipa se dedica a la confección de guantes de lana de alpaca, los cuales son vendidos a intermediarios. La beneficiaria solicita crédito para la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Este es el tercer crédito de la clienta con Impro, debido a sus antecedentes ella esta calificada para recibir otro préstamo.

loans.use: Buy production supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso Group

texts.en:
Aridaysi is a 28 year old woman who lives in the small community of Guaricanos, located on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She lives with her husband and five children, and is taking out her first loan to start her own micro-business.

She plans to use the money to start a small business selling new clothing to her community members. In her community, L. Guaricanos, the majority of the people live very poorly, but there are a few who have enough money to buy new clothes and for that very reason she sees an opportunity to start a business to meet a need that often goes unmet. She says that she hopes in a few years her business will have done so well that she will be able to own her own store where people come to her for her clothes. For her family, she hopes to see her children become prepared professionals and responsible adults, and to one day in the near future buy a home they can call their own.

Although things can often be very challenging and trying, Aridaysi says that she knows she is hard working, and that this loan will help her achieve her dreams.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Aridaysi herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To start a new business selling new clothing to her community members.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan lives in Sandino Memorial district: he is aged 37 years old, is married and has three sons aged 3, 12 and 18 years old. His wife sells cosmetics and clothes and also helps with homework.
