Juan has a repair workshop and 15 years of experience in the business. He began repairing filing cabinets, refrigerators and cookers. Currently he has diversified his work, buying appliances in poor repair and offering them to his clients with a profit margin greater than 100%.

With the authorised loan, he is going to buy more equipment in poor states and add value to them in order to sell them on at a better price, as he has already been doing. In the future he wants to establish a prestigious workshop which will offer security and satisfaction, with good working conditions and atmosphere.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Juan habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, su edad es 37 años casado y con tres hijos varones de 3,12, y 18 años de edad, su esposa vende cosmético y ropa y así ayudar al hogar. El Sr. Juan tiene un negocio de enderezado y pintura con 15 años de experiencia, el inicio reparando archivos y refrigeradoras y cocinas. Actualmente ha diversificado su trabajo comprando equipos en mal estado reparándolos y ofreciéndoselos a sus clientes con un margen de ganancia mayor al 100%.

Con el préstamo que se le otorgue va a comprar mas equipos en mal estado y proporcionarlo con un valor agregado y comercializarlo a un mayor precio ya que le ha resultado a futuro quiere un taller de prestigio que de segurita y sastifacer a sus clientes con condiciones laboral y ambiental.

loans.use: Purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Ivonne Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivonne began her business thanks to the need to help with household expenses. She sells clothes and make-up. She is married and aged 27: her husband is a cabinet-maker and they live in suburb 380. They have two sons, one aged 3 and one aged 7. She wants to invest the loan in a wall in order to ensure her family’s security and that of her business, so that in the future she will be able to increase sales.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Ivonne comenzó su negocio debido a la necesidad de ayudar a los gastos del hogar. Ella vende ropa y cosmético. Es casada tiene 27 años de edad su esposo es ebanista y habitan en el barrio 380, tienen dos hijos varones uno de 3 y 7 años de edad El préstamo lo quiere invertir en un muro y obtener mayor seguridad para su familia y su negocio que a futuro espera incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Building a perimeter wall to secure her house

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
A pharmacist by profession as well as a wife and mother of 2 young kids, Elena is a very hard working woman who owns 2 businesses: a small pharmacy which she has had for 3 years, and a bookshop which she opened barely 2 years ago. Moreover, each morning she works in a state owned medical centre, dealing with women's concerns, a service that she also offers in her pharmacy and home. However, her goal is to finish building their house so that she can open a general hospital for her community; but in order to do this she needs to finish building her house.

She got this idea as there are not many medical services near where she lives, and she also has support from her family as some of them are specialists in different fields of medicine, like nutrition, general medicine etc. Thanks to her hard work and the support of her husband, who works as an electrician, her dream is not too far from being achieved. She is sure that very soon she will be able to start building the general hospital.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Obstetra de profesión, esposa y madre de dos pequeños niños. Elena es una mujer trabajadora que se encarga de manejar dos negocios a la vez, una botica que tiene tres años y una librería con apenas dos años de formada. Además, durante las mañanas trabaja en un centro médico del estado ofreciendo consultas a mujeres, servicio que también lo brinda en su consultorio de la botica y a domicilio. No obstante, su meta es terminar de construir su casa con la idea de abrir un policlínico para su comunidad, para ello necesita terminar de construir su casa. Esta idea le nació al ver que no hay muchos servicios de salud por donde vive, por otro lado, tiene el apoyo de algunos familiares quienes también son especialistas en diversas ramas de medicina como nutrición, medicina general, etc.. Gracias a su trabajo constante y al apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como electricista, este sueño no está lejos de concretarse. Ella se siente segura de que no falta mucho para poder empezar a construir su policlínico.

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish off their house/Compra de materiales de construccion para culminar los trabajos de la construccion en su casa

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
This group from the Arroyo Pora neighborhood has come about due to the influence of another group of women who already have a loan group and are very pleased with the results they’ve obtained. Teresa A. is the General Director of the group, Claudia B. is the Director of Finances, Esmeralda S. is the Director of Public Relations, Victoria C. is the Director of Social Matters, and Wilma Martínez is the Director of Training.

Currently, the group is composed of 20 hardworking women whose businesses are diverse. Among them we can cite: kiosks, bars, seamstressing, cosmetics sales, the sale of a variety of merchandise, food sales, fuel sales, making and selling homemade bread, the sale of aloe vera products, and making aho poí (a typical Paraguayan embroidery), among others. Each member receives, on average, the sum of G. 685,000, which they reinvest in their businesses for the purchase of the ingredients and supplies they need for their small businesses and also a variety of merchandise for resale.

It is for this reason that credit is also a very important tool for these women. With it, they have the possibility of growing and expanding their businesses, so that they can continually increase their income.

With the loan that is being requested on this occasion, these enterprising women will be able to do the following: buy clothing, cosmetics, ingredients for making homemade bread and fast foods—such as flour, milk, eggs, yeast, meats, vegetables, salt, and sugar, among others; to by a variety of items for the sale of jewelry, cosmetics, toys, ect.; also merchandise for small grocery stores, such as canned goods, rice, noodles, and beverages in general; and for the women who work as seamstresses—fabrics, threads, elastics, zippers, buttons, and other sewing supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Este comité del Barrio Arroyo Pora ha surgido gracias a las influencias de otro grupo de mujeres que poseen ya su comité y están encantadas con el resultado que obtienen. Teresa A. es la Directora General del grupo, Claudia B. es la Directorias de Finanzas, Esmeralda S. Directora de Relaciones Públicas, Victoria C. es Directoria de Asuntos Sociales, y Wilma Martínez es Directora de Capacitación.

Actualmente el comité esta integrado por 20 mujeres trabajadoras cuyas actividades son diversas, entre ellas podemos citar: kioscos, copetín (bar), costureras, venta de ropas, venta de cosméticos, venta de mercaderías varias, venta de comestibles, venta de combustibles, elaboración y venta de pan casero, venta de productos de Aloe Vera, elaboración de Bordados en Aho poí (bordado típico de Paraguay), entre otros. Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de G. 685.000 que lo reinvierten en sus negocios para la compra de insumos necesarios para sus microempresas así como también mercaderías varias para sus ventas.

Es por eso que el crédito también es una herramienta muy importante de trabajo para estas señoras, ya que con él tienen la posibilidad de ir creciendo y expandiendo sus actividades, de modo a obtener cada vez más mayores ingresos.

Con el crédito solicitado en esta ocasión estas mujeres emprendedoras podrán adquirir lo siguiente: compra de prendas de vestir, cosméticos, ingredientes para la elaboración de pan casero y comidas rápidas como harina, leche, huevos, levadura, carnes, verduras, sal, azúcar, entre otros; compra de artículos variados para la venta como bijouterie, cosméticos, juguetes, etc.; también mercaderías para despensa como productos enlatados, arroz, fideos y bebidas en general, y para las señoras que se dedican a la costura telas, hilos, elásticos, cierres, botones y demás insumos para la confección.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics, flour, salt, meta, fruits and vegetables, milk, eggs, canned products, rice, noodles, and beverages in general; to buy fabrics, threads, elastic, zippers, and buttons, among others.

loans.name: Karla Magdalena

texts.es:
Mrs. V. is 36 years old, lives in Stage III of the Hialeah neighborhood, and has a beautiful 16-year-old girl. She is an English academic advisor with five years of experience. With the loan, she wants to build a room onto her house. She has been making home improvements with the loans given to her by Afodenic and part of her savings. In the future, she wants to set up a business for the stability of her family.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. V. habita en el barrio Hialeah III etapa, tiene 36 años de edad y una hermosa joven de 16 años de edad, es asesora académica del área de ingles con 5 años de experiencia. Con el préstamo desea construir un cuarto ella ha venido haciendo mejoras a su casa con prestamos que Afodenic le ha otorgado y con parte de sus ahorros. En un futuro desea poner un negocio para la solidez de su familia.

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
María Nelly sees herself as a calm, hard-working, and responsible person. She began her business due to the need for an income aside from her husband’s to cover the household expenses. They have three children who grow each day, as well as their economical needs.

She began some time ago selling different products and even had a home-made food shop which she had to close because of the increase in the shop’s rent, and because the owners were asking for the shop. So, one of her aunts convinced her to sell clothes and offered taking her to places were she could buy clothes at good prices such as Moroleon, Monterrey, and the Federal District. She followed her aunt’s advice and began to sell clothes in April 2006, for Child’s Day (El Dia del Nino). Her sales went very well because her neighbors and friends put in orders for their children. She now has a fair number of clients.

Maria Nelly asks for US $300 which she will pay in 6 months to purchase seasonal garments. She wants to take advantage of the dates and have a more diverse variety of garments for her clients, which will allow her to increase her sales.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

María Nelly se considera una persona muy tranquila, trabajadora y responsable. Inició el negocio porque era necesario tener un ingreso aparte del de su esposo para poder cubrir los gastos de la casa, ya que tiene tres hijos y cada vez van creciendo más y sus necesidades también se van incrementando.

Comenzó hace algún tiempo vendiendo diversos productos e inclusive tuvo un negocio de comida casera, el cual tuvo que cerrar porque le subieron la renta y le pidieron el local, pero una de sus tías la convenció para que vendiera ropa y que ella le ayudaría llevándola a lugares donde se puede comprar ropa a buenos precios en ciudades como Moroleón y Monterrey y el D.F. Siguió su consejo y comenzó en Abril de 2006 vendiendo ropa para el día del niño y le fue muy bien ya que sus vecinas y amistades le hicieron pedidos para sus hijos y en la actualidad cuenta con un buen número de clientes.

Solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ropa de temporada aprovechando las fechas y poder tener un mejor surtido para sus clientes, lo cual le permitirá aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Marbella De Los Ange

texts.es:
Marbella is 37 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She is married and has two children: a one-year-old and a nine-year-old. Her husband works in a sawmill. She began her business by selling cosmetics to family members.

She wants to diversify her products and capture new sectors of the market. She has been working for five years, in which growth has been minimal due to a lack of financing. She is requesting this loan to build a room and improve her family and social status. In the future, she wants to live in a dwelling in better conditions and have a solid business.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Doña Marbella tiene 37 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino es casada y tiene una familia de dos hijos una de una de un año y otra de 9 años de edad. Su esposo es aserradero de madera, el negocio lo comenzó vendiendo cosmético sus primeros clientes fueron miembro de la familia.

Su deseo es diversificar el producto y acaparar nuevos segmentos de mercado su experiencia es de 5 años en donde su crecimiento ha sido mínimo por falta de financiamiento, el préstamo lo quiere para construir un cuarto y mejorar su estatus familiar y social. Ya que el futuro quiere lograr una vivienda con mejores condiciones y un negocio solidó.

loans.use: Construct a room

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and has three children, who are 12, 8, and 6 years old. All three study at a school in the same neighborhood where they live because it is too difficult to get to the city center of Encarnación, since both Lilian and her husband have to work.

They have lived in their own house for many years. They acquired it through much sacrifice, since they had to double their efforts and go through some very difficult times in order to get together enough money to buy it so that they could give their children an improved life. Lilian owns a very well stocked small grocery store in the house, which allows her to be at home and take care of her family.

Lilian’s husband is a street vendor that sells a variety of merchandise in the neighborhoods of Encarnación. In this way they both contribute their income to their household and expenses.

Lilian sells different types of basic goods merchandise in her store. In general, small grocery stores like this are the most frequented for daily purchases in the country. Despite the fact that there are municipal markets and supermarket chains, the small grocery stores continue to be the most convenient and inexpensive option.

Lilian is requesting a loan today with which she will augment her stock of merchandise and buy a greater variety of products so as to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lilian tiene 31 años, vive en pareja y tiene tres hijos, de 12, 8 y 6 años, los tres estudian en un colegio de la zona de su casa, ya que le es difícil venir hasta centro mismo de la ciudad de Encarnación para que estudien por el tema que tanto ella como su pareja trabajan.

Viven en su casa propia hace muchos años, la misma fue adquirida bajo mucho sacrificio de parte de la pareja, ya que tuvieron que redoblar sus esfuerzos y pasar por momentos muy difíciles para poder reunir el dinero suficiente para comprarse la casa y dar una seguridad mayor a sus hijos. Lilian posee una despensa muy bien surtida de mercaderías en su domicilio lo que permite que este todo el día en la casa cuidando al mismo tiempo de su familia.

La pareja de Lilian se dedica a la venta ambulante de mercaderías varias por los barrios de la ciudad de Encarnación, de este modo ambos aportan con los ingresos a la casa y hacen frente a los gastos.

Lilian comercializa distintos tipos de mercaderías para consumo diario en su tienda, por lo general, las despensas son las tiendas mas recurridas para abastecimientos en los barrios del país, a pesar de que existen los mercados municipales y las cadenas de supermercados, las despensas siguen siendo la opción mas rápida y cómoda de comprar.

Lilian solicita el crédito hoy día, pues con el mismo busca acrecentar su stock de mercaderías y variar más sus productos de modo a poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise such as dairy products, breads, soft drinks, vegetables, fruits, sweets, canned goods, and noodles, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia considers herself a hardworking, responsible and happy person. She started her business as a means to make a living, given the present very difficult financial situation. In this way, she can support her children, some of which are still in school. She started in May 2004, when a friend convinced her to start selling second-hand clothes, which are in great demand and have a good profit margin. She started at home, then, on the days when she didn’t have to work as house aid, at ambulant markets. At times, at the houses where she worked, she would be given used clothes, which she would sell, in addition to the ones she would buy wholesale.

She is requesting a $300 loan, to be repaid in six months, in order to buy lighter warm season clothes, as she wants to have a good stock to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonia se considera una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y alegre. Inició el negocio para tener un medio de subsistir, ya que la situación económica actualmente es muy difícil y, de esta manera, puede sacar adelante a sus hijos, algunos de los cuales todavía estudian. Comenzó en Mayo de 2004, cuando una amiga la convenció de que vendiera ropa usada, ya que ésta se vende mucho y deja una buena ganancia. Se animó a comenzar en su casa y luego en los mercados ambulantes, los días que no le tocaba trabajar en casas. A veces, en las casas donde trabaja, también le regalan ropa usada en buenas condiciones, la cual aprovecha para vender, aparte de la que ella compra a mayoreo.

Solicita un préstamo por US $300, que pagará en 6 meses, para comprar ropa de temporada de calor, ya que en esta época la gente usa prendas de vestir más ligeras y quiere tener un buen surtido que ofrecerles a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy warm season clothes.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Day after day, Adela gets up early so that she can organize and tend her small business, formed barely two years ago. With the idea of generating extra income, she jumped on the idea of opening a small shop, something moreover that she already had experience doing. She worked before as a clerk in a store. That was the seed of the idea and she started off small, but always with the hope of growing and moving ahead. She and her husband are now the parents of three school-age children. Her husband is a factory worker and, happily, he completely supports her. In the future, she hopes to keep on growing her business and making it bigger and bigger but she knows that she needs a strong base to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Día a día Adela se levanta por las mañanas para poder arreglar y atender su pequeño negocio, el cual tiene apenas dos años de formado. Con la idea de contar con un ingreso adicional se animo a abrir una bodega. Porque además ya tenía cierta experiencia en ello; anteriormente ella estuvo trabajando en una tienda como vendedora. Es así que decidió empezar y lo hizo de a pocos, pero siempre con la esperanza de seguir creciendo y progresando. Actualmente ella y su esposo son padres de tres niños que se encuentran en edad escolar. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica, felizmente él la apoya en todo. En un futuro ella espera seguir creciendo en su negocio, implementarlo y hacerlo más grande, pero ella sabe que solo a base de esfuerzo lo podrá lograr.

loans.use: Stock more merchaise.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda started the business to help her husband because, at times, his income doesn't stretch to meeting all of their family's ever-increasing expenses. She started in February 2006 when her mother pushed her to sell jewelry in the days before Valentine's Day, a time when she could more easily move her products. That's how she started, first selling to neighbors and friends, then adding more customers, selling not only jewelry but also a well-known brand of beauty products and even used clothes from time to time.

Griselda is applying for a US$300 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy jewelry so that she will have a better inventory and be able to offer a wider range to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Griselda inició el negocio para tener una entrada extra de dinero para ayudar a mi esposo ya que a veces no nos alcanza con lo que gana y nuestras necesidades son cada vez mayores. Comenzó en Febrero del 2006 cuando su mamá se animó a que vendiera joyería ya que se acercaba el día de San Valentín y podría colocar mas fácilmente los productos, fue así como inicio, primero vendiendo entre sus vecinas y amistades, después fue incrementando mas clientes, aparte de que también vendo productos de belleza de reconocida marca y a veces también vendo ropa usada.

Solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de un lote de joyería que le permitirá tener un mejor surtido para poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel L. (27) is a young man who five years ago decided to open his own spare parts shop. Before that, Miguel used to work as an assistant in other spare parts shop, where he gained a lot of experience and knowledge in the area.

What is worthy to mention about Miguel’s business is that he demonstrates that he cares about his employees. Besides giving them jobs, he tries to educate them. For instance, now Miguel is paying the educational fees for one of his employees. “I want well-prepared people working with me,” says Miguel. Miguel has a family consisting of his wife Hilda Nunez (27) and his child.

Miguel needs the credit to buy cars’ accessories such as: loud speakers and radios.

loans.use: To buy car accessories such as speakers and radios.

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
Leonardo lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua. He's a married man, 52, and his wife sells clothes and cosmetics to help with expenses. He owns a minibus that he uses to take school-aged children to and from school, something he's done for 15 years. He started the business when he used a loan to buy a vehicle and contracted with the school to bus their students. With this loan, he hopes to build a room on his house that he will rent and, in the future, buy another minibus.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. M. habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino . Es casado con 52 años de edad su esposa vende ropa y cosmético para ayudar en los gastos. El es transportista tiene un microbús de recorrido del colegio con 15 años de trabajar, este negocio comenzó cuando se decidió a adquirir un vehiculo al crédito y así comenzó hacer un contrato con el colegio para traslados de los alumnos ahora con este préstamo desea construir un cuarto de habitación para alquiler y en un futuro adquirir otra unidad de transporte.

loans.use: Build a room.

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
In a city called Yaguaron, there is this group of women full of entrepreneurial ideas. They want to do something to improve their quality of life and they know that the only way to do that is by working very hard.

They are involved in many activities. Some of them own a grocery store, others a sewing workshop; some are housekeepers; others sell different products from animals and flowers to bijouterie. The credit provided would be used to buy raw materials depending on their business.

This group of 19 women, called “Ko’e Pyahu”, has been working with Fundacion Paraguay for a long time. They demonstrate to us they are always working as a team, respecting each other and repaying their loans on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy raw materials depending on their business and some products including sugar, rice, milk, cheese, bread, pasta and others.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
In a city called Yaguaron, 15 km. away from our Paraguari branch office, there is a group of women with full of entrepreneurial ideas. They want to do something to improve their quality of life and they know that the only way to do that is by working very hard.

They are involved in many activities. Some of them own a grocery store, others a sewing workshop; some are housekeepers; others sell different products from food and vegetables to underwear. The credit provided would be used to buy raw materials depending on their business. For example, fabrics, food and drinks.

This group of 16 women called “San Francisco” has been working with Fundacion Paraguaya showing us an excellent performance in its payment.

loans.use: Its loans would be invested in each of their activities. Purchase of fabrics, thread, meta, drinks, milk, pasta, rice, lingerie, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Even though she has been working in her grocery store for 20 years, María continues with the same strength, and even more, than what she started with. She is a 58-year-old woman and mother. Thanks to her efforts, the location of her grocery store is being modified and expanded because the space that she had before is very small when compared with how much her business has grown in the last few years. She started by selling drinks that she made herself, then she participated in sales campaigns on different dates of the year (Christmas, Mother's Day, the start of the school year, etc.).

It was when she built her house that it occured to her to build an additional room with the idea of starting a business. As such, once her house was constructed, she decided to open her grocery store. Little by little, she has implemented it, and now, she not only sells groceries, but also office supplies.

María's main motivation in these months is the education of her youngest daughter, who is 18-years-old, and who wants to enroll in a graphic design school.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

A pesar de que ya lleva veinte años trabajando en su bodega, María continúa con las mismas fuerzas, e incluso más, que con las que empezó. Ella es una mujer y madre de familia de cincuenta y ocho años de edad. Gracias a su esfuerzo, el local de su bodega está siendo modificado y ampliado pues el espacio que tenía antes ya le quedaba muy chico para lo mucho que ha crecido su negocio en estos últimos años. Al inicio ella empezó vendiendo bebidas hechas por ella misma, luego participaba de campañas de venta en diversas fechas del año (navidad, día de la madre, época escolar, etc). Fue cuando construyó su casa que se le ocurrió construir una habitación adicional con la idea de poner un negocio. Por lo tanto, una vez que estuvo construida su casa, decidió abrir su bodega. Poco a poco la ha ido implementando y, hoy, no solo vende productos de bodega sino también artículos de oficina. La principal motivación de María en estos meses es la educación de su última hija quien tiene dieciocho años y desea postular a una institución para estudiar diseño gráfico.

loans.use: To finish remodeling her grocery store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa Rodríguez V. belongs to the Communal Bank “Dynamic Women”. She lives in the San Martín region in the Picota province and Picota district. Her home and business are located at the Jr. El Comercio, where she sells basic medicine for first aid and over-the-counter medicines. She's a nurse by trade, and in addition to her work in the store she offers medical care and sells basic medicines to nearby communities on the weekends.

With a loan of 1,000.00 soles, Teresa will buy medicines, such as: anesthetics, antipyretics, and supplies to make serums and give injections. These are in high demand by the patients that she tends. She'll pay back the loan in 6 months.

Theresa is 52 years old and has spent most of her life working in rural zones, where she learned to treat people with many health needs. She is happy to be able to help others with her business. Because of this, her store never has a set schedule and she's always ready to help those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Teresa R. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal” Mujeres Dinamicas” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota , su domicilio y negocio están ubicados en el Jr. El Comercio, se dedica a la venta de Medicina Básica para primeros auxilios y confecciones en general Es enfermera técnica de profesión y paralelo a este trabajo ofrece asistencia sanitaria, venta de medicinas básicas recorriendo los fines de semana las comunidades cercanas Con el préstamo por S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará medicinas como analgésicos, antipiréticos en cajas y material para dar servicio de inyectables y sueros, que son los que tienen mayor requerimiento entre los pacientes que atiende. . La señora Teresa, tiene 52 años, y es una mujer que la mayor parte de su vida ha trabajado por zonas rurales donde aprendió a servir a personas con muchas necesidades de salud y se siente feliz de poder servir a los demás con su negocio que no tiene horario definido y que siempre está al servicio de los demás.

loans.use: With a loan Teresa will buy medicines to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana started her business to get ahead. She started a grocery store to help with her family's expenses. She started 2 years ago by selling fried snacks, until she had supplied the store with canned goods and basic grocery items.

Now she is requesting a loan of $200, which she will repay in 3 months so she can buy a display case for cold meat and dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juana inició el negocio para salir adelante por su misma puso un tienda de abarrotes para apoyar con el gasto familiar. Comenzó hace 2 años solo vendiendo frituras tipo snack, hasta empezar a surtir la tienda lateria y canasta básica.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses de manera que puede comprar una vitrina para carnes frías y lácteos

loans.use: To buy a display case

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora is a member of the Mujeres Dinamicas ("Dynamic Women") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "region" of San Marin and her shop is located in her house. She sells groceries, snacks and other everyday items. She used to work as a nutritionist in a hospital and then as a meat vendor, her first foray into the world of business. She decided to remodel a room in her house where she set up her shop. She saw, wisely as it turned out, that there were no businesses like hers in the neighborhood. With the S/.2000 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy eggs, canned fish, rice, sugar, cooking oil and other products for her shop.

Dora is married and has 4 children. Her husband supports her completely and they will soon be able to open a "polleria" (a shop for selling chicken) and a "chifa" (a Peruvian word for a Chinese food restaurant) that their daughter will run.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Dora D. V., es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Dinamicas, vive en la Region San Marin, Provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, su bodega está ubicada en su propia casa situado en la Av. Marginal carretera Fernanco Belaunde Terri, vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de soncumo diario. Antes trabajaba en el hospital como nutricionista, luedo se dedicó a vender carnes rojas, chorizo, cecina y comuda iniciándose así en el mundo del negocio. Decide acondicionar en su casa un ambiente donde implementó su bodega, además con buena visión vio que en la zona no había un negocio como el de ella. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará huevos en javas, distintas variedades de conservas de pescado en cajas,arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en litros, además de sutir con productos de aseo para el hogar y personal.

Ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo la apoya siempre en el negocio, juntos podrán muy pronto una pollería y un chifa el cual estará administrado por su hija , y así asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Buy merchanidse for resale.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Mrs. Marisol T. F. is a member of the “All United” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region of Peru, in the Picota province, district of Picota. She works selling clothing for men, women and children from her house located on Jr. Las Vegas S/N Street. She travels to nearby communities in order to sell her clothing. With this loan of 1,000 soles ($375), which she will repay over 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of underwear by the dozen for boys and girls, pants and polo shirts for men, women, boys and girls, and athletic shirts for women. She hopes to supply her business in order to satisfy her customers with varying tastes in fashion. She is 27 years old, originally from Picota, and has two children, both minors. She is known to her clients as being courteous and helpful. She is concerned with getting her family ahead and being an example for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marisol T. F., socia del Banco Comunal “Todas Unidas”, vive el la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, se dedica al negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, en su casa situado en el Jr. Las Vegas S/N. desde donde sale a vender a las comunidades mas cercanas. Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00, que será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropas interiores por docenas, para niñas y niños, pantalones y polos para damas y caballeros, niños y niñas, blusas sport para damas, Para surtir su negocio busca satisfacer a sus clientes en todos sus gustos con las novedades. Ella tiene 27 años de edad, natural de Picota y 02 hijos, ambos menores de edad. Se caracteriza por ser gentil y muy atenta con sus clientes. Se preocupada por sacar adelante a su familia y por ser un ejemplo para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Coralia Argentina

texts.es:
Coralia is 27 years old and lives in Sabana Grande. She is married and has a four-year-old son. Her husband is self-employed as a driver and she owns a small business, which she began a year and a half ago with the help of financing. It has become difficult for her to acquire products; she needs more investment in order to set up and strengthen her locale to increase her sales of motor oil. Her goal is to improve her home and educate her children.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Coralia tiene 27 años de edad vive en Sabana Grande es casada tiene un niño de 4 años su esposo es conductor por cuenta propia, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de año y medio que comenzó con financiamiento, con dificultad para adquirir los productos ya que necesita mas inversión para fortalecer y condicionar el lugar en la venta de aceite de lubricante de vehiculo y elevar su nivel de ofertas. Esto con el propósito de mejoras de su vivienda y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: To set up her workspace

loans.name: Rita Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mrs. Rita Guadalupe R. P. lives in the San Martin region, in the Picota province, district of Picota. She belongs to the “Dynamic Women” Communal Bank, and works selling juices and sandwiches. Her stall is located inside market 1 in the Picota district. Thanks to the guidance of her parents, she works in the business of selling fruit juices and extracts, as well as snacks such as sweets and cakes, among other things. She begins selling her products very early each day. With this loan of 1,300 soles ($500), which will be repaid over 6 months, she will buy a new blender, dishes such as glasses appropriate for juice sales, as well as flour, sugar, and butter by the kilo, and other ingredients for the preparation of breads. Rita lives with her husband and her daughter. Day after day they do their best to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rita Guadalupe R. P., vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota pertenece al Banco Comunal .”Mujeres Dinamicas”, su puesto de venta de jugos y emparedados se ubica en los interiores del mercado N° 1 del distrito de Picota. . Gracias a la orientación de sus padres se dedica a este tipo de negocio, la venta de jugos y extracto de frutas y refrigerios como: dulces, kekes, entre otros que ha diario es ofrecido desde muy tempranas. Con el crédito de S/. 1300.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará una nueva licuadora, vajillas como vasos apropiados para la venta de jugos, además comprará harina, azúcar, y manteca en kilos y otros insumos para la elaboración de los panes Rita, vive con su esposo y su hija, juntos día a día se esmeran por alcanzar sus objetivos.

loans.use: Purchase more products for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Her whole life Julia has dedicated herself to the household chores and looking after her family’s wellbeing. Even so, at times, when they have had the opportunity, her kids have bought her merchandise to sell from home to family and friends. When her husband died she really felt the need to be able to earn some money herself, as apart from just the household costs she also has a son who has heart problems, and has been unable to get up for 4 years.

It was only 3 years ago that Julia, with the money that she had saved, decided to open a shop, and she bought a little to start off with. This is how is started, and she achieved a part of her dream of having a business. Now she wants to enlarge it and make it more productive. Happily, she has a lot of support from her eldest kids, without their help it would be very difficult for her to go on.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Translator

Durante toda su vida Julia se ha dedicado plenamente a los quehaceres del hogar y al bienestar de su familia. Aunque por temporadas, según había la oportunidad, sus hijos le compraban mercadería pequeña para que la vendiera dentro de su casa a amigos o familiares. Cuando su esposo falleció sintió más la necesidad de contar con un recurso propio, pues aparte de tener los gastos de la casa tiene a su cargo un hijo quien padece de problemas cardiacos y está en reposo desde hace cuatro años. Fue recién hace tres años que Julia, con un dinero ahorrado que tenia, se animo por abrir una tienda y compró lo poco que podía para poder empezar. Y así fue, cumplió parte de su sueño de poder tener una tienda ahora sus planes esta en ampliarla y hacerla más productiva. Felizmente recibe el apoyo de sus hijos mayores, sin la ayuda de ellos se le haría muy difícil poder continuar por su cuenta.

loans.use: To stock her small shop with more merchandise/Abastecer de más mercadería su pequeña tienda

loans.name: Miranda

texts.es:
Mrs. Miranda U. E. is a member of the “All United” Communal Bank. She lives in the province of San Martin, Picota district. Encouraged by her mother-in-law and the experience that she had in this type of work, as well as the need to have her own income to contribute to the household economy, she decided to start selling breads of different varieties, as well as sweets. She has been doing this for the past year, and her products are requested by her neighbors for their good quality and hygiene. With the loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid over 6 months, Miranda will buy sacks of flour and sugar, eggs, liters of oil, packets of butter, and other ingredients for the preparation of a variety of breads and sweets which she carefully makes with the help of her husband and mother-in-law. She is 26 years old, lives with her husband and two children, and currently she feels more secure and independent, capable of making her own decisions. In the future she would like to have her own space where she can open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Miranda U. E. ,es socia del Banco Comunal “Todas Unidas”, vive en la región San Martín provincia y distrito de Picota motivada por su suegra y la experiencia que tenía en este tipo de trabajo y la necesidad de tener sus propios ingresos para ayudar en la economía del hogar decidió dedicarse a la venta de panes en sus diferentes variedades y dulces, desde hace 01 año, sus productos son muy solicitados por los moradores por la buena calidad e higiene. Con el crédito de S/.800.00 será pagado en 6 meses comprará harina y azúcar en sacos, huevos en javas, aceite en litros, mantequilla en paquetes y otros para la preparación de variados panes y dulces que los prepara con mucho esmero con el apoyo de su esposo y suegra. Ella tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, actualmente se siente mas segura, independiente, capaz de tomar sus propias decisiones, desea en un futuro tener un local propia para poner un restaurante.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for the preparation of her breads

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana began her business because she needed extra income. She's a single mother and she was looking for a way to pay everyday expenses as well as for the house where she was living, a heavy expense that left her with little extra income. That's why she started the business, selling shoes from catalogs, 2 years ago.

She's asking for a loan of US$250, to be repaid in 3 months, so that she can buy merchandise and sponsor showings. With your help, she'll succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Diana inició su negocio por la necesidad de tener ingresos extras dado que es madre soltera entonces busco la oportunidad de trabajar por su cuenta ya que además estaba pagando la casa donde vivía y esto le representaba un gasto fuerte ya que le dejaba muy pocos ingresos, por lo que emprendió una actividad extra a su trabajo hace 2 años con la venta de zapatos por catalogo.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y poder realizar demostraciones. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elizalda

texts.es:
Maria is married and has 2 children. She started her business because she wanted a career that would help her husband. She decided to enroll in beauty school. She began in her house 16 years ago as an apprentice to another person, developing her own style, until she was ready to go out on her own.

She's applying for a US$250 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy a new chair and remodel her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María es casada y tiene 2 hijos, inició su negocio por que siempre quiso aprender una profesión para apoyar a su esposo y decidió meterse a la escuela de belleza. Comenzó hace 16 años en su casa como aprendiz con otra persona hasta poner su estética para únicamente ver a sus clientes.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un sillón nuevo y remodelar parte de mi negocio como la fachada y pintura en general.

loans.use: Improve shop.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria is divorced and has 2 children. She started the business to get extra income to pay for her children's schooling because she couldn't count on her husband to pay for it. She was unemployed and unable to count on financial help from anyone else so she decided to start her own business to meet household expenses. She began a little more than a year ago with a rented food stand outside her house that she now owns.

Maria is applying for a US$250 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy supplies and new utensils. With your help, she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María del Carmen es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio para conseguir ingresos extras para pagar los estudios de sus hijos ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo. Se encontraba desempleada y no contaba con apoyo financiero de nadie por lo que decido iniciar su propio negocio para poder conseguir ingresos y sacar adelante los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace un poco más de un año con un puesto de comidas que rentaba afuera de su casa y actualmente ya es suyo.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses necesita para comprar mercancía y utensilios nuevos. Con tu apoyo podrá seguir adelante.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Meyling Raquel

texts.es:
Meyling has a 5 year old business selling silver accessories. She started the business with her own funds, hoping to help her husband with household expenses. She is 29 years old and lives in the Libertad neighborhood of Managua. Her husband works as a customs supervisor and they have 3 children, 2, 5 and 7. Her goal is to buy a house in a neighborhood where her children can get a good education. She wants to invest the loan in inventory so that she can sell more and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. M. tiene un negocio de 5 años ella vende prendas de plata su negocio lo inicio con fondos propios con el objetivo de apoyar económicamente a su marido actualmente tiene 29 años con dirección anexo villa libertad, su esposo trabaja es supervisor aduanero, tienen 3 hijos de 2, 5 y 7 años de edad. Su objetivo es comprar una casa en un reparto para lograr la buena educación de sus hijos. El capital de trabajo lo quiere invertir en inventario para vender más y obtener mas ganancias

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Giovanna Del Rosario

texts.es:
Giovanna used her own money to start a bakery business. She is 45 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. She's married and has 3 beautiful children, 2, 7 and 15. She and her husband, who is in Costa Rica, are saving money to educate their kids and make on-going improvements to their house. With the loan she is going to replace the roof so that water doesn't pour in during the winter and finish the house's porch.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Giovanna es una mujer que comenzó trabajando con su propio dinero haciendo repostería, ubicaba a sus clientes, ella tiene 45 años de edad y vive en los laureles sur es casada tiene 3 hermosos hijos de 2, 7, y 15 años. Con la ayuda de su esposo que esta en Costa Rica es ahorrar dinero para la educación de sus hijos, y seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda con el negocio quiere establecer una venta de cosmético y repostería en un puesto fijo bien ubicado. Con el préstamo va hacer cambio del techo para que no se le pase el agua en el invierno y concluir el porche de su casa.

loans.use: Replace roof.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Zoila Rosa P. F. is a member of the “All United” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, in the Picota province, Picota district. Her business is located at 368 Av. Malecón. Motivated by the experience that she had in this type of work, as well as the need to have her own income to contribute to the household economy, she decided to start selling breads of different varieties. She has been doing this for the past 11 years, and her products are very popular with her neighbors for their good quality and hygiene. With the loan of 1,200 soles, which will be repaid over 6 months, Miranda will buy sacks of flour and sugar, eggs, liters of oil, packets of butter, and other ingredients for the preparation of a variety of breads which she carefully makes with the help of her husband and children. She is 51 years old, lives with her husband and two children, and currently she feels more secure and independent, capable of making her own decisions. In the future she would like to have her own space where she can build an oven and open her own bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Zoila Rosa P. F., es socia del Banco Comunal “Todas Unidas”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia Picota y distrito de Picota, su negocio esta ubicado la Av. Malecón Nº 368, motivada por la experiencia que tenia en este tipo de trabajo y la necesidad de tener sus propios ingresos para ayudar en la economía del hogar decidió dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de panes en sus diferentes variedades, desde hace 11 años, sus productos son muy solicitados por los moradores por la buena calidad y higiene. Con el crédito de S/.1200.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses comprará: harina y azúcar en sacos, huevos en javas, aceite en litros, mantequilla en paquetes y otros para la preparación de variados panes que los prepara con mucho esmero con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos. Ella tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, actualmente se siente mas segura e independiente, capaz de tomar sus propias decisiones, desea en un futuro tener un local apropiado para construir un horno e instalar su propia panadería.

loans.use: Purchse ingredients for the preparation of her breads

loans.name: Merling Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Merling is 38-years-old and lives in the Francisco Salazar neighborhood. She is single with two sons, who are 18 and 17. They help her with the family's expenses by working in construction. She has had a grocery store for 3 years, which she started with the help of her parents. With this loan, she want to invest in the purchase of basic grains, which are what her customers buy the most. She wants to satisfy them and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña merlyng tiene 38 años de edad habita en el barrio Francisco Salazar, soltera con dos hijos de 18 y 17 años de edad que la ayudan con los gastos ellos trabajan en construcción su negocio es una pulpería con 3 años de tenerla que la comenzó con ayuda de sus padres, con el préstamo quiere invertir mas en granos básicos que son los que se adquieren mas y sastifacer a sus clientes, y mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: To invest in her grocery store

loans.name: Zary

texts.es:
Mrs. Zary A. P. is a member of the “Dynamic Women” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region of the Picota province, district of Picota. She works selling groceries, sweets, and soft drinks from her own home located at 386 Jr. Arica, where people from her neighborhood come daily to purchase her products. She decided to start her business with her sister’s help, with the goal of being able to control her own finances and increase the standard of living for her household, as she has a daughter who is a student. With the loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid over 6 months, she will purchase essential products such as: sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, oil, preserves, packets of noodles, detergents, and toilet paper, among other things, and in this way she will be able to meet the needs of her customers. Zary is 27 years old and her daughter is still dependent on her. Her goal for the future is to increase her sales and start another business selling soft drinks wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Zary A. P., es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Dinamicas ”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, en su propia casa ubicado Jr. Arica Nº 386, donde acuden diariamente a comprar los moradores del barrio. Decidió iniciar su negocio con el apoyo de su hermana con la finalidad de manejar sus propios ingresos y aumentar su nivel económico para su hogar, ya que tiene una hija que esta estudiando. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, conservas, paquetes de fideos, detergentes y papel higiénico entre otros y así poder llegar a satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 27 años y una niña que todavía depende de ella, su meta en el futuro es ampliar sus ventas y poner otro negocio de bebidas gaseosas al por mayor.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Simith

texts.es:
Mrs Simith F. R. is a member of the Community Bank “Sarita Colonia”. She lives in the region of San Martin. Her address is Mariscal Caceres province, Juanjui district, Eduardo Mena N° 756.

From her house, she distributes green bananas in large quantities to her clients so they can prepare “Sancochado”, the most common dish in all homes of the Peruvian rainforest.

Her sister had the idea to start this business as it is more profitable than the one she had before. She had sold clothes without problems due to the good quality of her goods as well as her charisma and customer-friendly service.

With the loan of S/2200.00 that she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy green bananas in large volumes in order to supply her customers in her region and beyond.

Simith is 37 years old and she really cares for her two children. In order to provide a better future for them, she would like to develop her business and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Simith F. R. , socia del Banco Comunal “Sarita colonia ”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , distrito de Juanjui, domiciliada en el Jr: Eduardo Peña Nº 756, de donde distribuye los plátanos verdes en racimos a sus clientes, que sancochado es el plato principal en todos los hogares de la selva del PERU.

Su hermana es quien la incentivó a realizar este tipo de negocio la cual le pareció más rentable ya que antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropas, que por la buena calidad de sus productos vende sin problemas con su carisma y buen trato que da al cliente.

Con el préstamo de S/.2200.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará: plátanos verdes en racimos en gran cantidad, para abastecer a sus clientes dentro y fuera de la región.

Simith tiene 37 años y 02 hijos, por quienes se esmera en salir adelante y brindarles un futuro mejor, dentro de sus planes esta en poner un negocio mas grande y construir su casa.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business

loans.name: Orlando Cornelio

texts.es:
Orlando has been a tailor for 17 years. He began his business as a laborer in the Trajes Gómez tailor shop. He lives in the Omar Truillo neighborhood, is 52 years old, married, and has 6 children who work. With the loan he will buy more fabrics to offer his customers and thereby continue working with his family so they will have everything they need in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Orlando es sastre con 17 años de experiencia, su negocio lo inicio a través de que laboraba en un taller de costura Trajes Gómez. El habita en el barrio Omar Trujillo tiene 52 años de edad es casado le tienen 6 hijos que trabajan. Con el préstamo Su objetivo es comprar mas materia prima para ofertar más a sus clientes y así seguir trabajando con su familia para que falte nada en su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Berlita

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertila Tuamama S. belongs to the Communal Bank “Sarita Colonia” and lives in the San Martín area of Mariscal Cáceres province in Juanjui district. Her business is located in Jr. Eduardo Peña Meza, where she makes wooden crates to ship fruits and vegetables to other parts of the state and country. She also sells fruits from the region.

Thanks to the support of her husband and daughters and the her own great effort she has been able to grow her business, earning the appreciation and gaining a large clientele.

With the S/.1000.00 loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy wood, glue and nails to make crates as well as various fruits from the region like: oranges, cocona fruit by the hundred, kilos of sapote, bunches of bananas, sacks of fresh and dried coconut, papayas.

Bertila is 47 years old, she works daily demonstrating that she is a hard-working woman and that to accomplish her goals, there aren’t any limits and she can achieve her goals with effort and dedication, so in thinking of her future she is thinking about opening a juice stand in her home and she wants to be a wholesale crate maker.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Señora Bertila Tuamama S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Eduardo Peña Meza, se dedica a la fabricación de cajas de madera para el envío de frutas y verduras a otras partes del departamento y del país. También se dedica a la venta de frutas de la región.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijas y al esfuerzo propio ha logrado incrementar su negocio, habiendo ganado el aprecio y la acogida de una gran clientela.

Con el crédito de S/.1000.00,el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará madera para la fabricación de las cajas, clavos y pegamento, asimismo diversas frutas de la región como: naranjas, taperivas, coconas en cientos, zapotes kilos, plátanos y guineos en racimos, cocos fresco y seco en sacos , papayas todo esto en cientos.

La señora Bertila tiene 47 años, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera, que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que en el futuro piensa tener una juguería en su casa y ser mayorista de la fabricación de las cajas.

loans.use: Buy wood, nails and glue for crates as well as various fruits.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia has had her seamstress business for 6 years. She is 35 years old, married, with two beautiful children ages 16 and 13 who study in school, and her husband is a healthcare aide and he helps with the household expenses. The loan Patricia wants will be used to buy an overlock sewing machine which will allow her improve her product by using the machine to finish her work professionally, resulting in more sales and better working conditions in her shop and being able to support herself.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Patricia es una Sra. que ha logrado tener un taller de costura este negocio lo inicio hace seis años, tiene 35 años de edad, casada con 2 hermosos hijos de 16 y 13 años estudiantes, su esposo es auxiliar de enfermería y ayuda con los gastos. El préstamo lo quiere para comprar una maquina Overlock y así mejorar los acabados de los productos para lograr mas ventas y las condiciones en el taller como en su propia economía.

loans.use: buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
I am a dance instructor and I want to open my own dance school. I don’t have my own locale, I pay rent. I’m asking for a $500 loan to pay a month’s rent and make interior and exterior signs for my locale where I give dance classes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Soy instructor de baile y deseo abrir mi propia academia de baile, no cuento aun con un local propio, ya que pago renta; el crédito que solicito es de $500.00 dlls, para pagar una mensualidad de la renta y para rotular el local por dentro y por fuera en el que imparto mis clases.

loans.use: Open a dance school

loans.name: Francis Raquel

texts.es:
Francis is 34 years old, married, and lives in the Riguero neighborhood. She has a one year old son. She has had her convenience store business for 4 years. She began selling in the market then was able to relocate the business to her own home. With the loan she wants to buy more products as sometimes her sales are low because she doesn’t have enough inventory to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Francis tiene 34 años de edad casada habita en el barrio Riguero tiene un niño de un año, su negocio es una pulpería con 4 años de tenerla ella comenzó vendiendo en el mercado oriental lo cual logro ubicarlo en su propia casa el préstamo lo quiere para comprar mas inventario ya que a veces sus ventas son bajas por no tener todo lo necesario para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy products to expand her store's inventory

loans.name: Iris Beltsy

texts.es:
Iris lives in the Riguero neighborhood, is a 30 year old businesswoman, married and mother to 1 year old twins. She has been selling cosmetics such as perfumes and other items in the market for 10 years. With the loan she will invest in products to sell and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Iris reside en el barrio Riguero , es comerciante tiene 30 años de edad es casada tiene un par de gemelos de 1 año de edad el producto que distribuye al mercado es la venta de cosméticos como perfumes y encargos que le soliciten, ya son 10 años lo que tiene de vender y con el préstamo quiere invertir mas en sus ofertas y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell

loans.name: Aida Saballo

texts.es:
Aída lives in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood. She is single, 53 years old, with two married daughters. She has been an elementary school teacher for 20 years and she has been selling cosmetic products for two years. She started her cosmetic business with her own funds, with the goals of improving the structure of her home and improving her business. With the loan she is going to buy more products resulting in greater demand from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Aída vive en el barrio Carlos Fonseca, tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera, con dos hijas las cuales están casadas ya. Ella es docente de primaria tiene 20 años de dar clases pero a demás vende productos de cosmético que lleva dos años de experiencia vendiendo comenzó con fondos propios su propósito es mejorar la estructura de su casa y mejorar el negocio. Con el préstamo va a comprar más productos, y así tener mas demanda con sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase more cosmetic products

loans.name: Azia

texts.en:
Mrs Azia L. is a single woman of 30 years old. She is model designer and seamstress. She has been doing this business for over 5 years. She has her shop in Kara and 5 girls as apprentice/students learning how to sew and design women's clothes.

She is doing well with her business but she is facing huge pressure from women who want to buy more clothes but she does not have funds to buy more fabrics to sew and sell. On top of that, she is also wants to enlarge and improve her shop and recruit more apprentices who are willing to learn. That’s why she is requesting a loan of 1000 dollars to buy more fabrics and also to improve her shop. By doing so, she will be able produce more clothes, sell them, and make more profit that she can use for her family's need and to pay back her loan within 18 months

Thank you for supporting her initiative that will help other girls to learn.

loans.use: To buy more materials for  her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothes and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Tumainis Garicheni Group

texts.en:
Tumaini is 36-year-old married woman. Tumaini is a clothes seller. She started in 2006. Every day she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in charcoal and fire wood sales, a shop and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is married woman with 4 children, 10-20 years old. Sophia is a food seller. She started in 2006. Every day she works from 8am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Clisentia

texts.en:
Clisentia is a 32 year old married woman with one child. She lives with her family in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya. Her business, which she started in 2000, offers a variety of staples such as bread, rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, along with other items often used by her customers.

Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation and many years in business, coupled with a well-established clientele base ensure that her business will continue to grow. She has applied for a loan of $800 US to help her purchase additional stock of essential commodities.

loans.use: Purchase stock of basic commodties for sale

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a 54 year old entrepreneur and mother of six school-aged children. She lives with her family in Kisumu, Kenya. She began her current business of selling second-hand clothes in 2005. She specializes mainly in women’s clothing: skirts, dresses, and tops. She travels periodically to Nairobi, where she can purchase a good variety of merchandise at wholesale prices. The prime location of her business on a busy street, her many years of experience and friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a solid clientele base.

Consolata is requesting a loan of $ 800 US to expand her business, invest in a trial stock of new ready-made clothes, and increase her stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: Increase stock of used and ready-made clothes

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two grown sons. She lives in Melitopol, Ukraine and runs a small business selling groceries in the local market. Natalya has been in this trade for 15 years. She is an experienced entrepreneur with a gross income of $1600 a month and about $1200 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $400.

Natalya’s venture has benefited from Nadiya Ukraine loans. They have helped Natalya keep her business running and improve her family’s standard of living. Today Natalya is actively helping her children and grandchildren financially, which she feels is her most valuable investment. Natalya is very flexible with her clients and offers a good discount system to her retired customers. She is requesting a loan of approximately $225 US to restock her inventory and increase the groceries for sale in her kiosk.

loans.use: Restock inventory

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
As a married mother, Zhanna also manages to successfully run her own beauty salon, called “Light”, in downtown Zaporozhye, Ukraine. She started her business 3 years ago. One of the main secrets of her success is a favorable location in a college neighborhood. Many students and professors visit regularly and have become loyal clients. Zhanna loves her work. She hires all her own staff and manages the finances herself. Currently, her monthly net profit is about $500.

Zhanna would like to purchase new furniture and equipment for her beauty salon — chairs, mirrors and manicure devices that will increase the efficiency and quality of her nail care services. To this end, she is requesting a loan of approximately $525 US. With the additional profits, Zhanna plans to continue developing her business so it will provide a stable and consistent income for her family.

loans.use: To help purchase new furniture and equipment for beauty salon

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. She is married and has a 14 year old son. Natalya sells men’s and women’s knitted wear in the central city market. She has 10 years of experience working in this sphere of business. Her vending location is well equipped and clients like Natalya’s style of service and reasonable prices. Consistency in quality service has promoted her business growth, helping her to build about $1200 in turnover capital and earn about $500 in net profit every month.

Natalya wants to add some stock this spring season, so she has requested a loan of approximately $1025 US. With this additional merchandise, she hopes to generate extra profits and improve her family’s standard of living. She would especially like to buy her son a computer which he’s been longing to have for some time. Natalya proved herself credit worthy when she took her first loan with Nadiya Ukraine in 2004 . We believe her tenacity to pursue her goals will help Natalya to be successful and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Tatyana has operated a kiosk selling cosmetics at a market in Pavlograd, Ukraine. A hardworking mother and wife, Tatyana has successfully grown her business to establish a stable income for her family. With an enterprising spirit and rich experience in the sphere of market trade, she has worked hard to expand her business. Currently, Tatyana makes about $400 in profit each month and has about $3000 in inventory.

Tatyana is seeking a loan to purchase new merchandise. With the increased profits she hopes to continue expanding her business. Eventually Tatyana would like to open a new vending facility. This loan will benefit her business and family as Tatyana’s husband is physically challenged and the money Tatyana makes is the main income for the family.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna is married with two sons. She lives with her family in Zaporozhye, Ukraine. Inna sells children’s toys, table games, strollers and footwear in the Pravoberezhnyi mall. She has a nice variety of merchandise to please her customers. Inna started this business 11 years ago when entrepreneurship in Ukraine really started emerging. She operates her business with integrity and skill and is looked up to by others as an entrepreneur of authority and intelligence. Today she has about $2400 in inventory on hand and her monthly net profit is about $600.

Inna has requested a loan of approximately $525 US to purchase children’s bikes to sell in her kiosk. Additional merchandise combined with Inna’s work ethic and experience will enable her to expand her business, increase her income and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: Purchase children's bicycles

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
As you can see, my house has an unfinished wall. I would like to enlarge the front of my house for better security and to improve its look and comfort. The loan of 1000 USD that I request will be used in order to finish the construction of this wall.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Como pueden ver tengo una pared sin terminar y deseo ampliar el frente de mi casa, para tener mayor seguridad en ella, darle una mejor vista a la vivienda y así tener un buen confort. El crédito que solicito es de 1000.00 dll, para terminar su construcción.

loans.use: Enlarge the front of the house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Marcela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Marcela M. has owned a general store in the South San Rafael municipality of Managua for the past 15 years. She runs the store, which she has developed bit by bit over the years. She is a widowed mother, and is responsible for her school-age son.

Despite the difficult circumstances that Marcela has come across in her life, she has been able to come out ahead, thanks to her efforts and the support provided by Ceprodel in the form of loans. Today, she returns to the institution in order to benefit from a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise to sell in her general store.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua, la señora Marcela M. desde hace quince largos años se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería del cual es dueña y ha venido desarrollando poco a poco a través de los años. Es madre viuda y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su hijo en edad escolar.

A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que ha atravesado en la vida, ha logrado salir adelante y lo ha hecho gracias a sus esfuerzos y al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel en la entrega de créditos. Hoy en día una vez mas acude a esta institución para ser beneficiada con los créditos que le permitan la compra de su mercadería para ofertarla en su negocio de pulpería en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Francisco Arturo

texts.es:
A general store, like any other business, requires a great deal of investment as the increasing number of competitors obliges merchants to improve their sales levels. Mr. Francisco E., originally from South San Rafael, runs a general store and is conscious of this need.

Despite his long-standing difficult economic situation, Francisco has been able to bring food home to his family, which consists of his wife and three children. Today, he has come to Ceprodel in order to benefit from a loan that allows him to purchase the merchandise he needs for his general store. Francisco, his business and his family will all benefit from the loan, since he will sell the products he acquires in his store and thus generate more income.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

El negocio de pulpería como cualquier otro requiere de mucha inversión por el hecho de que hoy en día surgen mas competidores que obligan a los comerciantes a mejorar su nivel de ventas. Consciente de esta situación, el señor Francisco E. originario del municipio de San Rafael del Sur se dedica al negocio de pulpería en su localidad de habitación.

A pesar de su difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado ha logrado llevar el alimento a su casa de habitación que se compone de su esposa y tres hijos. Hoy en día el señor Francisco acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de su mercadería. Al obtener el crédito se beneficiara el mismo, su negocio y su familia ya que al adquirir los productos los comercializará en el negocio y esto hará que se generen mas ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Angela M. runs a general store out of her house in the South San Rafael municipality of Managua, the capital of beautiful Nicaragua.

Like all Nicaraguan women, she is an outstandingly hard worker--she can always be found serving customers in her store, and she has also been looking for a way to expand her business. To help her realize this goal, Ceprodel has given Angela loans to purchase merchandise. Today, she is requesting another loan to buy these products. Since the general store is her only source of income, she will greatly benefit from this loan.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Angela M. es al negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua capital de la bella Nicaragua.

Como toda mujer nicaragüense, se ha destacado en ser una gran trabajadora ya que en todo momento se encuentra atendiendo su pulpería y además ha buscado la manera de como engrandecerla. Para llevar a cabo esta tarea Ceprodel le ha apoyado con créditos para la compra de su mercadería. Hoy en día una vez mas solicita crédito debido a la necesidad de inversión para la compra de dichos productos. Es necesario destacar que por ser su único ingreso el generado por este negocio, ella es beneficiada con la entrega de este crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
For 12 years Ana Victoria has run her small grocery store. This has been the only income to support her humble household and her two small children that she loves so much.

She started her business with very few resources and products and over the years she has been able to improve her sales. Regardless, she still has many needs for her business. Ana Victoria now urgently needs to purchase merchandise and for this reason has gone to Ceprodel to take out a loan to purchase products and thus continue to fight to improve her financial situation through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La dama Ana Victoria desde hace 12 años se ha desempeñado en su pequeño negocio de pulpería, único ingreso para el sustento de su humilde casa de habitación y de sus dos pequeños hijos a los que tanto ama.

El negocio inició con pocos recursos y productos, a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo, ella ha logrado mejorar en parte sus ventas, sin embargo aun atraviesa fuertes necesidades en su negocio. Hoy en día la señora Ana Victoria posee la necesidad de la urgente compra de la mercadería y para ello acude Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le de la oportunidad de adquirir estos productos y así seguir luchando para mejorar su condición económica por medio de estos prestamos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nancy Janela

texts.es:
Nancy S. works selling various food and personal products in her own grocery store. She is located in the city of Managua in the district of San Rafael del Sur. Along with her husband she seeks a way to provide their two daughters with the means to pursue their studies.

Ceprodel has been a pillar in her business because it has enable her to take out the loans with which she has bought merchandise. She now urgently needs to acquire more merchandise and for this reason is looking for Ceprodel's support to take out a loan and thus continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la dama Nancy S. es a la venta de productos varios teniendo su propia pulpera la que atiende con diversos productos como comestibles y personales. Se ubica en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en el cual en conjunto con su esposo buscan la manera de cómo proporcionarles a sus dos hijas las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio por lo que le ha brindado los créditos que le han servido para adquirir la mercadería. La necesidad que actualmente atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir su mercadería y por ello busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener dicho crédito y de esta manera continuar con el mejoramiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Esperanza Rosa

texts.es:
Esperanza R. is a woman who works hard running her business selling food items and drinks from her home, the only line of work which allows her to survive, as she has no support as a single woman. Despite her difficult economic situation, she has always succeeded through her hard work.

Today her priority is to gain some financial support in order to purchase sweets and drinks. This is why she has turned to Ceprodel for a loan, which will enable her to purchase products and continue to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Esperanza R. es una dama que se dedica con mucho esfuerzo al negocio de la venta de comestibles y bebidas en su casa de habitación siendo este el único negocio que le permite su sustento ya que no posee el apoyo de ninguna otra persona ya que es soltera. A pesar de su difícil situación económica siempre ha logrado sobrevivir con mucho esfuerzo en su negocio.

Actualmente la necesidad atravesada por esta dama es la urgencia de adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de las golosinas y bebidas.
