Para ello acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para continuar contribuyendo al desarrollo de su negocio en su localidad.

loans.use: To buy food products for her business

loans.name: Meyling Gioconda

texts.es:
Meyling G. comes from San Rafael del Sur in Managua and has a business selling clothes from her own premises at home. She started this line of work three years ago, which has enabled her to support her young child, who is of school age.

As with all businesses, selling clothes requires a lot of investment in order toincrease sales, which is why she has turned to Ceprodel for a loan which will enable her to buy stock. With this loan, Meyling will be able to increase sales and thus continue to support and run her home which is so important to her.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Meyling G. es originaria del municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua y se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa en su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace tres años con el cual ha logrado mantener a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar.

Al igual que todo negocio, la venta de ropa requiere de mucha inversión para incrementar las ventas, por ello se refugia en Ceprodel para recibir el crédito oportuno que le permita adquirir la mercadería de su proveedores. Por medio de esta entrega se garantiza que la señora Meyling aumente sus ventas y así logre continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar que tanto necesita de ella.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Jenys Deyanira

texts.es:
Jenys Gomez is a very hard working woman, who runs a business selling cosmetics and costume jewelry from her own premises in San Rafael del Sur, in Managua.

She has a young daughter who is her main incentive for succeeding, so that she can support her studies. It must be pointed out that the business has developed thanks to the support given by Ceprodel, enabling Jenys to purchase stock. Now she is calling upon Ceprodel once again for a loan, to enable her to buy cosmetics and costume jewelry to continue in business, and thus continue supporting her daughter and her education.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Jenys Gomez es una dama muy esforzada que se ha dedicado al negocio de la venta de cosméticos y bisuterías atendido en su establecimiento propio en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

Es madre de una pequeña hija a la que proporciona los recursos para sus estudios. Es necesario destacar que el negocio lo ha venido desarrollando gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha otorgado créditos que le han sido de mucho beneficio para la adquisición de su mercadería. Hoy en día una vez mas acude a la institución para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita la compra de los cosméticos y bisutería para continuar con su labor y de esta manera seguir brindándole a su pequeña hija las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
For eight years, Carmen L. has had a beauty business, with her own beauty salon, where she works looking after her loyal customers every day, offering them the highest quality service. She has become very experienced in this field, and as a result she has secured a good client base.

It must be pointed out that Carmen is a single mother of one, and she uses the income from her business to support and raise her daughter. This is why she has turned to CEPRODEL for a loan, which will enable her to purchase the necessary products for her business and furthermore, will enable her to expand her premises so that she can offer the best service to her loyal customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Carmen L. desde hace ocho años se dedica al negocio de belleza teniendo su propio salón de belleza en el que atiende a sus fieles clientes todos los días para brindar un excelente servicio con alta calidad. SE ha destacado por ser una persona muy experimentada en el ramo de la belleza y gracias a esto ha logrado acaparar clientes para el negocio.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Carmen es soltera y con una pequeña hija que mantener por lo que para brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias debe de hacer uso de la inversión en el negocio. Para esto ha buscado el apoyo en CEPRODEL para recibir créditos que le den la oportunidad de adquirir los productos necesarios para el negocio y además para iniciar a ampliar su área física con el fin de brindar un excelente servicio a sus fieles clientes.

loans.use: T purchase materials and improve her premises

loans.name: Emilia Albertina

texts.es:
Since seven years, Mrs Emilia O. runs a grocery store from her home in the beautiful district San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Nicaragua.

Now she urgently needs to obtain a loan in order to purchase goods that she wants to commercialise in her grocery store. That is why she has requested the support of CEPRODEL. This loan will benefit her, her family and her business in general.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Emilia O. se dedica desde hace siete años al negocio de pulpería atendiendo en su local de habitación en el bello municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua Nicaragua.

Hoy en día la problemática que atraviesa la señora Emilia es la urgencia de adquirir los créditos para la adquisición de sus productos y por esto, muy sabiamente e busca el apoyo en ceprodel para recibir los créditos con el cual pueda comprar los productos necesarios para ofertarlos en su pulpería. Con este préstamo es beneficiada tanto ella como su familia y negocio en general.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Maquely

texts.es:
Mrs Maquely A. is a very hard-working lady. Since 6 years, she runs a grocery store from her home where she sells various products like food. She is a single mother with four children and she tries to provide them with everything they need.

Now, she urgently needs to purchase goods in order to commercialise them. However, she does not have the economic resources to buy them herself. That is why she requests a loan from CEPRODEL. The loan will benefit her and her household as she will be able to take care of her four children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Maquely A. es una dama muy esforzada el cual desde hace seis años se ha dedicado al negocio de la venta de productos varios tanto personales como comestibles en su propia casa de habitación donde posee una pulpería propia a la que abastece con sus productos. Es una madre soltera y con cuatro hijos a los que debe de mantener y proporcionar todas las condiciones necesarias para subsistir.

La necesidad que esta dama atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir sus productos para comercializarlos por el hecho de que no cuenta con el recurso económico que le permita llevar a cabo esta labor. Para ello acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito oportuno para la compra de los productos. Con este crédito será beneficiada ella y su humilde casa de habitación donde alberga a sus cuatro hijos.

loans.use: Grocery store

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Mrs Ana E. runs a grocery store in the district of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Nicaragua. Thanks to this business and her energy, she has succeeded in improving her economic situation.

She is the mother of two little children. Together with her husband she tries to provide them with everything they need for their development.

She now needs to buy goods in order to commercialise them. Therefore, she requested the support of CEPRODEL in order to obtain the necessary loan to purchase the merchandise she needs from her suppliers. In this way, she will be able to continue to raise her children and maintain her modest home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana E. con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su condición económica por medio de su negocio de pulpería el que atiende en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua Nicaragua.

Es madre de dos hijos pequeños el cual junto con su esposo es esfuerza para proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. La necesidad atravesada por esta dama es la urgencia de adquirir los productos para comercializarlos. Por ello busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la adquirir su mercadería de sus proveedores y así continuar con su ardua labor de mantenimiento de sus hijos y de su humilde hogar donde habita.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Pedro Ovilio

texts.es:
Mr. Pedro P. comes from the San Rafael del Sur borough in Managua. For the past 15 years, he has made a living with the fishing and sea food sales business.

He is married and has the responsibility of supporting and providing education to his little child. He has a fishing permit issued by the civilian authorities, and uses a launch that is not in good condition and is in need of repairs. For this reason he turns to Ceprodel, in order to obtain a loan that will allow him to buy the replacement parts for the boat and to continue feeding his family.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Pedro P. es originario del municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua y, desde hace quince años, se dedica al negocio de la pesca y establecimiento de venta de mariscos, el cual ha sido su negocio con el que sustenta su hogar de habitación.

Es padre casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su pequeño hijo, el cual requiere el apoyo de su padre para sus estudios. Actualmente el señor Pedro lleva a cabo su pesca previamente autorizado por las autoridades civiles y para ello hace uso de una lancha, que requiere la compra de repuestos, por estar en mal estado. Para ello acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita comprar los repuestos y así continuar con el negocio para seguir alimentando a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts for fishing boat.

loans.name: Elvis Hamilton

texts.es:
The cattle husbandry business requires great effort and sacrifice. Mr. Elvis Valeiro R. has been devoted to this activity since his young age and has his own cattle. He feeds his oxen and calves to ensure their development and growth, such that, when the time is right, he can commercialize the derived products, such as milk.

He presently needs to acquire animals for breeding. For this purpose, he turns to Ceprodel, in order to obtain a loan that will allow him to purchase the animals. The profits form this activity benefit him, his wife and three children.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la ganadería es una labor que requiere mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. El señor Elvis Valeiro R. se dedica a esta labor desde muy joven, teniendo su propio ganado. El alimenta diariamente a sus bueyes y terneros para su desarrollo y crecimiento y de esta manera cuando se da el momento, se aprovechan sus productos derivados como la leche, para su comercialización.

Actualmente la necesidad que este caballero debe de suplir es la compra de ganado para la crianza. Por esta razón acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los animales para proceder con su crianza y comercialización. Por medio de esta labor se beneficia tanto él, su esposa y tres hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle.

loans.name: Auxiliadora Del Carm

texts.es:
For the past 12 years, Auxiliadora L. has been running a grocery store, where she serves her clients with great kindness. The store is located at her home in the San Rafael del Sur borough in Managua. She is a single mother, in charge of her little child. She makes great efforts to provide her son with adequate living conditions.

Her present need is to buy merchandise to sell, such as grains and food products. For this reason she turns to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow her to continue improving her business and supporting her child, for whom she acts as mother and father at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Auxiliadora L. desde hace doce años se dedica a la labor de la pulpería, teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación y atendiendo muy amablemente a todos sus clientes, en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua. Es madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su pequeña hijo. Por este motivo es que sus esfuerzos son muy grandes para lograr brindarle a su hijo todas las condiciones necesarias para vivir

La necesidad de la señora Auxiliadora hoy en día es la compra de los productos tales como granos básicos y comestibles para comercializarlos. Para ello acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de estos productos con el propósito de continuar con el desarrollo de su negocio para así brindarle las mejores condiciones a su hijo ya que ella realiza el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Ms. Maria Gutierrez puts great effort in running her grocery store, located at her home in the San Rafael del Sur borough in Managua. It’s important to point out she is a single mother with four children to whom she has to provide adequate living conditions.

She currently needs to stock her store. In order to do this, she is turning to Ceprodel for a loan, in order to buy merchandise to offer to her clients and improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Gutierrez se dedica al negocio de la pulpería, el cual atiende muy esforzadamente en su localidad de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua. Es necesario destacar que ella es madre soltera y con cuatro hijos que mantener y brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para subsistir.

La necesidad que hoy en día atravieza esta dama es la adquisición de la mercadería para ofertarla a sus clientes. Por ello acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan la compra de sus productos, para así comercializarlos en su negocio y de esta manera contribuir al mejoramiento de situación económica.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
For Isabel, it all started when she was very Young. She was selling candies in the Central Market in Lima for a while until she decided to become independent. She decided to open up a candy store alone, becoming an unofficial distributor of many candy companies. When she had enough money saved up, she opened up a small store in her home, 18 years ago. Bit by bit, thanks to her and her husband’s efforts, she has been able to sign an agreement with a big candy company so that she is an exclusive distributor of their brand of candy and snacks. Now she has been working for them for 15 years and the business keeps growing.

Isabel and her husbad have 2 kids who are 19 and 12 years old. They both work hard to keep progressing and find new markets in which to sell their products. The shop that they have is a sign of the great effort that they have put in since they decided to start this business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Para Isabel todo empezó cuando aun era muy joven. Estuvo vendiendo dulces al por mayor en el mercado central de Lima durante una temporada hasta que decidió independizarse. Sola se animo a ofrecer de bodega en bodega golosinas, cumpliendo el papel de distribuidora no oficial de las empresas de golosinas. Una vez que tuvo ahorrado un dinero abrió una tienda de dulces en su casa hace dieciocho. Poco a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su esposo, ha podido conseguir un acuerdo con una empresa de golosinas para ser los distribuidores exclusivos de una marca de dulces y snacks. Hoy ya tienen quince años trabajando como distribuidores y continúan creciendo. Isabel y su esposo son padres de dos hijos que tienen diecinueve y doce años de edad. Ambos trabajan arduamente para seguir progresando y para cada vez encontrar mas mercados donde distribuir sus productos. La tienda que tienen es una muestra de su gran esfuerzo desde que decidieron ingresar a este negocio.

loans.use: To enlarge her sweetshop/Ampliar su tienda de golosinas

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys has been selling food in the market over the past four years. Before that, she dedicated all of her time to her home and children.

When she separated from her husband, she felt the need to find a job. She tells us that she inmediately thought of selling food, as cooking is one of her favorite activities. She began by renting a restaurant in the local market and purchased the basic elements to start the business.

Over the past four years she has managed her business to ensure that it keeps growing, even during hard times. She wants to continue in the restaurant business but not in the market. Her objective is to open a soda fountain shop with the support of her eldest daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: To improve her restaurant by adding furniture and electrical appliances

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
As Adela´s family grew, she felt the need to have her own job as her husband´s income was insufficient to support the family.

She decided to rent a stall in the market near her home to begin selling clothes. The business only lasted four years as there was little demand for her products and a lot of competition. This downturn motivated her to think of another type of business. She closed her market stall, and opened a grocery store at home. Working at home made it easier for her as she was able to take care of her young children as well.

Adela currently has six children, more than enough reasons for her and her husband to coninue working harder and harder. Her plans are to finish constructing her store and to purchase more stock.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: To complete the construction of her home and purchase more stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Before becoming an entrepeneur, Adelaida worked during four years selling personal hygiene products in an itenerant market stall. Eleven years ago she began to manage the pharmacy.

Her husband is a registered nurse who decided to open a small pharmacy. According to Adelaida, her husband´s clients would visit his office at home and requested the prescriptions be sold in the same location. As time passed, the pharmacy grew along with her husband´s patients. Eventually, they decided that she would take care of the pharmacy which allowed her husband to take on a second job as a teacher in a local school.

In the future, Adelaida wants to expand her pharmacy by adding non-pharmaceutical products.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: To expand her pharmacy by adding non-pharmaceutical products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Tohirman

texts.id:
Tohirman, who lives in Gatot Subroto street has a profession as used tire rubber sales. He and his wife daily buy used tires that could not be used any more, then cut into pieces using special equipment. The cut rubber is then rolled, and every 3 or 4 days brought to building or furniture stores who are already their customers. Sometimes the buyers also directly picked up in their house. Those cut rubber are usually used as string for sofa, furniture, springbed, etc. Tohirman hopes this loan could be used to add capital to buy used tires. Expected profit will be used to pay for family expenses, and schooling for their two children: Lilik and Milatun.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Tohirman, yang bertempat tinggal di Jl.Gatot Subroto berprofesi sebagai penjual karet ban bekas. Dia bersama istrinya sehari-hari membeli ban bekas yang sudah tidak layak pakai kemudian dipotong-potong menggunakan alat khusus. Karet yang sudah dalam bentuk potongan kemudian digulung dan setiap 3 atau 4 hari sekali dibawa ke toko bangunan atau mebel yang sudah menjadi langganannya. Kadang juga pihak pembeli yang datang mengambil langsung dirumahnya. Potongan karet ini biasanya dipakai sebagai tali untuk kursi sofa, mebel, springbed, dan lain sebagainya. Tohirman berharap dari pinjaman kali ini bisa dijadikan tambahan modal usaha membeli ban-ban bekas. Keuntungan yang nantinya dia dapat bisa untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga dan menyekolahkan kedua anaknya, yaitu Lilik dan Milatun.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngô Thị Tuyến, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two children in township Lâm, Ý Yên. Before, her family used to be farmers. They did not have much land so their income was very limited. Right after joining the TYM Fund, they moved to copper casting. Working hard and learning more experience earn them a good reputation and they now have a pretty sound business. Her average monthly income is about 200-230USD. She would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to stock more copper.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Ngô Thị Tuyến, 36 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại thị trấn Lâm, ý Yên. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Do ruộng đất ít nên cuộc sống cũng khó khăn. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ, chị vay vốn đầu tư vào làm nghề đúc đồng. Nhờ chịu khó tích lũy kinh nghiệm, nâng cao tay nghề và tìm hiểu các mối tiêu thụ nên công việc ngày càng tiến triển thuận lợi. Đến nay chị Tuyến có một cở sở đúc đồng chuyên đúc đỉnh và lư hương bán cho các vùng miền trong cả nước. Thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình từ 200-230USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm đồng, tăng số lượng sản phẩm làm ra.

loans.use: Buy copper for casting

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi X.. 52 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1998. Her family has 3 members: herself and her 2 children. Her husband passed away from fatal disease. Her children are all grown-up: her daughter sells goods in the market, and her son just came back from military service. Before, she processed bronze at home, earning 150 USD/month. This time, since her son is helping her, Mrs. X. wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy bronze-processing machine to make more products.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Xuân, 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1998. Gia đình chị gồm 3 người, chị và 2 con, chồng chị bị bệnh đã mất từ lâu. Các con chị đều đã trưởng thành, con gái bán hàng ở chợ, con trai mới đi bộ đội về. Các năm trước chị chỉ nhận hàng đúc đồng về làm một mình ở nhà, thu nhập 150USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này, có con trai cùng tham gia, chị Xuân muốn vay vốn mua máy gia công để có thể làm được nhiều hàng hơn. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Xuân là 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy machine to process bronze

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 46 years old, joined the Fund since 1998. Her 3 grown-up children are living separately. Currently, her family has 2 parents and her 2 youngest children. Before, Mrs. T. invested the money in selling general goods in the market and also selling unhusked rice. Her income was 6-7 USD/day. Her 2 children have been helping her a great deal. This year, since the price of everything goes up, Mrs. T. decides to invest money in breeding fish. Her suggested amount of money is 950 USD and it is used to buy fish and more general goods to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thủy, 46 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1998. 3 con lớn đã có gia đình riêng, trong nhà hiện nay chỉ còn 2 vợ chồng và 2 người con cuối. Các vòng vốn trước chị Thủy đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá ở chợ và đi thu mua thóc về bán cho các đại lý, thu nhập 6-7USD/ngày. Công việc nhiều, 2 con của chị cũng tích cực hỗ trợ mẹ bán hàng. Năm nay trước tình hình giá thực phẩm tăng cao chị Thủy quyết định đầu tư thêm vào nuôi cá. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị là 950USD để mua cá giống và mua hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy fishes and goods

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi L., 31 years old, joined the Fund since 2002. Her family lives in a rural area near Day River. Since her husband works in the mine and her 2 children are still young, her family economy is very difficult. Since she had joined the Fund, Mrs. L. borrowed money to invest in the rice fields and in breeding pigs. Her average income is 120-150 USD/month. This year, she wants to borrow 375 USD to buy fishing boats, to buy more pigs and to fix the pigsty.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Lương, 31 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2002. Gia đình chị sống ở vùng quê ven sông Đáy. 2 con còn nhỏ, chồng đi làm thuê ở bãi than nên kinh tế gia đình có nhiều khó khăn. Tham gia Quỹ chị Lương vay vốn đầu tư vào làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng từ 120-150USD. Năm nay, chị Lương muốn vay vốn về mua thuyền để vợ chồng đánh cá ở sông và mua giống lợn cũng như sửa sang chuồng trại. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Lương là 375USD.

loans.use: Buy fishing boat and pigs, fix the pigsty

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi N.. 51 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1996. Her family has 2 parents and 2 grown-up children. Before, Mrs. N. used her borrowed money in breeding pigs, ducks and fishes. Her breeding plan works effectively and is expanded over time. Her husband and 2 children are of great help to her. Her family average income is 200-220 USD/month. This time, Mrs. N. wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more pigs and fishes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị N., 51 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1996. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành. Các vòng vốn trước, chị N. đầu tư chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi lợn, vịt và thả cá. Công việc làm ăn mang lại hiệu quả, quy mô dự án lớn dần theo từng vòng vốn. Chồng và 2 con là những người phụ giúp tích cực cho chị trong công việc. Thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình từ 200-220USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị N. muốn vay 1200USD để mua thêm lợn và cá giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs and fishes

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi H., 54 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 1999. Her main activities are to breed the pigs and grow pot plants while her husband and her children make gloves. Her family average income is approximately 200 USD/month. Since the beginning of this year, price for everything goes up. Therefore, Mrs. H. wants to borrow money to expand her farms. Her suggested amount of money is 575 USD. She intends to repair the pigsty, improve the farm and buy 6-7 more pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hường, 54 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1999. Công việc chủ yếu của chị Hường là chăn nuôi lợn và trồng cây cảnh còn chồng và các con chị may găng tay. Thu nhập bình quân của cả gia đình trên dưới 200USD/tháng. Sang năm nay, giá cả hàng hóa đắt đỏ, chị Hường mong muốn được vay thêm vốn mở rộng đầu tư tăng thu nhập. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Hường là 575USD. Dự định của chị là sẽ sửa sang lại chuồng trại và mua 6-7 con lợn giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs and improve farm

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu P. is 35 years old living in Siem Reap province. She is a farmer providing for her family with the rice and vegetables she grows in small fields by her house. The leftover crop makes her 1 US$ per day on average. Her husband, Kung Samnang, is 36 years old and a construction foreman. He brings in the majority of the family income at 5 US$ per day.

They have had five children already, however, all of them are young and the family is not yet prepared to send them to school. As time goes on, they will allow them one by one to be educated, depending on the family’s financial situation. As her husband is the primary bread winner for their household, she wants to provide a motorbike for him to get from job to job around the city. If he can help manage a greater number of construction projects, then their income will rise, possibly allowing them to send their children to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng B. K. is 35 years old making a decent living as a carpenter in the city of Siem Reap. He has worked there since 1999 becoming more and more skilled at his trade. He can now make 6 US$ per day with his carpentry business. His wife works for a weaving business, weaving cloth for traditional Khmer clothing. She earns 5 US$ each day. They have three young children living in the family home, along with her younger sister who is dependent on them.

He wants to facilitate his sister in law being able to work and add to the family income as well as obtain personal transportation to and from work for him and his wife. He wants to invest in a motorbike to provide for these needs. His wife is pictured here outside their home as he was unavailable when our loan officers visited. The motorbike in the picture belongs to a loan officer, not the family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang L. is a housewife living in Kampong Cham. She cares for a household of five including her husband, their two children, and her elderly father. Her husband, Thai Deng, buys recyclable items from people at their home and then sells these to local factories that will put them to use. He has developed this low income business surprisingly well to the point where he can make 5 US$ per day depending on how many items he is able to secure. Their children are all too young to attend school.

She wants to take out a loan specifically to help her husband increase his business by buying a greater quantity of recyclable items. They can stockpile these to sell to support their family in months when his business has not been as profitable as it usually is.

loans.use: To buy recyclable items in bulk.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S. is 40 years of age. She is something of a middleman between vegetable farmers and the market vendors that sell off the crops. She purchases the vegetables in bulk from the best farmers to sell to whichever vendors offer the highest price for her high quality goods. This has the capability of being a lucrative business.

She currently earns about 38 US$ per month. Her husband shares her business and brings in another 38 US$ per month on his part. On this income, they support a family of four including their young child and her younger sister.

Seng S. wants to expand her business by adding both eggs and dried fish to the list of food items she can resell to the markets. These items are more expensive, but with her extensive experience dealing with market resale she should be able turn a large profit through this expansion.

loans.use: To buy dried fish and eggs.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem O. is 43 years old. Her husband’s name is Sam Kreng (pictured here in their home as Yem O. was unavailable to be photographed). He is 42 years old. The two of them run a business in the remote province of Prey Veng, renting out music equipment like stereos, microphones, soundboards, and other such devices. Their combined income through this business is 3.20 US$ per day. They have five children, with four still unmarried and living in the family home. Three of their children are construction workers, each earning 150 US$ per month. This significantly adds to the family income and is important because the parent’s business is mostly seasonal.

Between the months of January and May is the harvest season as well as when several other key Khmer holidays occur. In preparation for this high time of parties and karaoke, a beloved Khmer pastime, Yem O. would like to invest in newer equipment to expand her inventory and hopefully draw in more business this year.

loans.use: To buy speakers and stereo equipment.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin N. is a 51 years old. She earns about $5 a day from selling groceries. N. lives with four children in Svay At Village, Pursat Province. Her husband, Mr. Hem Vann, is 53 years old. Vann earns about $5 per day being a motor taxi driver and pig breeder.

N. requests a loan of $500 to buy grocery stocks. The remainder of the loan is to buy small pigs to raise. This loan helps increase their overall income and improve the living condition of the family.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock for the business, and the remainder of the loan is to buy small pigs to raise.

payments.comment:
Chin Nat's business is going very well. She decided to pay off the remainder of the loan early in order to take out another loan. 

The next loan she requests with Kiva will allow her to purchase additional grocery inventory so that she can further expand her grocery-selling business. She also plans to use the loan to raise pigs to sell for additional income.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam S. is 35 years of age. Since she got married in 1995 she has been a farmer in Kampong Cham. The farm earns her 3 US$ per day. Chen Kosal, her husband, is a construction worker making 2 US$ per day. They have four children who are all still dependent and living in the family home. The older ones help their mother farm whenever they get the chance.

Cambodians raise water buffalo, which are much larger than cows or even oxen, to use in plowing their fields and occasionally to pull carts to transport goods. To be a farmer and not be in possession of one of these animals is a serious disadvantage. Sam S. would like to be able to buy her own water buffalo. This will save her family valuable time and money. They are pictured here in front of a neighbor's house who deals in such livestock.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo for plowing.

loans.name: Pram

texts.en: Pram S. is 44 years old. She makes her living making and selling Khmer style noodles to be used in soups and served with various traditional dishes. Since 2003, she has been running this business from a store in front of her home. Her husband also has a unique trade. Roth Mon Hean is 46 years old and runs a business selling palm sugar from house to house. Palm sugar is derived from a special breed of palm tree specific to Cambodia known as the sugar palm. The raw sap is used to produce both palm sugar and, when fermented, is made into palm wine. Together, their combined income is 9 US$ per day. Two of their four children also contribute to the family income by working at a golf course at a nearby resort. Pram S. would like to invest in her husband’s business by buying palm sugar in bulk for him to sell.

loans.use: To buy palm sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Thị Mai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Mai (MS: 06030006), 48 years old, is an active woman. She and her husband together they tend a herd of water buffalo, a vegetable garden, sell its product and farm a small patch of rice paddy. They have two school age children. She is applying for a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her ducks. Her G. has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Lưu Văn Bắc (MS: 06030007), 33 years old, applies for a loan to invest in egg laying hens.
  • Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt (MS: 06030008), 40 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her đi chợ.
  • Lưu Thị Lan (MS: 06030009), 24 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her đi chợ.
  • Kiều Thị Hồng (MS: 06030010), 41 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her đi chợ and egg laying hens.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Mai (MS: 06030006), năm nay 48 tuổi, chị là người rất năng động trong việc phát triển kinh tế gia đình, chị chăn nuôi châu, trồng rau bán hàng ngày và làm ruộng, chồng chị cùng tham gia vào công việc chăn nuôi và trồng trọt của chị, chị có hai con hiện đang đi học. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho đàn vịt đẻ. Chị rất thích tham gia vào chương trình. Anh Lưu Văn Bắc (MS: 06030007), năm nay 33 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để nuôi cám nuôi gà lấy trứng. Chị Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt (MS: 06030008), năm nay 40 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua hoa quả, rau và bỏng ngô đi chợ bán. Chị Lưu Thị Lan (MS: 06030009), năm nay 24 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán hoa quả, bỏng ngô. Chị Kiều Thị Hồng (MS: 06030010), năm nay 41 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để đi chợ bán rau quả và chăn nuôi gà.

loans.use: Invest in businesses

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong N. is 49 years old. She makes traditional Cambodian desserts and then sells these from a stand in a local market. She also occasionally hires herself out as a wedding cook. Her business does quite well in a crowded tourist city like Siem Reap, and she makes 10 US$ per day on average. Her husband works in the historic Angkor Thom complex at Taprum temple as a temple guard. These ancient Hindu and Buddhist temples once comprised the capital city of the old Khmer empire. Now, hundreds of thousands of tourists flock to Siem Reap, Cambodia each year to tour these ancient architectural wonders. He makes only 35 US$ per month as a guard, however.

Duong N. has six children, all of whom work in the tourist industry if they are not going to school. The oldest daughter helps her mother run her market stand. The other children all work selling souvenir products to tourists around the temples. This could promise to be a large and secure source of income for their family if they do well. Duong N. wants to buy a stock of souvenir products and handicrafts for her children to sell to tourists year round.

loans.use: To purchase souvenir products.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Mr. Hin H. is a 52-year-old farmer and makes about $2 per day. His wife, Mrs. Suth Soth, 46, makes about $2 per day weaving baskets. They live with their two children in Khvean Village, Siem Reap Province. H. requests a loan of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to go to work to help reduce family expenses. (The Photo is of H.'s wife. )

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to go to work and help to reduce family expenses.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon N., 45, lives in Tuol Thmor Village, Kampong Cham Province. She makes about $5 per day selling groceries from home. Her husband, Mr. Noul Chhay, is a 38-year-old farmer who makes about $2 per day. Chhay has been farming for 28 years. They live with their four children, all of whom are young students.

N. requests a loan of $1,100 to purchase grocery stock to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock to sustain and develop her business.

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en: Mrs. Chhum S. sells cosmetics near her home and makes about $4 per day. She lives with one child in Tuol Chambork Village, Kampong Cham Province. S. requests a loan of $300 to purchase cosmetics to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sustain and develop her business.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mr. Yun B. is a horse trailer taxi driver and makes about $5 per day. His wife, Mrs. Um Phat, is a farmer and makes about $2 per day. They live with their six children in Tuol Thmar Village, Kampong Cham Province. Three of their children work as grass cutters for a private farm.

They request a loan of $1,100 to purchase a horse and trailer to develop their business. This loan will expand the businesses and improve their income to support their family sufficiently.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and trailer to develop their business.

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeum A., 27, is married with two little children and works weaving mats to raise her standard of living. The mat-weaving skill has been taught by her elders. Generally, whenever her outputs are done, the brokers come over and purchase her products during the day. She can make about $2 net income each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works as a construction foreman, earning around $5 per day. The income that she and her husband make basically helps to cover her daily expenses and her loan repayment. She will use the loan partly to build her house, and the rest of the money will be used to reinvest in her mat business. She feels amazed by the effect of the loan on her family.

loans.use: Partly to build her house and the rest of the money will be used to reinvest in her mat business.

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeum A., 27, is married with two little children and works weaving mats to raise her standard of living. A mat-weaving skill has been left and taught by her ancestors. Generally, whenever her outputs are done, the brokers come over and purchase during the day. She can make about $2 each day of net income. Her husband, meanwhile, works as a construction foreman, earning around $5 per day. With the incomes that she and her husband make are basically help to cover her daily expense and her loan repayment. Recently, this couple has taken out a loan to build partly of her house and the rest of the money will be used to reinvest in her mat business. She feels amazed with the loan on her family.

loans.use: to build partly of her house and the rest of the money will be used to reinvest in her mat business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo L. is 26 years old. She lives with her husband Pin Han in Chrey Choeung Village, Siem Reap Province. L. earns about $10 per day from selling clothes and sewing. Han is a 28-year-old who earns $4 a day breeding pigs. They request a loan of $1,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. This loan will help expand their business and increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell for the business.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Mrs. Khat N., 31, works making Khmer wine (made from steamy rice) and sells it for a profit. With her business activity, she can make about $2 per day of income. Her husband works driving a motor-taxi to transport passengers from place to place, earning about $5 per day of income.

She has three little children who are too young to attend school. Her husband finds recently that if he can have a trailer to attach to his motor-bike, he will be able to not only transport passenger but to also transport goods for the market vendors from place to place, which can generate further income for his household. Mrs.Khat N. and her husband would like to take out this loan to purchase a trailer to use to expand their business. ( Her husband is pictured with his motor-bike because Mrs. Khat N. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to expand a business.

loans.name: Raqia

texts.en:
Raqia lives with her own family in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She was married and is the mother of 3 children but she is a widow now since her husband died during the war in Kabul. She is a tailor, and she has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. She supports her family.

Raqia has requested an individual loan to complete materials necessary for her business so that she can make a good monthly income and help her family. She is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete materials needed for her business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Đào, 38 years old, joined TYM fund in 2001. Her husband is a farmer. They have 2 school aged children. Initially, she used her loans for raising pigs and buying fertilizer for her field. Her income was about 100 USD a month. When she was able to get bigger loans, she started investing in charcoal sales. Today her charcoal business is established, serving the people in the region. Her income has increased to 200 USD a month. Her business has picked up, she has been able to buy material things that her family needs. She has also bought a truck to transport the charcoal. She is requesting a new loan of 1200 USD so that she would be able to expand her business / increase her sales.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Đào, 38 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2001. Chị sống cùng chồng, một nông dân, và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Các vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn về chăn nuôi lợn và mua phân bón làm ruộng, thu nhập hàng tháng khoảng 100USD. Khi bắt đầu được vay những mức vốn lớn chị Đào đầu tư vào buôn bán than. Đến nay chị Thủy đã có một bãi bán than phục vụ nhân dân trong vùng. Mức thu nhập hiện nay 200USD/tháng. Công việc kinh doanh phát triển, chị Đào đã mua được ôtô để chuyên chở, các vật dụng sinh hoạt trong gia đình cũng được sắm sửa thêm nhiều. Với mong muốn mở rộng quy mô kinh doanh, tăng lượng than bán ra, vòng vốn này chị Đào tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy coal

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Dương Thị Hằng is 36. She is a TYM fund member since 2001. She is married and has 3 children aged netween 3 and 12. With the loans from TYM, she invested in charcoal sales and construction material supply (lime). She has built brick ovens in her yard to make the lime. The material to make lime is stone which is transported by boat from Ninh Bình. The charcoal is bought and transported by boat from Quảng Ninh. Since there are a lot of construction projects in the region, all the lime production gets sold out all the time. Her income is about 300 USD a month. She is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to buy charcoal and stones.

Translated from Vietnamese by KH. Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Hằng, 36 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2001. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 con từ 2 đến 12 tuổi. Tham gia vào Quỹ, chị Hằng có điều kiện để đầu tư buôn bán than và vật liệu xây dựng. Tận dụng diện tích rộng chị Hằng xây dựng lò đốt vôi liên hoàn. Nguyên liệu dùng đốt vôi là đá được vận chuyển bằng đường sông từ Ninh Bình về. Bên cạnh đó than cũng được chuyển về theo đường sông từ Quảng Ninh. Hiện nay những công trình xây dựng của tư nhân trong vùng rất nhiều nên vôi của gia đình chị đốt xong đều bán hết. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Hằng khoảng 300USD. Vòng vốn này chị Hằng tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua đá và than.

loans.use: Buy charcoal and stone

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị T., 48 years old, joined TYM fund in 1999. Her family is composed of 4 members: she, her husband and their 2 children. In the beginning, she used her savings plus the loan from TYM to buy machinery to husk rice. Her income has increased, the family living condition has improved a lot. After a while, she has opened a metal shop making iron doors, even boat parts. They are very busy with the work, their 2 children help out also. Despite the busy schedule, she makes time for herself to participate in her group activities. Her family income is 180-200 USD a month. She is seeking a loan of 625 USD to buy iron.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 48 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1999. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành. Thời gian đầu, với nguồn vốn tự có kết hợp với vốn vay của Quỹ, chị T. đầu tư vào mua máy xát gạo phục vụ nhân trong xã. Thu nhập tăng lên, đời sống gia đình được cải thiện rõ rệt. Sau một thời gian, chị đã mở thêm cửa hàng sắt với hoạt động chủ yếu là mua sắt về làm cửa sắt và gò hàn các vật dụng khác như thuyền chở lúa, ... Công việc bận rộn, chồng và 2 con đều hỗ trợ chị rất tích cực trong công việc cũng như tạo điều kiện cho chị tham gia các hoạt động của Quỹ. Mức thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình chị T. khoảng 180-200USD. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị xin vay 625USD để mua sắt làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy iron

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Tuyết, 38 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1999. She lives with her husband and three children, aged from 10 to 15. At the beginning, she took out small loans to invest in raising few domestic pigs and some poultry. Gradually she changes course to raising breeding pigs. She produces 50 to 70 pigs a year, that earns her an average of 200USD a month. Feed for pigs is a biggest burden. She would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to buy more feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Tuyết, 38 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1999. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 con từ 10 đến 15 tuổi. Các vòng vốn đầu, chị Tuyết vay vốn đầu tư cho việc chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Sau một thời gian, chị chuyển sang tập trung chủ yếu vào chăn nuôi lợn sinh sản và lợn giống. Mỗi năm chị Tuyết xuất chuồng khoảng 50 đến 70 con lợn, thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng khoảng 200USD. Một trong những khó khăn của chị Tuyết là chi phí cho thức ăn cần rất lớn. Chị Tuyết hiện đang rất muốn vay 950USD để mua thức ăn gia súc không phải mua chịu.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 3 and 2 years old. Mwajuma sells fish. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 2 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Ngọc, 43 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2000. At that time her family farmed a small rice paddy and raised few poultry. She took out loans to invest in raising domestic pigs. Gradually she gets a nice pig farm that outputs 4 times a year, each time from 10 to 20 pigs. Her average income is 200USD a month. She would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to buy feed and piglets. She lives with her husband and two children in Yên Cường, huyện Y Yên.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc, 43 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2000. Kinh tế gia đình khi đó chủ yếu là làm ruộng, hoạt động chăn nuôi chỉ nhỏ lẻ do thiếu vốn. Sau khi được vay vốn, chị Ngọc tập trung vào chăn nuôi lợn. Qua các năm tham gia, chị đã mở rộng chuồng trại và mỗi năm cho xuất chuồng từ 4 lứa lợn, mỗi lứa từ 10 đên 20 con. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Ngọc khoảng 200USD. Hiện nay giá thực phẩm trên thị trường đang tăng, chị muốn vay thêm 1200USD để mua lợn con và thức ăn gia súc. Chị Ngọc đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại xã Yên Cường, huyện ý Yên.

loans.use: Buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuch M. is 29 years old and lives in Thnot Tret Village, Pursat Province. M. sells fish and earns about $2.83 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chhan Chhat, is 34 years old. He sells toys and balloons, earning about $2.16 per day. They have five children, two of whom attend school.

They seek a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for family use, and with the remainder of the loan she wants to further expand her business. This loan helps expand her business and improve the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and to further expand her business.

loans.name: Noorullah

texts.en:
Noorullah, the son of N. M., lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan.
He is 19 years old and he couldn’t continue his studying because of  economic problems. Therefore he decided to start a small business so he wants to take out an individual loan  to buy some materials for metal working.
He hopes that through this business he will improve conditions and support his family and solve their financial  problems.

loans.use: To buy materials for a metal-working shop

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom K. is a farmer who lives in Ortong Village, Pursat Province. K. earns around $3 per day from the pig-breeding business, and her husband earns about $2 per day from farming. They live with two children, one is a policeman and the other is a truck driver for a private entrepreneur.

Their childrens' income helps support the family’s expenses. They seek a $1000 loan to purchase small pigs, and the remainder of the loan can be used to repair the pigpen and purchase equipments for the pig-raising business.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs for her business, and with the remainder of the loan, she wants to repair her pigpen and purchase equipment for the pig-raising business.

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 30 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 2 years old. Mwanahamis sells maize. Every day, she works from 9am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more maize for her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Zainabu's Usagara Mueza Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is 40 years old and is a married woman with1 child, age 7 years old. Zainabu sells fish. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 3am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing in tailoring, charcoal sales and vegetables sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business,

loans.name: Farida's Azimio Group

texts.en:
Farida is a married woman with 3 children, ages 20, 17 and 10 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 10 and 17 years old. Farida is a clothes seller, she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 19pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $220 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Aisha, Emmy and Mariam, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 10 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 10 and 15 years old. Fatuma sells clothes. She started in 2003. Every day, she works from 3am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15, 10 and 7 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 15, 10 and 7 years old. Zaina sells clothes. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 3am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This is Ahmad, son of M. Y.. He is 20 years old and he is the owner of an internet club. He lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan right now.

Ahmad wants to improve his business so he decided to buy some computers and other necessary materials for his club. For that reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1050 from AFSG.

loans.use: To buy some computers

loans.name: Zaharia

texts.en:
Zaharia is 20 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. Zaharia owns a small clothes shop. Every day, she works from 9am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her shop

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 30 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15, 10 and 5 years old. Amina sell clothes. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rahma's Kopa Ulipe Group

texts.en:
Rahma is 31 years old and is married. Rahma sells clothes. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaisha, Saana, Mwanahawa and Mwanaid, who sell clothes, charcoal and firewood.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Halima's Kopa Ulipe Group

texts.en:
Halima is 35 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 1-13 years old. Halima sells charcoal. She started in 2001. Every day, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling food, stationery and fish.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Vat

texts.en:
Mrs. Vat L. is a widow who lives in Thnal Chapon Village, Pursat Province. L. earns about $3 per day from her noodle-making business. She lives with five children, so her responsibilities are high. One of her children helps to make money by transporting pieces of wood to sell for another noodle maker.

L. is seeking a loan of $800 to purchase rice stocks to make noodles, and the remainder of the loan is to purchase small pigs to breed. This loan helps to expand and develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice stocks to make noodles, and the remainder of the loan is to purchase small pigs to breed.

loans.name: Chieng Kem Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chieng K. is 45 and lives in Banh Chhkol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is group leader of four women, and is a soup pot seller in the local village. She is single with two children; both of them are pot makers and make the pots their mother sells to make an income. This business is very profitable and can help them to improve their living conditions.

Last year, Mrs. Chieng K. had access to a loan to buy land for building a house. At that time, she did not have enough money to both buy the land and build the house. Through her business activity, she managed to save some money to build her house. Unfortunately, this is still not enough to finish the house, thus she asks for a new loan to finish it.

loans.use: To build her house.
